description: Great, great, classic dive bar! Cool place to catch a show on a early Saturday evening.
author: Nic S.

description:
Good venue near Bart. Location not too sketchy, but hard to find from Google Maps! The sign was kind-of low and not where my friend or I expected it to be. 

Cozy, intimate, well-decorated, this is a great place for a Tinder date or a girls' night out. They also have a clean bathroom (only one stall.)

Service could be better, however. A bartender skipped over my friend who wanted a drink (maybe because she looks younger than 21?) and was not helpful. It was like he didn't care about her service!

May be back just for the venue.
author: Lizzie S.

description: Don't ever go here unless you want to be falsely accused for not paying for your drinks and have one of the bar tenders cuss you out. One of the most unprofessionally ran venues I've ever seen. Let me also say I'm a concierge at four seasons hotels and resorts. I'll be sure to tell my counter parts in the area to keep their guests far away from this place!
author: Ben L.

description:
First of all, this place has a FANTASTIC name, and I'm lonely as hell (hello) so that's really saying something. Second of all, people really were making out here and I arrived fairly early, around 9 pm on a Saturday. Congratulations to all of you folks out there getting that lip.

Anyway, I loved the atmosphere here and all of the attention to detail when it comes to decor, right down to the dresser onstage that serves as a turn table for whoever is in charge of music for the evening. The alcohol is pretty fairly priced here as well, though it is CASH ONLY which stresses me out a little bit, but that's no one's issue but my own. If you're in the area, definitely check this place out, because it's definitely unique.

Thanks, bye!!!!!
author: Anna K.

description:
Make Out Room has a fun atmosphere! Its a great spot to grab beer, dance or hang out and see one of their many events.
I came here specifically to see a stand up comedy, One Night Stand. 

I think when there is an event you def have to pay for tickets. My friend got me tickets ahead of time incase they sell out.

The event was lively and even audience volunteered to share their One Night Stand stories. 

I really enjoyed their decorations. A fun disco ball hanging from a top shined on people in the room. Sparkly confetti was hanging everywhere too. It really did remind me of 90s dance house. As a kid thats how i used to decorate my room or house whenever you were having a sleepover and wanted to dance. It def brought out a fun inner child out of me. Part of Make Out Room is reserved seating, so there is a lot of standing around because seating is limited.
author: Galya T.

description:
In a world where businesses come and go everyday, Make-Out Room feels like one of the fewer SF institutions hanging on. It was probably one of the first bars I visited after moving to SF several years ago and going there now it still feels basically the same (which is a good thing!)

My favorite part of the bar is just the overall feel and look. From the decorations hanging from the ceiling to the seating along the wall, to the small dj area on the stage, it's welcoming and uniquely its own. 

Speaking of the dj area, I also appreciate the many weekday happy hour sets playing indiepop, britpop, glam, 60s, etc. Weekdays are already the best time to go here as weekends are insanely crowded (plight of the Mission), but the awesome dj sets make it even more worth while. Archive Fever, Cool as F**k, and Rock and Roll Workshop are all worth checking out. 

As for the drinks, I'm a beer person, and while I wouldn't say the selection is out of this world, the variety is decent and there's usually a couple very drinkable choices available. The one major downside, though, is that they only do cash. I get that there are a variety of reasons why a bar might go this route (and this does seem to be a thing for some of the older places in SF), but I don't ever carry cash so I have to go out of my way to get some out before going to MOR. Would absolutely end up spending more if I wasn't capped by however much I took out of the cash machine. 

Nonetheless, glad that there are still places in SF like Make-out Room, and hope their doors will stay open for many years to come.
author: Jon T.

description: Very eclectic crowd, soulful music with an old school feel to it. Pretty lively on a Thursday night. Cash only but there are ATMs right next to it. Good vibe after only a short time inside. Cheap drinks, about 20% less than what I am used to paying since arriving in San Fransisco.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Make Out Room is a hidden gem in SF's nightlife scene. If you like dancing and people who still DJ with vinyl, this is the spot for you! They have great underground DJs every night of the week, but if you aren't sure when to go I would recommend going on a night when Chulita Vinyl Club plays (one Thursday / month) and that way you won't go wrong with the music selection. 

The atmosphere is very non-pretentious and so so so fun - there is even a disco ball! They play music you won't here at other clubs / bars and the decor is very unique. The drink prices are about the same as other places in the area ($6-10), and most nights they don't have a cover charge. 

Check this place out!
author: M P.

description:
Pros: The bald candor of the staff is breathtaking.
Cons: If you leave something behind, they keep it and have a good laugh.
author: Miles D.

description: Make-Out Room has the best atmosphere and shows , which will make you forget about the daily routine. My favorite thing about it is the hanging decorations from the ceiling, which makes this place so unique and original. I usually go there to listen to indiepop, cause they play it differently from all other places I have been to. I am glad, that there are still places like Make-Out Room in this city.
author: Anna C.

description:
Appropriately named spot haha. This place is great for dancing! Arrived at 11:30 on a Saturday to a line which moved pretty quickly. Inside they were playing some great dancing music including a lot of the popular Latin songs of this year. 

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but the bartenders killed that. Besides the classic understaffed nature of trying to get a drink at a crowded bar, the bartender was short and rude with us and then proceeded to ignore us for a while.  Didn't ruin us having an awesome time but it was a bit unprofessional.
author: Alex S.

description:
So first impressions of this place were great, really nice atmosphere and setting, live music and cool dance floor. But unfortunately 3 factors ruined the evening for me 

1) The older looking bar man heard my non American accent and shouted down my ear about tipping when I had barely received my change back

2) They don't allow straws in drinks... First time I've heard this rule

3) One girls toilet, surely for the size of the venue that should be illegal
author: Holly M.

description:
I feel like at the end of the night, we're somehow always here or around this place.

Things to know: Cash only bar, sometimes here is a $10 cover to get in on busy nights. Loud, small club/bar environment, you will not be having any deep conversations here. Think dance dive bar. Think grimy, dark, with dusty decorations hanging from the ceiling. Think cheap drinks. Think running into the owner as your arm is around some girl you've just met, shaking his hand and admiring his beard, as you compliment him on how dope his bar is. Think thinking to yourself that you won't drink anymore, and then having your drunkass friends handing you another redbull vodka and toasting to all the best times in life. Think drinking that last drink and knowing that you're blasted, and watching your friend pass out on the couch.

Drinks are good - the dive bar drinks that is. Moscow Mule/Old Fashioned-esque drinks, not the Local Edition bougie drinks that you may be used to. if you're looking for a low key ratchet night (you ain't down to run into your boy's ex at bootie), then swing by here. Just pick up some benjamins from the bank before you step inside.
author: Albert C.

description:
The Makeout Room is a fun bar. There's music and a dance floor. A beer will cost you between $6-$8. It definitely is a fun environment. Make sure to bring cash because it is cash only. 
The crowd at the makeout room is a mix of ages and people.
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is the only place out of the bars my girlfriend and I went to where they could make a midori sour perfectly

Ambience was chill and relaxing

yay
author: Nick O.

description: It's 2018. Time to stop avoiding paying taxes and accept more than cash like every other modern business. Pretty fucking annoying to pay $10 at the door to find out you the have to pay everything in cash and wait in another line and pay another fee to get the cash
author: John S.

description: Friday nights became boogie nights :c  this place was known for latino music and now this :c
author: Luis C.

description:
Cool place and environment; but had this terrible experience with the bartender, this 50 y.o. dude with beard and glasses. 
Yelled at me and treated me disrespectfully in front of my friends. So rude! 
I've been working in the US for the last 5 months and I've never seen anything slightly similar happening to me or with other people. Shame on you, dude!
author: Henrique G.

description:
Dear Make Out Room Bartender,

That was the worst margarita I've ever had. It was also the most expensive margarita I've ever had ($18?!? Wow). What a terrible combo. 

Love the DJs though. Cool crowd. Too bad the bar can't quite measure up.

Sincerely,
A former customer
author: Skye C.

description: I came here on a Saturday night for the first time and had a blast. If you are looking for a place to dance, the Make Out Room is one of the best places to check out in the mission. Although there is a cover, and this is a turn off, I still had a blast and recommend for anyone to come here with friends that are looking to dance the night away
author: Ross S.

description: This is such a fun place! Thanks to them and their wonderful staff, my Christmas as a 'Christmas Orphan' was saved. So nice of them to work on the holiday and provide such a great time. I loved the holiday decorations, and the drink options were fancy. The music was upbeat and loud, and the patrons were a fun crowd. The only downside would be that they only have one bathroom stall for ladies, and there can be a wait.
author: Shu J.

description: Awesome music and dancing! Really lively with lots of people. Great place to let loose, for sure. Cant comment on the drinks or bar service as I was already pretty lit when we arrived, haha.
author: Lissette C.

description: We'd never been here just for drinks before -- the place is often used for events so that's why I've gone in the past. They have a list of mules that seem to be a house specialty -- I went for the one with bourbon this time. Bartender was friendly, fast, and talented. We'll be back.
author: Teresa D.

description:
OMG!!!

i came here with a friend to help them feel more comfy in her new lifestyle, before i knew it i was dancing and shaking my arse. before the night was over i had been completely turned around on female on female action. my pussy was dripping with excitment as 2 girls led me into the toilets, which by the way are fantastic, and made me feel things i didn't know i could. ill be back for more every chance i can. 
to all the nervous girls out there, don't be afraid and i'll be waiting in the toilets for you.
author: Jordana G.

description:
Ambiance: We got there at 10 and the crowd was mostly older Caucasians, but as the night went on, it became more diverse in age and race. The place has a divey bar vibe and has a space in the middle to dance.

Drinks were $7-12.

Music: We came here looking for some Latin music. The DJ played mostly cumbia and one old merengue. He also played some salsa which I did not recognize. If you're looking for east coast Latin music, this is not the place for you, but I was happy to see what my Latinos in the west coast are into. I can't say many of the people there dance well but then again as long as you're having fun, who cares, right?

My friends were not feeling it and wanted to leave but it was an interesting experience.
author: Rosemary V.

description: It's a big time hipster hangout and for those who've actually been going to clubs in the city for decades, don't be surprised that there's decent music being played by really good DJs. After all, hipsters DO have decent taste in music and actually try to expose the rest of the uninitiated to it and do a good job of it. And for the most part, hipsters don't bother me. Entitled, over-privileged folks who can't wait in line to use the bathroom and go ahead and cut do. Bartenders who consistently judge you on the way you dress do. I wear snap backs with 'ethnic' writing on it and a hoodie...so what? Get over yourself and let me be proud of my heritage. Skipping me over in favor of those who 'appear' to have a fatter wallet protruding from jeans so tight they move robotically is extremely annoying. And it's why I refuse to come back here until I see a change behind the bar. Don't be afraid of us who are proud of our heritage or at the very least, respect us. Maybe I'll even leave a tip next time, asshole.
author: Chris C.

description: Different kind of bar, did have a $5 cover. Liked the music and the atmosphere there. Decorations reminded me of a New Years party.
author: Lolita M.

description:
Went here for Slow Jams on a Tuesday night. Fantastic selection of music that you rarely hear out and about. Dance floor eventually got pretty fun.

My two complaints are that:
* The Slow Jam vibe started too late... I understand if the DJ doesn't want to start their set at the advertised time, but could the bartender get us in the mood with a playlist from the genre we came here for?
* The bass was turned up so high it sounded pretty bad until I got enough whiskey in me not to care. I was expecting a weeknight Slow Jam night to be a little mellower, but the muddled sound system made it hard to converse and hard to appreciate the quality of the musical selections.

I'd still go back, though.
author: le-sacre s.

description:
If only Yelp had an option for zero stars...this place tops my list for the worst spot in San Francisco. 

Here's to "quality" service and an immaculate environment. 

1. Friends and I popped in at 10:30pm on a Friday night. Right when we entered, we were rushed to pull our ID's out to show the doormen (**note** there was absolutely no line). 

2. Ordered 1 vodka tonic and 1 ginger whiskey. Then a friend popped in and added another one of each to the order. The female bartender's response "what else?" Me "that's all for us." Her, "Okay good, don't waste my time and make me add another drink to your order!" 

3. My friend was pulling out cash at the atm as the drinks were being made. The bartender scolded us and said "WHY THE F!CK DONT YOU HAVE CASH READY?!" 

4. Our friend returned with cash and we handed her $20 for the 4 drinks. Of course, at this point, there is absolutely no reason to reward her for her stalwartly service, so no tip was given. 

5. Another scolding "NEVER F!CKING COME BACK HERE AGAIN!!!" 

6. The decor is painfully tacky and the place is filthy.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
EVENT: it's 9:30pm... it's after dinner.. we walked around... trying to find a place to sit and drink... and do some chatting... we had great parking already and didn't want to move. LOL!

We thought this place had an interesting name... make-out room? haha... that's something to try...

DRINKS - $4, $6 bucks! I guess not so bad..

Seating... interesting - wheely chairs and tiny round tables...

Music - some salsa, so old school music = love it!!!

Love the VIBE! Totally cool! Will come back again!
author: Mindy Y.

description: I get to the bar and they have no Red Bull's no sex on the beach and no don Julio smh your playing Latin music in here hello!. I ask bartenders for a manager no manager is available I ask security security tells me the same thing but with an attitude seriously waste of money  I would've never came in here and yes it's my first time. Rude security and rude  bartenders . I'll def take my money somewhere else
author: Eve G.

description: In my eyes, this is essentially a perfect bar. Drinks in the front, party in the back. Cheap boozy drinks and a stage with some live music. Feels like heaven.
author: Leo I.

description: The Make-Out Room is my favorite bar in San Francisco's Mission District. I guest DJ once in awhile for Festival '68, and the sound is good, the night well-attended, and the vibe is just great. This bar hosts other great music nights and happy hours too, such as Rock and Roll Workshop. Good music, friendly and knowledgable bartenders, and no cover charge make this spot a great choice any night of the week. I really like the bar decor too...velvet paintings, chandeliers, and red walls provide an intimate, vintage atmosphere.
author: Nina C.

description:
I have only been here twice and they have both been on Saturday nights. Apparently those nights are Latin night which is my favorite so you know I was into it. There was no line to get in, even tho it was around 11pm. There is a charge of $10, cash only. 

The first time I came here it was totally spontaneous. My friends and I wanted a place to drink so we just went in. We had no idea it turned into a dancing space. I enjoyed it so much that 2 weekends later I was back with my friend and my guy. The age range varies, there were people who are probably in their 30s, late 20s. Both times I've came I believe my group and I have probably been the youngest ones there (we're in our early 20s) but that did not matter. 

To me it seems as if there's not a lot of dirty dancing here, like grinding. My friends and I were probably the ones that we're getting a little too wild, but honestly everyone enjoys it. We're all just trying to have a good time.

The only thing that was kind of annoying was someone threw a beer can up in the air and it hit me on my head and spilled on the girl next to me. I'm the type to be very passive so I let it go, but if I would of been kind of tipsy I would of gone off on them. 

Even with that I'd still recommend it if you're in the mood to dance to some reggeaton, Cumbia and just Latin music with a mix of Hip Hop.
author: Mayra A.

description:
Pretty much a typical divey venue in my book, with the added ambience of live acts on various nights. When there isn't something live going on, the music can vary greatly. The crowd also varies greatly too. 

Not much I can say besides a divey atmosphere, a large space conducive to dancing when the music allows, and fairly reasonable prices on a decent array of drink choices.
author: Vincent L.

description: The make-out room is a fabulous place to see a spoken word show, except when inconsiderate aholes stand directly in front of the booth seating. The last show I went to had said aholes, but the event was otherwise lovely. Get there early to get a seat. Drinks are reasonable-ish for the mission. $8 for a beer and a shot. Didn't die from using the bathroom. Friendly locals.
author: Kaia V.

description:
Poor customer service and some rude interactions with staff have left a bad taste in my mouth. 

On the way in, the bouncer--who was supposedly checking IDs without looking at them--very rudely yelled at those waiting to get in to not block the sidewalk. I understand the need to keep the sidewalk clear. But his tone and aggression were unpleasant and unnecessary. As a first time visitor I was very put off. 

Also, if you want the line to be orderly then buy a flipping velvet rope to indicate where the line should be. Don't be cheap. 

THEN the same bouncer later came to aggressively inform me that I could not sit on the stool as I was sitting on it. Again, it was the tone and aggression. He could have said the same thing nicely as I had just given $5 cover to get into the place.

THEN I told the manager (bar tender) about what happened. He said "point taken."  What he didn't do was apologize for his employee/co-worker, offer any kind of empathy, or hope that I had a good time. Very poor customer service. 

The decor is cool (esp the things hanging from the ceiling). The music was also cool and my girls are having a great time dancing as I write this review on a Saturday night. That is why this place got 2 stars instead of 0. 

Very diverse and mixed crowd though. A little bit of everyone in here.  Girls dressed to kill and dudes who haven't showered and aren't wearing deodorant. Everyone!
author: Rachael T.

description:
I come here regularly with my husband. WE Absolutely love DJ Kool Kyle's mix of music. He is the absolute best! It may not be the fanciest place in town, but it sure does harvest the perfect environment to have some good ol' fun. 

My only complaints are the air quality inside and the bartenders. After 10:30pm it becomes a sauna inside. It is so cool that it gets crowded but I think there should be a better system to get some ventilation up by the stage/dance floor. After two songs of dancing, you can bet you are sweating bullets!

It's cool that drinks are decently priced...but some of the bartenders behave like they hate being there. Wait times for drinks are also really long. The dark haired female bartender has a bit of an attitude. I always try leaving a few extra bucks tip to kinda cheer her up but she just grabs it and tosses it aggressively into their tip bucket. 

I would definitely recommend saturday nights to any latin dancing fans. It rocks here guys, seriously.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
This place is cool if your going to see a specific band or performer. Upon entrance at the door they charged an exorbitant $12 cover charge and only took cash at their bar. 

The spot feels like your typical mission dive bar, but with a stage and a little dance floor that was made by clearing out the chairs. 

Go for a band you follow, or if you like the mission hipster grunge scene then this place is for you for dam show. 

Cons: they packed this place pretty full, which was surprising because the cover was so much money! Also beers ranged from 6-8$ which isn't bad but considering the cover, you end up having to spend a lot of you want to drink at all.
author: Albert E.

description: Great eclectic divey atmosphere with good and plentiful portioned cocktails and interesting live DJs puts the Make-Out Room on my list of great bars in SF.
author: Steven B.

description:
Love this bar! Diamond in the rough. Not a fan of comedy nights, but love the music shows!
The bartenders rock- but they are not joking around.

Know what you want, and have cash in hand, and fuckin tip AT LEAST a dollar or two a drink- just proper bar etiquette... DUH!

Sometimes the crowed sucks, but that's just because San Francisco is being taken over by brainless, soul sucking, DOUCHEBAGS :(

Shoutout to that cute blonde girl, Sarah- you make the best DRANKS!!!
author: Jane D.

description: Okay so I came to this place on Cinco de Mayo because on Facebook, it said they were going to play salsa, dance, pop, etc. at this place and they were playing 70-80's hits. On top of it they don't have straws! What kind of bar doesn't have straws for their drinks! Seriously? That's like a bar not having ice. When we asked the bar tender if there were straws available she rudely said no. And on top of THAT the bouncers were rude and were rushing us to pay them and show them our ID's. Facebook said it was $5 cover charge before 11pm and hey tried charging us $10 because "it's Cinco de Mayo" one said, and it was 10:45pm. I will never come here again. The music sucked and so did the atmoaphere.
author: Dayna H.

description: Dancing good, music good. The bartenders and bouncer have attitudes. All the drinks taste and look the same
author: Andrew S.

description:
I was explicitly told that only staff could dance on the stage--which has a sign that says "dance on the stage at your own risk." And then I proceeded to watch three women dance on the same stage without comment--one of whom was in line with me to get in, so I know she doesn't work there. I don't support sexist establishments; especially during SF Pride.

I won't be back. Since they charge a $15 covfefe #sexism
author: Trent D.

description: This place is crazy crowded for a Tuesday night at 11pm. Had no idea. After a terrific dinner and old co worker and I werent quite ready to head home yet so we got a drink here. Kentucky Mule and Mezcal to cap the night. Luckily we caught a booth but it was decently full and people were working the dance floor. the people are all over the place and it's interesting people watching for sure. Otherwise It's a decent bar with a kooky charm
author: Kim N.

description:
The Make-Out Room is one of the few original bars left in SF.  And when I say original, I'm not only referring to the fact that it's been an anchor business in the neighborhood since the mid-90's, but also that it continues to host a range of local talent - authors, bands and DJs - that have been a part of the community for some time.

And with the closing of other local watering holes like the Attic, Pop's and Jack's, it increasingly serves as somewhat of a refuge for otherwise displaced artists, writers and creative types that don't necessarily have the income or inclination to frequent some of the city's newer, pricier, and more boutique establishments aimed at a very different, and more recently transplanted, audience.

That said, you can catch some of the city's best up-and-coming bands during one of their frequent happy hour shows, and some of the city's best DJs on choice weeknights.  Not to be missed are the Tuesday night Slow Jams party with Primo and Lucky (San Francisco's best oldies DJs), the Thursday night Web of Sound party with Jackie Sugarlumps (San Francisco's best 60's garage DJ) and the Friday night 2000's party Last Nite (some of San Francisco's best indie DJs.)

Go for the happy hour, stay for the show.  Leave a nice review as well.  We don't have many real places left and this is one of them.
author: James G.

description: They never answer their phone. Trying to reach them about a lost jacket at coat check and no answer, everrr. However, this place was super fun and you will find your jacket the next day.
author: Emaly T.

description: Violent and hostile stuff. I'm an intelligent person and try to avoid conflicts at all costs. Look at this Barbary hitting people is a felony in United States of America FYI!!! Bouncers just hit me again for asking their names pictures are attached. PS I have bruces and going to press charges. Barman tempered with my phone and erased important messages it's synced to the cloud and a proof hes been usinf my phone without authorisation.
author: Paul J.

description: I've come here for two events. One was "Writers with Drinks" and the other was "It's a Jewish Christmas". The venue is not very big and the booths are always taken by the time an event gets cracking, so get there really early to get a booth or bar stool if you want to sit otherwise you'll stand. I enjoyed the events I went to here. It's in the Mission off Valencia.
author: Denise C.

description: Fun vibe, relatively cheap mules, aaaaand a disco ball. Wasn't too packed on a Friday night, which was refreshing--and the music was obscure but dance-y enough that everyone seemed to be having fun. Cash only and $10 cover, but good times!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Came to this place last Saturday night and I have to say,  I was actually pleased. From the outside, it doesn't look like much (just like most places in SF) but the cheap drinks and great salsa mix kept me there for longer than I expected. 

My party and I came around 11 and left by 1:30. The dance floor wasn't as big but it drew a large crowd in. There was no line when we came but as we came out for fresh air throughout the night, the line outside to get in was getting longer and longer. 

The only complaint I have was that it felt so suffocating while dancing. I felt no type of circulation in that place at all. Can't say much for the bathrooms since I didn't use it but it seemed pretty inconvenient that the men's bathroom door was right across from the bar and every time someone came out a whiff of bathroom stench would wafer out to whoever was standing near it. 

4 stars for cheap drinks, good music, and interesting choice of decoration.
author: Cathy N.

description:
Cool space. Horrible Service!! They only take cash, really?? With a $3.50 charge at ATM. C'mon, get with the times. 

Tatted up, dark haired bartender a total B with a bad attitude. Went there with some friends last night to celebrate. First round... ordered 2 drinks, gave her a $20 she gave me back ones. Left $2 tip on bar, walked away.

Second round of drinks, bartender ignoring us, then finally comes over after my friend flags her down. Starts yelling at us... accusing me of not leaving her a tip that and I left my ATM receipt on the bar for her to clean up. Wanted to know if the ATM receipt was supposed to be her tip. Being completely ridiculous. 

Totally ruined the night, my friends and I will NEVER be back.
author: Karen P.

description: In a rough part of the mission with an interesting hipster feel. If you get a good live band it us the place to be.
author: Zoe C.

description: Came here on a Friday night, and I won't go back. Only one stall in the women's restroom (awful) and the bartender and Djs were rude. I asked the bartender for an amf and his response was "we don't make those here this ain't no fuckin college fraternity sorority bar" then my friend had asked a staff memeber standing behind the bar (assumed it's a bartender) if he could put a napkin over another friends drink because he couldn't reach it and his response was "I'm a dj not a fuckin bartender". The drinks are cheap. The music was all 80s all night.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I've got to hand it to Jessica T. She's absolutely right that Make-Out Room is all about the right bands on the right nights.

From the outside, it looks pretty dumpy, like the kind of place where you would absolutely not have a good time. Of couse, sometimes the best dive bars can turn out to be amazing, but this place just looks dead, particularly if you're showing up earlier.

But a friend's band was playing, so we ventured in. Warm, welcoming, not too busy, tinsel and lights dangling from the ceiling, good drinks... The sound was OK, although the red light was a bit much (a photographer's bane), and we had a good time dancing during the show and hanging out after.

I think I also tried watermelon beer here for the first time, in a can no less. Win.
author: Natalye R.

description:
Mixed feelings about this place.

Major creepers dancing and lurking around, but it's more funny than creepy.  I hate paying covers, but I've been wanting to check out Make-Out Room for the longest time.  Drinks are cheap, and if you want to dance you stage, no one's stopping you.  I came here at the end of the night, so maybe my judgment wasn't quite on point, but I had a decent time because the music was fun.

One of my favourite things about Make-Out Room is that it's not super dim... aka you can see everyone's face ;)  So don't come ugly.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The bartender treated me like I was stupid because I asked about one of the sour beers on the menu, then ignored me. Sorry if I want to know about the selections on your menu.
author: Galen P.

description: Rude staff. I didn't have enough cash for tip, told the bartender I would come back with more cash. The bartender ignored me when i returned from the atm. He tried to lecture me about Bernie Sanders, and he refused to take my next order.. Wtf?
author: Rishabh S.

description:
OK Make-Out Room  - I see your charm now.

I get it.

If you catch the right band here on the right night - the Make-Out Room is quite endearing.

My friend's two bands played here last week -and unlike past visits they filled up the space with epic sound. There wasn't a slew of people in the space - and I was away from the narrow entrance - so I was able to slide around on the dance floor without bothersome bar chatter. 

There was no line for the bathroom and there was a plethora of chairs to camp out on.

The Make-Out room would never be a destination spot for me personally - but if I knew there would be some great music - and that the space wouldn't be too crowded - I would definitely cruise on over again  - with my dance moves in tow.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The DJ sucked!!! He couldn't stick with one good beat and song. Total shitty DJ on 5/28/16.
The place was pretty cool but overly crowded so couldn't dance without getting hit or hitting someone. I would check it out before heading to a better spot.
author: Jessie J.

description: CASH ONLY.  which is so stupid.  What is this 1991?!  System kept overloading and cutting out.  Cover to get in, coal check price, over priced drinks and again,  cash only.  I guessing their owner owns the atm.  Dancing was good small ass bathrooms.
author: N. A.

description:
Music is great, bartenders, not so much. Can we please add either "hustle" or more bartenders? I was getting beers faster at the coat check than at the bar. I am not exagerating ...for real. These guys were going 20 mph at at the Autobahn. Did I forget to mention this is a cash only place? I understand cash only, but slow service? 
I'm top of that, my friend was sitting at the bar waiting for me, these girls next to her asked  to get a drink and waited 25 minutes. So, my friend vas vocal, asked who was servicing this area of the bar and the bar back ended up getting shots for the girl. Then the bartender came and told the bar back to charge the girls $10 EXTRA.  He then proceeded to tell everyone at the bar that my friend should never be serviced again.
 I had to leave the place, go to the bar next door to get a drink and then come back. I'll have a better party at my local bar, hire a dj and  tell girls is 2 x 1 drinks than at this place.
author: J H.

description: I went in there to have a couple of drinks in there with my Friends and the rude bartender said because I didn't tip him on the first shot he wasn't going to take my order, what kind off customers service is that? Completely unacceptable!
author: Michael H.

description:
Two starts seems a little harsh, on the surface... but "I've experienced better" really does encapsulate my experience here.  I'd go back if someone else was making the plans but probably not on my own.

We went on a Friday night, $10 cover... Not the best start to the evening but I could shake it off with my sweet dance moves!  And the music was great, a mix of funk and latin-- definitely something anyone can get into!

And anyone and everyone did just that-- the clientele was really mixed in terms of age, style, drug of choice... Which makes for fun people-watching and actually made the night really great!

But what made the night so "meh" was the line for the bar and the quality of drinks!  I ordered a Moscow Mule and got back a highball of vodka and water with a wedge of lime in it.  It was so undrinkable, I was going to just put it down and say goodbye to my $8 + tip, but my fiance insisted on getting it remade, or getting something else entirely.  He asked the bartender who made it what she could do, and she threw up her hands and walked away.  The other bartender working asked what it was supposed to be, and when my fiance told him, he looked at him like he was crazy.  He brought out a new kind of glass entirely, mixed my terrible drink with some more ginger ale and lime juice, and handed it back.

Meh. I've experienced better customer service for sure.  And better volume control on the music!
author: Allison M.

description: Friends and I went here. Thought the place had an awesome vibe and good music but nearing the end of the night a tall black man who worked there was harassing customers to the point of trying to fight people. He for no reason tried to kick my friend that was behind him courteously bussing his glasses and then persisted to spray bleach in my friends face. When my friend got incredibly angry with obvious reason the bartenders kicked him out and tried to explain why they had to keep that person working with the company because he's been there for so long. The bartender even admitted that he was very unstable but was basically allowing such behavior. If I had an establishment and someone working there that threatened customers, I'd fire them immediately.  This was definitely the strangest occurrence of unprofessionalism I've witnessed yet.
author: Shayna S.

description:
After visiting The Make-Out room several times, it is definitely one of the night clubs I like to visit frequently. As a woman, you somewhat worry when you go to a night club because of weird men out there. My first time at a night club (which shall remain nameless) was terrible because there were men who tried to grab me, insisted in dancing with me even after I clearly said "No, thank you" I never have to worry about any of that at the Make-Out room. Every time I've been there, I've never had any issues with creepy men who won't take "no" for an answer.  I typically like to dance solo. No issues leaving my small bag by the water station while I dance.

The whole place is somewhat small, but it doesn't get too packed often, but when it does, you can still dance and not be trampled over by other people.  

Salsa nights on Saturdays are my favorite times to go because I don't really know how to dance to "American" pop music, but play Salsa or Merengue, and I will dance for hours. I think its a $5 cover charge before 11.
author: Sophia G.

description: Nice little, divey, stop-over joint in the Mission.  The decor is fun, and the drinks are cheap!
author: Mark B.

description: I love this place for Cumbia Saturdays. The djs spin pretty good music during their sets. In general, people that come here don't really know how to dance Cumbia so I take friends that are dancers and we get down. Majority of men that show up are white or Latin. The floor is so sticky and dirty here so don't wear super nice heels because they'll get dirty. Cumbia nights get really packed so don't layer clothes. It gets really hot in there. Only one stall for the female bathroom so it'll be a wait for sure. Drinks are decently priced and as usual ask for the alcohol you want by name. There is a coat check for cheap. Entry on Saturday nights for Cumbia is $5 before 11, $10 after.
author: Ms. F.

description:
I usually love the Make Out Room, but I'm usually there for the bands & burlesque and not the drinks. The bartenders/service there is god awful, though (and looking at the reviews, people tend to agree).

There was a dollar left on the bar before we got there, and we ordered drinks and paid the bartender. She then came back and yelled at us for leaving her just a dollar before we even had the chance to tip her (you know, with the change she would have to give us first)

When I corrected her, asked for our change, and tipped her (you know, now that we have change) she just shrugged, said "fair enough" and grabbed the money. Not so much as a sorry. 

PS: The drinks were horrible
author: Helen Z.

description:
"I like this place" that's what I said a couple of different times while sitting in the Make Out Room. Odd name aside this is actually a great little bar with a dance floor. It's not really a night club but given the size of it, that is a good thing. They don't try to do too much with their location which I appreciate. 

Located in the Mission this place can get lost in the outskirts of it much more popular brethren but the fact that it isn't too packed can be a good thing. The place oddly enough is more of a salsa joint than a dance club though they do have different theme nights. 

What I loved about this place is that people actually danced here. One of the few places in the city that I have actually seen that happen without provocation. The women that were there were attractive and genuinely wanted to try out their salsa moves with each other or the guys that were there. I came with a date so I didn't get to experience this myself but my date and I danced for a while without ever bumping into other couples and had a great time. There are some Salsa pros who seem to take advantage of the fact that there are so many women looking to dance and they lurk the dance floor looking for partners. But its not a creepy way much like the old country dance clubs I used to go to in Texas the guys here actually have skills on the dance floor and if you don't you will be bumped out pretty quickly. 

We made it there before the line and cover charge started but it doesn't seem to expensive. The bar is one the left as you enter and is pretty long and easy access to the bartenders who seemed super nice. They have some great classic drink combinations which I appreciate but this is the mission so if you aren't eccentric and old school you probably aren't getting business. The dance floor is actually pretty large and located in the back of the establishment. The DJ booth is located up on a stage above the dance floor with seating around the dance floor if you are tired and want to watch others get down. 

Be warned there are some really good people there so if you get embarrassed easily don't go out there. They will be swinging each other and spinning in circles you could even imagine. 

I did make out in the make out room but I did it because i wanted to say I had. I can't attest to the likely hood that you will make out with someone when attending this place but when drinks are around that is always a possibility.
author: Nick R.

description:
Went out last night for a DJ spin...good times...OK general prices to be expected. Looks like a prom inside...but I think that's what they are going for. 
There was a live reggae band before the spin, could hear them all over the bar. 
Small spot, clean bathroom. Nice bartenders, pretty quick even when it was PACKED.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
So this is almost on the verge of being a dive bar, but it's not--Its just old and has a very unique decor to it-- kind of like being at a prom with sparkles and disco balls hanging from the ceiling. We came for 80s night, and out of the four nights a month that they have 80s, we caught the one night it was 70s/80s combined. 
The DJs were playing all the good hits and were willing to take almost any request (as long as they had the track.) 
My friend and I arrived around maybe 9 or so, and the place was crowded. We got the dance floor going between the two of us and then everyone was dancing. The music was right, the decor was a trip, and the drinks tasted fine to me (not too strong, but not too light either.) We started our "80s night adventure" here and actually wound up coming back here at the end of the night as well, because they were playing the best throwbacks out of all our other stops!
author: Cassandra E.

description: Dude.... So bad. Just so bad! Someone told us this place played a lot of reggaeton and hip hop, but apparently this person has no idea what the fuck those two terms mean. This place just played straight up techno mariachi and electronic Peruvian flute music??? It seemed like they were playing what white people thought Latin dance music was. Not a good time and definitely not worth the $10 cover.
author: Claudia M.

description: I would suggest the margaritas!!!.. go for it.. The issue I had was by the booths, apparently someone got sick and it was slippery/bad odor and staff members didn't do anything about.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Great place to have a good night!
It's one of my favorite night places in San Francisco. Every time I've been there music is cool and drinks are strong enough.
author: Sebastian K.

description: What's up with the lame ass bartenders? Dude said I need to tip him after serving one drink otherwise, fuck this place. Don't even bother coming here. Nothing is great about the place, not the music, not the atmosphere, everyone dances so awkwardly, it's pathetic to be honest, and remember, if you want more than 1 fucking drink get ready to pay more tips than the actual drink.
author: Gordon B.

description:
I like this place. I like the events I've been to here. (Write Club? Super fun!) And genuinely, this would be a much higher rating... but. What. The. Flarg? You don't have straws or stirrers or swizzle sticks anymore. Seriously? This essentially means I stir my drink with my finger. Or a pen. It also means that you - a bar - don't really understand how alcohol interacts with ice. Or how humans interact with alcohol. So yeah. Two stars. 

And a warning to all comers to bring their own stirrers.
author: Joy C.

description:
This review is only for the music/dancing part based on one night. Night of black friday, I had just arrived in San Francisco for the first time, no real plans, found myself in the Mission area. Had some ok Mexican food a couple of blocks away and was walking around just exploring. Walked past the Make-out room, heard some loud music coming from the inside, and decided to check it out.

Apparently, I made it just in time as they had a $5 cover later in the night. Holiday weekend, not too crowded, got a seat at the end of the bar closest to the stage where a DJ was spinning some 60s/70s music. I loved the way the place looks inside, it was just bright enough. The crowd when I entered was a bit hipstery, I didn't fit in the way I was dressed. Some people did dress up to the theme, the music was great and there were a few cute girls dancing.

Gradually got crowded later into the night, it's a good mix now, I struck up conversations with some really chill locals. I was doing just fine people watching, but the music was just too good to sit there. After my Mexican dinner settled down a bit, got a drink and joined the merrymaking. What a fun time! All in all I had a great night, and now I need to find a place that has 60s dance parties in Philly!
author: Siva J.

description:
This is possibly/probably one of my most disliked places in SF (besides something like Bootie SF). I went here on a Saturday night and the music was very odd.

It's just not a fun place and they charge a $5 cover for no reason. PASS!!!
author: Carleen W.

description:
Is there anyone who doesn't like making out? Those monsters are well-advised to steer clear of this niche of nighttime necking. The Make-Out Room is a sexy, sexy dive where you can slide-in (sans cover) and slow dance to soulful tunes on a dance floor big enough for a Civil War re-enactment.

Their stage seems well-suited for live music (though I have yet to experience this) and their bar is well-suited for stirring proper cocktails. In fact, it's worth underscoring that is a spot for cheap drinks, made strong.

Only word of warning: Saturday night. The sexy, sexy vibe evaporates under the harsh conditions of fake world music and dudes trying to teach hipster lasses how to salsa. You'll be kissing your dignity, goodbye.

Obligatory Title Pun-cronym: Keep It Sexy, Stupid.

Menu Readability: Ain't no menus in your mouf.

Need to mention: There are a lotta events there. Check the calendar.

What this place teaches me about myself: A portmanteau of pun and acronym? Somewhere a logophile just ruined his pants.
author: Vivek S.

description:
The name is intriguing, there's a dance floor and it's in the Mission! All qualities that I thought would make this bar a shoo-in for me. Instead I had one of the least enjoyable Friday nights in a long time here.

The drinks were terrible. I'm sorry, but $7 for a disgusting Old-Fashioned just puts me in a sour mood. And then the music ... I love that there's a stage and live music and people dancing, but the tunes just were not my style. When a short man with a mullet grabbed my hand to dance, it was kinda the last straw. I booked it.

On top of that there was a $5 cover. In no world of mine should a bar of this caliber be able to charge an entrance fee. 

It does sound like Make-Out Room could be a good time when they're hosting special events (karaoke, literary gatherings and comedy shows are a regular occurrence, according to other reviews), but I'd avoid this spot on your typical Friday night.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Great place to enjoy a little salsa, merengue, bachata, and free-style. The place is a little small, but we got cozy and made it work. The staff is very nice as well!
author: Anna E.

description:
Definitely an older crowd. Major old men creeping... And women in skimpy dresses, looking for who knows what. Latino crowd, Latino music. I don't know how else to describe it, maybe it's just the night I went on. 

$5 cover on Saturday. Long line for drinks.  $8 for a cocktail, not bad.
author: Joanna H.

description: What a great place to hang out! DJ is awesome & bartenders are very nice. We will visit on other nights as well. Thank you for being the best in Mission District.
author: Tonie P.

description:
This review is specifically for New Years Eve. The fact that I am up early on Jan 1 writing this should give you an indication of how the evening went. The cover clearly went to the pilgrim party hats and a few oversized masks and not to the things that really matter on NYE like more bar staff and good DJs.
I tried several times to get a drink and was unable. We were promised a champagne toast at midnight, which also did not happen. The bar was not even the most crowded I have seen it, so no good excuse there. 
The worst part for my group was that the DJs were awful. To say they seemed like novices might indicate they had a clue at all about playing music for a crowd. They played random music cutting off one song for the next, dead air, bad song choices, etc.. They could have used Shuffle on a random iTunes to better result. Finally, there was NO COUNTDOWN TO MIDNIGHT! I hope last night was not an indication of a new and improved Make Out Room for 2015.
author: Abby S.

description:
Hummmmm.....

Interesting crowd...kinda of a weird place. Not sure. Maybe? No, yes?

UGH
author: Meredith M.

description: Place was better before they started charging a cover (which is ridiculous for this divey old dump - no one should have to pay money just to get in and listen to some no-name DJ). Just a standard bar with an old run down dance floor, offering standard bar shit. It's really just your classic overpriced mission hipster bar with nothing much to offer in terms of creativity either in their drinks or their ambiance.
author: Luis M.

description:
Monday Karaoke at this place was *amazing*... but BEWARE, several friends and I had our drinks collected by the wait staff while they were still half full.  I'll be nice and give it a mediocre star rating though, since the drinks were well made and fairly priced.

Just be sure to guard your drink!  Mine had at least a shot's worth of a cocktail left in it, and it disappeared while I was dancing. I asked the bar tender if I could get my half of a Manhattan back, and he just told me it wasn't his fault and that some jerk probably stole my drink. I told my large group of friends about this, and nearly everyone I talked to said that the same had happened to them!  There's no way some person was just hovering and stealing everyone's drinks at that rate. Come on you guys, that's terrible service. I hope management makes sure things like this don't happen anymore, because I do really like the venue.
author: Letisha K.

description:
Two pairs of  imagery couplets for you: Saturday Night. Dancey Pants.

Who would have known this place would be so crackin? People smiling, Salsa playing, hips swaying, dance dance, and some reggae/ton. If you're looking for a fun night look no further. For a cover of merely $5, you'll have a good night.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
With lights as dim as these, the red hawt walls and interior, cocktails that strong and cheap, booths that are so inviting - sometimes you just find yourself in the mood to makeout. 

Or maybe just enjoy a live band, spoken word event, a little dancing and fun with friends. I like the divey vibe and cheap cocktails all night long. 

XOXO!
author: Rebekah T.

description: Wasn't too sure what to make of this place, since it looks sketch as all hell from the outside. Then the $5 cover. Then a pretty old crowd and some music I don't usually listen to. But whatever it's dancing music and we all got down and it was loads of fun. It was like funky latin or something. There were guys CREEPING hardcore and I guess it's more obvious when the place is so small.. but makes it tots awks.
author: Vivian H.

description: I dig this place! Room to dance. Cool bartenders. Good crowd.
author: Em L.

description:
People weren't kidding. It really is HOT in there. I was wearing a backless dress and I still felt it. My friend wasn't wearing anything bulky and she had to grab a napkin to pat away some sweat!

My drink was actually more expensive than usual, despite the fact that the event description said there were special prices for the night. It was decently made, but not extraordinarily stiff to make up for it. 

The other thing I take serious issue with is the fact there's only ONE stall in the restroom, and barely any space to line up while you're waiting.

The only positives to the place were the decor, abundance of seating, and decent size for use as a music venue.
author: Cat N.

description: I can't believe they have a cover of $10. They couldn't pay me that much to come in and listen to the shit DJ and crap decor that they try to pass off as hip. This place blows.
author: Michael H.

description: Me and my shorty stopped by for "Loose Joints" one night, great crowd and everyone was dancing.  Drinks were good, so was the music. Try and make it a point to stop by whenever I'm in the city.
author: Freddy H.

description:
People make out here. A lot. At least in the back booths and on the dance floor on Tuesday nights for Slow Jams: a night of 40s, 50s, and 60s R&B on 45s. 

If I could put together a night where I want to steal away, and choose one setting, this is it: 

Adults making out like teenagers in a basement. Adults dancing like teenagers in Junior High. Disco ball. Disco glow. Insanely stiff Manhattans. The crackle of soul singers on 45s. I could literally sit here in a booth and not say a word all night and be the happiest man between Bartlett and Chattanooga. And that I did, and that I'll do, again and again.
author: Jon A.

description:
After a grueling 6+ hour drive to SF, my friend tells me to get ready in 5 min cuz the cab is coming! I quickly change, put on some makeup, and we haul ass over to Mission.

The "Make Out Room" ... sounds like an interesting place. We get there just 10 past midnight or so, and we have pay $5 cover. What? Why?? Ok, whatever, we're here, and we'd probably never find a place for $5 cover in LA.

We walk in, and we're like "whoa/wtf?/dotdotdot" This place was like decorated by someone on drugs. Don't get me wrong, it's really cool, just really overwhelming to the senses. I particularly liked the mounted stag heads all blinged out with rhinestones, peals, glass shards, etc.

After the initial shock, we gun for the bar and look to see what to get. We ordered:
- hornitas sunrise: figured this must be like a tequila sunrise. It's super syrupy and sickly sweet. 
- side car: not too strong but just bubbly enough to make it not super sweet. I definitely preferred this drink.
- coronas (in a can): LOL I read the menu which says "in a can" but my mind didn't process it, and I still expected bottles. It's all good; they still gave us little lime slices to push into the cans.

Bartenders were chill, a bit busy to tend to everyone promptly, but ok. The dance floor was small (but I guess decent for SF standards), and it was like weird-ass retro/motown/60s night. I have no idea wtf was being played, but it seemed like people were having a good time.. 

The nightlife is definitely different from LA, and I'm more of a clubbing type anyway. However, SF people seem pretty nice! Met a good amount of techies as well haha
author: Erin H.

description: I have been here a few times and think it is generally a good time. I was surprised to see that the place was still charging a $10 cover when they were about an hour from last call. While I was thinking aloud about it, the door man was quick to point out all the other places I could go. He was being such an arrogant jerk. It was odd to me that he would not even feign an apologetic stance. I was trying to convince my friend that it wasn't our best option and that he wasn't being very nice when he decided to call me a "cunt" and saying I was "banned" from entering the trashy and overpriced club. He insisted that that was an appropriate term for me even when pressed.
author: diane b.

description: I wanted to attend their Jewish event night on Christmas. Stood in line, in the cold for 45 minutes. A small group was told by and "organizer" that it was warm inside. This was to appease us. Next, the doors opened, people moved slowly. They needed to show a digital ticket, which slowed the line.... and a photo I.D., slowing the line more. As we stood in the cold. next we were informed that with the ticket the entry was $5, without it it was $10. This is contrary to their web site calendar, which stated that it was $5 for all entry before 7 PM. A classic and illegal  case of "bait and switch. NEVER AGAIN!
author: Jan N.

description:
We came to the Make-out Room on a Friday for my lil bro's birthday night on the town.  The music (DJ) is different than what I'm used to in SoCal - wasn't catchy IMO, but seemed to get people dancing.  This is by no means an upscale bar, but it was decently happening.  Still, I have to agree with Sarah S. - there's something missing here and I didn't find it hard to leave the joint.  Maybe it's just not my scene.    
The Make-out Room is cool, but not a place I'd like to be making out. 
 
P.S. Bathroom is gross; it's apparent that ladies hover regularly because the floor was VERY wet.  Hint: if you've only got one stall, there needs to be more frequent cleaning.  Soap would be good.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I had a LARGE make out room margarita. The bartender told me they mean "business" with these huge puppies; the only thing is that I'm certain my blood alcohol wasnt affected at all by this monster mix. The venue is cool and I dunno, I just love this place just because of what it's theme is, where it is, and the diversity of what goes on in here.
author: Kevin F.

description: I give it 3.5 stars.  I went on a Friday night and there was a DJ, the DJ was playing music that was fun to dance to.  The drinks were good, the crowd was fun.  Something is  missing there, I haven't been able to put my finger on it.  It's a dance party, but it's missing the cool factor.  It's a bit cheezy....
author: Sarah S.

description:
The place is dark, dank.    Chairs are all funky.. floor has cracks.. stage is worn... drinks are cheap... did i say the drinks are cheap? CHEAP.. yup.. head on down. 

The Make-out Room is perfect for both making out and being in a room at the same time.  Its really a smallish dance club with pretty good ventilation, try to get in during free times.. Parking is going to be challenging, but do your best.  

Its a fun club to watch live or spins.
author: Tito Y.

description:
*On our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.* 

Truth be told, I haven't seen a band here, so my review is literally shit. 

Came here for a quick drink on our walk home from dinner the other night. I had a glass of Prosecco and it was tasty and cheap. Cash only. $3 well drinks during HH sounds like I may need to make a trip back asap.
author: Melissa N.

description:
The only truly important thing to say about this place is "Make out Margarita." This drink is not only tasty but it is KILLER, killer, killer, killer. I drank one of these over an hour and I was, how do I say, DRUNK. And everyone I was with got wasted off of it too. I'm convinced it has special powers.

And it kind of worked too. I wanted to make out all over my fiance. And the girl next to me was looking kind of sweet, too. Making this drink quite dangerous, but maybe dangerous in a good way. ;)

There is nothing crazily unique about this bar, but is has kind of a romantic ambiance with the candle lit booths. All I gotta say: be careful with that drink. Be careful, and by that I mean, enjoy what happens after you drink this very special life-giving amazement!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
My boyfriend performs here off and on.  I went for my first time to be his groupie.  I thought the place was really cool.  Decorations on the ceiling make me feel like New Years Eve.  

Drinks are cheap here.  Great place to just be who you are.  I did see some people kissing so that justified the name of the place.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Music is always good. bartenders and crowd is super fun. Not many hipster douchebags here that I can remember.

I really hate that they have a cover most nights. Hate it.
author: Camille R.

description:
Drinks.  Writers.  Writers with drinks.   Writing a review of writers with drinks.   Writing a review of writers with drinks with drinks.   Yay!   

I've only ever been to the Make-Out room for Writers with Drinks, which seems to happen every month, and seems to make me very happy.   I believe there might be other fun things at the Make-Out room, but I don't know for sure.   And I don't need to know, because Writers with Drinks is awesome.   I think every time I've gone I've ended up happily tipsy with my head filled with new ideas, and my Kindle filled with some new books.   

The drinks are good, the writers are good, I'll be back for more.   The bar seems like it'd be cool for other events as well, and the drinks are tasty, so yeah, I'm a fan.
author: Travis B.

description: Great place, we had a great time, the dj is soo good, not very big but the atmosphere is soo cool the only thing is there is only one bathroom, but this doesn't matter at all because every thing else is perfect, i will definitely be back again
author: Ghenwa S.

description: $10 cover and a cash only bar in the mission? You fucks should realize that other bars in the city take cash and that it is 2014 and not 1994....
author: Stephen M.

description: The atmosphere was great but the ten dollar cover was a little steep considering it was Latin night. The place was filled with creepy, ponytail wearing middle aged men. Would maybe try this place again on any other night.
author: Luis P.

description: This place has the potential to be one of the top spots in the city. The location is great, the staff is awesome and the drinks are not expensive. The only problem at the Make Out room is that is not secure at all. Around a month ago one of my friends had her bag stolen, the manager promised to make sure these incidents would not happen again in the future. We came back a few weeks later and again, the same story, this time someone else was stolen both her jacket and her bag. My friends are quite dumb, they should not leave their stuff unattended even for a minute but the truth is that we we go out to have a good time we cannot be focusing just on watching our belongings. This is a pity for a bar that not a long time ago had a great reputation.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Great for a Saturday night out dancing to cumbias, salsas, and other Latin music ! The New Years decor is pretty cool, the crowd is very mixed, and they serve Palomas (tequila w squirt). The DJ does not have very smoothe transitions but overall the music is good. 

The biggest downfall: one stall bathroom, the bouncer held onto my ID while I went in to get cash from the ATM and handed me back the wrong ID when i came back and now im stuck with someone elses ID. yeah, crazy.
author: Susana M.

description: This place is the worst!!! Their atm machine is broken and what do they do..yell at the customer. No thanks. The syrup drinks are not worth it. The worst service I have ever received in a bar.
author: Maria H.

description: My girlfriend had her wallet stolen from there last night (Sat Dec 28, 2013)... she felt something in her backpack purse...noticed the latch was undone...wallet gone. We ran outside probably 2 seconds behind the thief....told the main door guy immediately... to be honest he was a bit of a dimwit and had no helpful suggestions on what to do... he wasnt very apologetic either for filling a club full of $5 cover low lifes. Wont be going back there anytime soon. Do watch your belongings.
author: zach b.

description:
Meh, I dont' really dig this place.  Cover charge is lame.  Drinks aren't very strong and are on the pricey side & I'm not sure if it was just the night I came, but they didn't have any straws :|  

BUT, I like the cool prom decor.  Could be really cool for people who love cumbia music as it was a cumbia night....
author: Katrina V.

description: Ugh! Saw the worst DJ ever here a few weekends ago... He had an 80's style mixer and kept playing it with his elbows. It sounds entertaining, but it was annoying! Just play the music, dude!
author: Abby S.

description: Mehhhhh. I think it was 70s night when I came, and we weren't really feeling the music/empty dancefloor. It got a lot more lively and the music became more danceable, but that wasn't until midnight/1 AM ish. My redbull vodka was only $5 (woot woot), but they actually charged a $5 cover for this place... it's so small. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Came here again after the Latin American Club.  I was a little tipsy from the drinks there already and from all the boy attention, so I was probably really embarrassingly uninhibited ("loud" would be a probably more accurate description).  We got down to the live band El Ritmo.  I had one more drink which I am still paying for this morning. 

Then, even more embarrassingly we sort of did what the club name suggests--and proceeded to suck face.  Hopefully his friend doesn't post the photos all over the internet.  My future political career will be ruined. 

The whole no credit card thing keeps me from giving it a full 5-stars but overall I enjoyed it much more this time around.
author: Nikki K.

description:
It kind of pains me to write this review after the many years of frequenting the Makeout Room..

I went there tonight to see Mortified- a great show that I have been to a couple times before to see. Loved the show but not the "staff" cleaning up afterwards..

Right after the show the host of the show came over to offer us different chairs to sit on (there were foldable chairs for the show) and we took them and continued our conversation. A few minutes later a man cleaning the floors came over to tell us to move the chairs to the table area when we were done, in a very abrupt, rude manner, and we assured him we would when we were done (as it was quite empty and not an immediate need).

After about 10 minutes, the cleaner came back over and instructed us to get up "now" "right now" so he could finish his job. I told him we would move them when we were done and that he didn't need to be so rude in asking- we weren't actually inconveniencing anyone. He completely shut me down and made me feel like a jerk, when it was very inappropriate to do so. I mean, really?! We are capable of moving TWO chairs 15 feet away. He insisted and practically used physical force (no joke) to remove me and my friend who had not been there to hear his previous request. I told him that I was sorry for holding up his job, and we got up, and he continued to talk to us in a very demeaning manner. 

After the confrontation, I watched the interactions and noticed that someone at the bar gave money to the cleaner and the bartender gave him a beer. After a bit, I approached the person at the bar who gave this cleaner money, and when I told him the situation he replied that he had only given the cleaner  "a dollar" and could not change the cleaner's behavior. 

After telling the person who I am assuming is the manager about this situation, he basically told me that he could do nothing and that my patronage  was not important (regardless of me and my friends all being long time customers of 3+ years and paying for many shows). 

So yes, Mr. Manager, I will be telling everyone I know NOT to go to your bar, and that you obviously do not value your customers in the slightest.

Sad, but I'm over it. It was a great run Makeout Room.
author: Lara M.

description:
My group and I had such a good time here that we were more than willing to miss the last BART and pay $100 to cab it back to Walnut Creek - I don't think that I can express my love for this place any better. (This review is for Saturday night - El SuperRitmo.)

We nearly missed this place as the outside looked pretty shady to us (especially with the "wanna party?" sign hanging out front). After paying our $5 cover, we stumbled into the most gloriously blingy bar ever. If you look around you at eye level, you could almost believe that you're at a speakeasy in the 20s. Then your eyes go up... and you see the glittery tassels and the rhinestone reindeer mounted on the wall. Fabulous.

The Latin/Afro-Caribbean music was a welcome change from the usual top 40 stuff (of which I'm a huge fan, mind you). We had a blast "learning" to "salsa" and the only breaks I took were for the bathroom (surprisingly clean and not crowded for having only one stall) and for the drinks. How much more can I compliment a place where a round of drinks for four is $15 and each one is more potent than the last? (Slight downer: cash only).

Bonus points for being high-ceilinged so that no matter how packed it gets, you never feel like you're suffocating (coughBubbleLoungecough).

I'm almost scared to come back here and not have it live up to last Saturday night... but I think I'll find a way to get over my fear :-).
author: Kavita B.

description:
I'm not going to lie: I feel like an awkward freshman at prom at big city clubs.  You see, being fresh out of college, the whole concept of interacting with people that are several years older than you (and probably more mature as well) is kind of strange.  People aside, my only recourse from this awkwardness is the music that's played -- and this is where the Make-Out Room shines. 

When I graced the Make-Out Room with my presence last Friday, a variety of eclectic DJs rotated performances. They all played semi-obscure songs, but the music was still rockable/grindable/danceable. The highlight of the night was this dude name Jeremy Ellis performing a live set on his little MIDI sampler.  This man could fucking play.  I'm not sure if he's on every night or if he was even just a guest performer, but he made my visit well worth it.
author: David H.

description:
Dance! Dance! Dance! There are not many places to dance in The Mission, so The Make-Out Room gets my vote just for serving that function. I also like the inexpensive drinks, quirky decorations and Saturday Salsa!

This place has my heart when I feel like dancing in an unpretentious, fun environment :)
author: Shira O.

description:
Decor: 4 stars.
Drinks: 2 stars.
Music: 2 starts.
Cover charge: 2 stars.

Having a bartender that ignores you for 20 minutes, then "forgets"
to bring change and avoids you for the next 40 minutes until you give
up and leave because chasing down a bartend for 7$ just ain't worth
the effort: 1 star.

Classy, eh?
author: Max R.

description: I decided to change it to 5 stars... just because I have realized how awesome this place is compared to other SF bars...
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Shruggingly came here on Saturday with a group of friends after being sardined near the bathroom at Latin American for an hour and finally decided we'd had enough of people asking us if we were in line for the bathroom. 

After the $5 cover we walked in to a nice looking space with a restored bar, booths, and a large room in the back with people dancing below silver streamers and decorations hanging from all over the ceiling. The vibe was lively and everyone seemed to be having a good time. At one point I asked the bartender for a special drink on recommendation, and he whipped up a ginger vodka martini - pretty nice! His kindness and obvious happiness in his job was in stark contrast to the insane, grumpy grizzly tending the bar at Latin American.

Even though the $5 cover at Make-Out Room was a little annoying, I was willing to pay it for some breathing room (although it was still pretty crowded). Saturday is their El SuperRitmo! night which claims to present, "the finest African music of Latin America. Cumbia, dancehall, reggaeton, salsa. soul, hip-hop, funk, rio baile funk, mambo, electro, descargas cubanas, disco, bhangra..." of which I only really heard the first three, plus a few of the Spanish-language versions of some disco classics. There was one hip-hop song and none of the rest. Also, since when did bhangra become African music of Latin America? Just asking.

Decent night out.
author: Ekin O.

description:
If you want to pay a cover to get your stuff stolen, come here.  If you don't, I'd recommend going elsewhere in the Mission (there are so many better places to choose from!)

I got my nice wool coat taken when I was here this weekend.  Looked away for a second and it was gone.  To make matters worse, though, the Make-Out Room staff could care less.  There's no system for trying to reconnect people with their switched coats and their phone number just goes through to an answering machine, regardless of whether it's during their stated business hours or not.  

Rest assured, I won't be back and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

p.s.  If you happened to walk away with a knee-length women's black wool coat that isn't yours, please let me know!
author: Kelly K.

description: One of the only bars I feel relaxed at and I'm a lush and go to a lot of bars so I know what I'm talking about haha. Drinks are cheap enough that it's not taking too much out of my savings for a brand new Lamborghini. They have apple cider so that also makes me happy and the decor and lighting is quite lovely and soothing. I'd write more cool stuff about this place but I'm running late for my taco date.
author: Bori G.

description:
So, I saw no one making out and I was extremely disappointed...but maybe because I was there for Writers with Drinks.  

The vibe was typical trashy Mission.  Funky, bordering (ha, bordering, right?) on weird...all of the reasons we love the Mission.  

Hardly any seating, especially considering we were listening to writers read their stuff for 3 hours and cram packed into the place were like 400 people.  We ended up on the floor, in the booze and the dirt and were perfectly happy there.

Cool vibe.  Amazingly yummy drinks.
author: Stacey C.

description:
It seems like whenever I go out in the Mission I end up at the Make-Out Room. 

A ton of cool events seem to happen here: Litquake, burlesque, you name it. And while it can get a little crowded (forget getting near the stage if you don't get there early), it never has that sweaty overcrowded feeling that makes you think you'd be better off at another bar.

The drinks are good and there's food nearby. Also the lighting is fabulous for a romantic evening, though I'd suggest going on a quieter night for that. All in all, one of the best bars in the Mission.
author: Lynn B.

description:
Don't worry, making out is only optional.  

Cheap drinks.  Chill bartenders that actually pay attention to getting a drink to you.  Great when there's a show going on.
author: Christine K.

description: Not a long time ago this was one of the finest places to hang out on the Mission. Due to the lack of great bars and club in the area The Make Our room continues to survive (it's always busy during the weekends), in my opinion it is a matter of time until people start going somewhere else. During my last 3 visits this place smelled really bad and we saw a girl crying after her purse was stolen. The owners need to do something about it, they have added several notes on the wall warning people to be careful with their belongings but this is far away from being enough. Please do something before you lose your clientele due to the facts I mentioned above.
author: Pepi R.

description:
By the end of this trip I was a little tired of settling in at one dive, only to be dragged across town to yet another, so I begrudgingly gave in to my friend's wishes to hit up Make Out Room (she had found it days before, wandering the city on her own).

But as I entered the door and saw the glittering silver ceiling decorations I was immediately delighted. Instead of a cover, we were waved through and sat at the half booth to get a good look at the band. The live music, the atmosphere, the weird deer head made of bottle caps and the disco ball set to "1950s prom under sea" slow spin were just what I needed.
I finished off my Colibri tortillas and enjoyed the music for a full 30 minutes, then was off yet again. 

Loved it here, absolutely loved it.
author: Lauren V.

description: Got there a little after 11 and the music was decent. The music picked up around 11:30 or so and got really good with Latin hits. Cash only which was tough but prices were reasonable. The crowd was mixed with a few people dancing salsa constantly and some just having fun. There were also a decent amount of guys just standing around the perimeter. The night I went was more guys than girls. I give it 4 stars because some of the music was out of place and messed with the vibe. Overall a positive experience and I will be going back.
author: Andy S.

description:
Went with friends the other night on a whim while cruising the mission and paid 5 bucks for "Loose Joints" on Friday. OK, reasonable drink prices and the crowd was pretty chill and eclectic....

The DJ? KILLED IT!!! Holy shit, he was spinning roots, dub, oldies, rock, hip hop all on VINYL. THANK you my friend, you made our night!
author: Teo C.

description: Stopped by the Make-Out Room one night with a bunch of friends. They were playing salsa/latin music and there was a $5 cover. The dance floor was packed! We had a great time here, would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a fun place to dance!
author: Stephanie T.

description: Unfortunately the music was packing up as we were leaving, but the entire bar looked like one big dance party, and everybody inside seemed cool and hip.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I have several hilarious memories here. They are all "you had to be there"  stories, but hopefully I can transcribe them so you can all be in on it too. I just care that much about you(s).

The whole look and feel was of an 80's slash not really out of the 70's quite yet prom-y thing. It had glitter, awesome lampshades, a big hook thing that must have held at least 30 bras (I would have taken mine off to add to the pile but I was wearing my favorite one and cost me 50 bucks  from VS..soo...yah no.)
