The layout wasn't TOO astechically (yeah, the spellings off..bite me) pleasing, but there was a stage with a band that night (THANK YOU KEANE!!), and chairs surrounding so it was all good. We stood at the bar and listened to the band, I ended up in a "WOOO!"-ing contest with some random person, and some crazy random guy pushed my head into my dates when we were going to kiss. Talk about another awkward situation! (How are we still dating? That is strange to me.)

The band asked about what kind of jobs we held, and I, being my father's daughter wanted to make a presence for myself, screamed "PAPERBITCH!". I meant receptionist, but no one would have listened to that!

The place really lives up to its name. I saw a bunch of couples makeout, and two cute guys were getting all flirty and close to each other and FINALLY one of them made a move and kissed him. It was the cutest thing I have ever seen! I LOVE SF! 

Yes, if you have to ask, I did makeout here with my date too. Even without the strange guy forcing it :P
author: Jaime L.

description:
If you like Mylar, you'll LOVE the Make-Out Room. 

It is just kind of an annoying place to see performance. If you're in the front, you're trapped, and if you're toward the back, you could be just about anywhere....there is a total disconnect from the long narrow bar area to the stagefront area, and total clusterclog to get to and from the bar/front door to anywhere else. The booths in the bar area are a swell idea for "making out" I suppose but they just suck up space. 

It got so crowded near the bar on a recent visit that some chick in a wheelchair ran right over my foot. I'm not saying she did it on purpose, I don't think she had a choice, and I'm not supposed to get mad I guess, but my foot hurts like hell.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I can't rate it as a music venue, but if you're into San Francisco's best authors reading their stuff, you'll love it.  I caught the October 9th Litquake event, hosted by Stephen Elliott, and it was awesome.  Stories of S&M, masturbating priests, swearing, orphaned children on the verge of growing up all wrong...it was all there, and more.

Stephen Elliott has some nice arms.  An entire show of Steve in a sleeveless shirt is worth my hard-earned money.  I wouldn't care if he read bankruptcy ads the whole time.

It was a cool place - I felt at home.
author: Ellen M.

description:
I've always wanted to come here, just for its name. 

But it's actually really pretty, too - with all the sparkly silver helium balloons, streamers, etc. hanging from the ceiling.

Also, it has the right balance of hipster meets posh. 

I like. 

But I wasn't so impressed with the beer selection on the lighter, medium body side... though I hear their darker beers are fantastic.

p.s. Just as Ryan V. said, I saw at least 2 couples here FULL-ON (Double Rainbow, ALL THE WAY) making out. It was a little awkward. Mainly b/c I wasn't the one making out.
author: Sally M.

description:
In summation: 
Atmosphere: 5 stars
Music: 5 stars
Bartenders: 1 Star
Cash-only: 1 star
Pizza place across the street: 5 stars
Cover charge of $10: 1 star 

I have big mixed feelings about this place, mostly positive overall though. I went there with a group of my friends last night and we had a very fun time! The music was fun, the vibes were great and I enjoyed dancing on the stage. That being said, I can't give give this place the 5-stars it deserves due to their EXTREMELY RUDE BARTENDERS!

I understand that it was a busy night, and I don't mind waiting for my drinks. What I can't stand though are bar tenders who are just down-right disrespectful. I felt that I was being ignored all night. I ordered 2 beers and the bar tender looked at me and did not acknowledge my request. I asked her again 5 minutes later to which she snapped at me "I HEARD YOUR ORDER THE FIRST TIME." That was the first strike. I asked her to deliver 2 shots of tequila for my friends down at the bar (I was sending them a drink, something that is totally reasonable) to which she replied: "send them over yourself, I'm not your delivery woman." I thought she was joking but then when I asked her again she gave me the same reply. I had to convince her to do the simple request for me. That was strike 2. Strike 3: she over charged me for one of my drinks and failed to provide me with adequate change (note: this place is cash only). 

Make-out room: Fire her, this is ridiculous. There are plenty of people looking for jobs in san francisco who will actually make it a pleasant experience.
author: Joel K.

description:
This place reminds me of a Valentine's Day dance look in the best possible way. When you enter, you notice the shiny streamers hanging above you, and the lighting is nice and dim.

The drinks are tasty and pretty strong, the dance floor is fairly small but sufficient, and the music is not so loud that you can't hear yourself think. I came with a group on a Saturday night, and we were able to get a table in the back, which means the place wasn't *too* crowded. True, there is a cover, but hey, in the big scheme of things, what's a little cover charge, right?
author: Sonia M.

description:
So I walked in to this place tipsy and with only goal, to dance. And danced I did. I was really feeling the music that night, the DJ was mixing salsa with hip hop and he made it work. I loved the environment and the people all seem really nice out there. 

The make out room is a must go, if you go bar hopping in the mission!
author: Cristhian M.

description:
Came here this past Saturday night on the suggestion of a mutual friend.  We were looking for good music and a chill crowd and found it! The $5 cover was definitely worth it and the $3 beers made me happy as well. Yes the bathroom only has one stall but it wasnt crowded, and when something went wrong with the ladies room, the staff was so nice to guard the guys room so my friend and I could pee in peace.
The music was mostly spanish and reggae, both two of my favorites! Although, I wouldnt have minded some more hip hop in the mix! A fight almost broke out, and a guy walked off with a bloody face somehow but other than that the night was a success!
author: Dominique Y.

description:
This place gets 5 stars because of the range of events that go on here and the many communities served. Funk night, Soul night, 80s night, Latin music Comedy and some literary events for them intellectual types.  

Went here on a Friday night with some friends a while back and the djs were just plain fun. The coat check is a big plus ...knowing our belongings were kept safe while we DANCED! 

Drinks are on the strong side so WATCH OUT !!!
author: Charles F.

description:
Andy and the rest of the bar staff were terrific on my first visit to Make-Out Room. The drinks came fast and heavy.

If you go on a weekend, be prepared to stand or dance, because seating is limited.
author: Kiarash Z.

description:
Of all the bars I went to in San Francisco, the Make-Out Room was my favorite. Squiggling streamers and stars funked up the ceiling, reflecting off the disco ball. Staring at me from above the bar was a buck head, covered in studs and rhinestones, probably with one of those Bedazzler tools from the mid 1990s. Spotlights illumined the art work, such as a glowing owl at twilight, a bear skin, a circular sheep diptych, and smiling creatures with snail antennas and faces but the bodies of cats. Plus, a star-shaped wall light wowed me, multi-colored stripes blinking inward and outward a la Rainbow Brite. 

When I arrived, the line for the night's Mortified performance flooded the sidewalk. A bunch of people annoyingly had saved entire rows of seats for their friends by stretching their jackets across the chairs. So I stood in back with a Death & Taxes, laughing my ass off at the show, numbing my aching feet.
author: Bobbin W.

description:
You must remember this 
A kiss is just a kiss, a sigh is just a sigh. 
The fundamental things apply 
As time goes by.

And when two lovers woo 
They still say, "I love you." 
On that you can rely 
No matter what the future brings 
As time goes by.

I can't help thinking that song like thinking of this place. This place really got me, and I think this place will stay in my memories of all time. I'm been seeing this girl for a while now, and she took me there. I think she was trying to make a statement. I really should have saw it, but I was clueless, now I wish I can replay that night ever night of my life. I never felt so much closer to her  that night. I didn't mind the $5 cover charge ( after a certain time, it's free to get in), I didn't mind the one broken ass toilet, scorching hot inside or the crack dance floor that had more crack than Lindsey Lohan's nose. I was just focus on one thing and that was having a good time with my lady. 

There were a loud of people, and yes, some of them were making out. (Hints the  name). There were booths full of them, too. The bar was fill with hippies and hipsters. Drinks are $4. I didn't care. My eyes was on her.

I didn't mind the odd art work on the wall, the silly Disco Ball, the deer heads, hanging silvery tingel, or the other decorations on ceiling. My eyes on her. 

I didn't mind the cool mixed of old and new music from the DJ like Salsa, soul, electro, Funk, and others. I didn't mind the events themes such as Stay's Gold (Queer Night), the Writers with Drinks or even when 'Mortified' was playing live music. My eyes was on her.

We dance the night away, and we were there when it closed. My eyes on her. I wish I went for the kiss that night, but I didn't. Damn. Now all I have right now is that song.

Maybe one day, I get my girl back and give her the kiss, I didn't do.
author: Ivy V.

description:
The Make Out room was my next destination after enjoying a wonderful bday dinner at Foreign Cinema. It was only $5.00 to get in so that wasn't so bad and it wasn't overly crowded which was nice. The decor inside is interesting... I was excited since I was expecting to get my dance on to some Latin music...

The group I was with still made the best of it and danced but we all agreed the Dj sucked. Not sure I would come here again...
author: Lynn C.

description: First ever yelp review because of how horrible my experience was. I asked for a redbull vodka which may not be the most tasteful of drinks I admit but the bartender told me to fuck off. She was brunette with some tats from what I remember. This place has the worst service of any bar I have frequented in SF.
author: Kevin F.

description: Loved the music selection! Good funky kind of vibe. I went on a Thursday and it wasn't crowded by any means which was great for the date I was on. I want to go back on more of the weekend with a bigger group and see if there's a difference. Either way, I liked it. :)
author: Audrey V.

description: DJ Purple is really, really good, and the drinks are, too! Great atmosphere and we didn't have to wait too long for drinks even though the place was packed.
author: L V.

description:
Oh, wow.  Talk about a trip filled with iridescent slides, poofs of spicy atmospheric bubbles, and cheesy wooden tables and chairs tipping over in slow motion.

We dropped in without the intention of going to this bar.  It just happened to be along the way of our bar crawl...

I am not sure what theme night we intruded upon, but it was as if a modern hippie caravan stopped for a communal get-together.  Mix in the Mission neighborhood types with a few jocks just visiting from South Bay and our scene was complete.  

Drinks were typical, but not watered down.  Crowded for sure, but if you can score one of the banquettes along the wall, even better.  We spent time dancing in the middle of the room, but there was all sorts of craziness going on all over the place.  Not in a bad way...........just in a psychedelic gauzy way.

I left with a veil of uncertainty following me......... but regained it once the cold evening air hit me in the face.

Great bar, cool layout, casual ambiance.  The name of the place was aptly named and could have been attributed to a short make-out session, but I was not drunk enough......besides,  my friend does a good job keeping a protective eye out for me  (^_^)
author: Miika M.

description:
I wandered in here (all by myself.....boo hoo) while waiting for a table for a restaurant up the street (was with my family, the wait was 1/2 hour, I got bored). 

Saw that the Happy Hour was still in affect, bellied up to the bar and ordered a mighty strong whiskey sour (well drink). For $3 it's definately not a bad place. 

I was fortunate enough not to wander in while there was a cover charge, in fact, the place was near empty, as it was only 6pm on a Sunday. 

Overall, the place seems like it will be very fun while in full swing mode. Will be sure to go in next time with someone whom I will have the pleasure of sharing PDAs with.
author: Jackie F.

description:
I ended the night here with my friends during our trolley bar hopping adventure.  For being as intoxicated as I was, I still remember disliking this place.  

The first two drinks I tried to order, they didn't have because 1) they didn't know how to make it, and 2) they didn't have red bull.  Booo! No bueno!  I asked the bartender just to make me anything good and she gave me something that tasted like a mix between Robitussin and Metamucil.  Yakkety yak - no thank you.

The music on a Saturday night was salsa, which was okay, but I would have liked more variety.

The crowd was a bit on the older side and had no problems hitting on my friends and I; although when we did not reciprocate they pretty much backed off and left us alone (which usually isn't the case when you go out and the guys are bit younger).  

Bleh, I wouldn't go here again.
author: Tram T.

description:
I like the place but make sure you know it's a Latin club. Their drink specials are really good and strong. I tried the rum + ginger beer...delicious!

Not too sure about the $5 cover though, but I guess it's for the unique Latin club and their decoration on the ceiling.
author: Gerard L.

description:
Was supposed to go to a live show here last winter but it sold out. Fast forward a year and DAMN do I regret not getting those tickets!!! 

Anyway, came here to dance and dance we did! The decor is fun and the music was awesome! Not the typical house or club music that you often hear these days. They played music that just made me wanna dance dance dance! Like the Devendra stuff :D Patrons here are all pretty cool too. They know how to bust a move for sure. Hahah

So very glad that I happened upon this place again because next time, I'm bringing all my friends! (And I KNOW we'll have a blast, guaranteed!)
author: Elaine T.

description:
Fun little place.  I've been here a few times, and have always had a pretty good time.  The best way to spend your time here is to dance up on the stage.

Predictable Mission bar atmosphere:  A bunch of messy people sloppily drinking gin & tonics within a sort of dirty, long + narrow room. 

It's a Latin bar, and I have nothing against Latin music but it's just not my thing - I like to come here when they're playing normal dance/house/electronic music.  If I want to dance in Mission I'd much rather go to Medjool, but the Make-Out Room will do if your not dressed for Medjool or if your entourage wants a less upscale venue.  

FYI: they charge a cover.
author: S. F.

description:
It's a 3-star bar, but I'm tossing in an extra star for a variety of reasons.

1.  We were entering solely because as we walked by, we heard a live band.  When we entered, the bouncer looked at us and asked, "You guys here for the band?  There is a $10 cover..."  I was taken aback by this because there were all of 20 people in there listening to the rather good band - but immediately, he adds, "Well, if you're just wanting a drink at the bar, come on in free of charge."
COOL.

2.  Who's a fan of Brandon Lee?
He's bartending here - or at least he was a week ago on Sunday.

3.  Reasonably priced, good drinks.  

The atmopshere was a bit on the grungier side, and the clientele, perhaps because it was a Sunday was slim and very mixed, but the live band (I wish I got the name) was great.  However, by 9 PM or so, they were off the stage.  Bummer.

The Make-Out Room was just all around cool, and if hanging out in the Mission - this would be a venue I'd return to in a heartbeat.

Ladies, did I mention Brandon Lee (lookalike anyway) tending the bar?
author: Grace K.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in the city. Why? Well, besides all the steamy French kissing, it's the home of Tuesday soul nights (slow dancing is a great way to maybe French someone), pint-size margaritas (aka "smooch guarantees"), rad musical acts (you can make-out at concerts too) and is the occasional venue for DJ Purple. Serenade someone on the karaoke mic and then tongue kiss them. This is the place. Just don't forget breath mints.
author: Christina S.

description:
I liked the mellow vibe of this place.  I'm not sure if it's because I went to see "Mortified" but the crowd that night was pretty relaxed.  The music was decent too.  I'd imagine this place would suck on a really crowded night, but on a less crowded one, it's a great place to just sit with some friends and have a drink.  The DJ was pretty good too.  I saw a few people getting their dance on.  Then again, it was still early when I left.  The door on the women's bathroom, however sucks.  It nearly was going to fall off.  I hope they get that fixed soon.

According to my boyfriend, the interior reminds him of a really bad prom. He also added that we need to make out at a place called the make out room...I'm not all about PDA but I thought I'd humour him at the suggestion. (Although I'm not sure if I'll actually follow through).
author: Amy J.

description:
Came here one Saturday night after Limon. The place was packed! Luckily, one of our friends worked in the neighbourhood and knew someone so we got in without problems. The venue was playing Latin music that night, which not all of us were into.

However, it turned out to be a great night, bartenders kept the drinks strong, nice amount of room to dance, and we met some cool people! Bathroom was dark, and parking was a big problem though. Too bad I don't live closeby...
author: Lois W.

description:
I came here last night for Stay Gold's Four-Year Anniversary. And for those who don't know, Stay Gold is a queer event that happens every last Wednesday of the month. It was my first time there, first time at Stay Gold. Not my favorite queer event. I really wanted to like the party. I had heard great things. Needless to say, I was disappointed.

PLUSES:
-$3 to get in
-Seeing people you haven't seen at other queer parties
-Short amount of booty-shaking music
-Entertaining live performance (not sure if this was an anniversary special)
-If you ever wonder where all of the hipster lesbians hang out, it is here. That's fer sure.

MINUSES: 
-Long line to the bathroom. I didn't have to wait in it but my friend did. One bathroom stall for all of the vaginas in this joint. Fail.
-Crowded.
-Body odor. Look above at the plus...hipsters also don't wear deoderant or shower for that matter.
-Fish smell...yes, I said it. I smelled fish. Too many pink tacos perhaps?! And I kid you not, my hair smelled like fish when I left the place. I was sitting on the bus and thinking...who the eff smells like fish?! I smelled my hair and there was that smell.

I don't want to give off the wrong impression in this review. I love women. I love hipsters. It's just that sometimes, ya know?! I think you get the picture. If you have problems with this review, feel free to PM me.
author: Ileana H.

description:
After 3 years in SF, I think the MOR is in my top 3 favorite bars. There are a few reasons: 

- good entertainment
- good location
- good venue to play
- good drinks
- good bar staff

Entertainment - I have seen Calexico here, good DJs, great random bands, etc. Though I haven't gone, I hear Mortified is pretty funny too. 

Location - not on a main avenue is a bonus in my book. Being across the street from Cafe Revolution and around the corner from my other favorite bar (Mission Bar), makes MOR prime real estate!

Venue - my band has played here once, and luckily everything went swimmingly - we were asked to play again. The sound is good. The 2 level stage thing is fun and exciting. The red curtain background made me feel important. Music is heard from anywhere you are within the bar. 

Drinks - $5 PBR pitchers and overflowing glasses of whiskey?! C'mon! 

Bar staff - always a pleasure to do business with. Jill and staff are full of smiles and always know the right things to say. 

Please stop by the MOR if you are in the area. You will not be let down!
author: Morgan F.

description:
I was always intrigued by this place even when I was a kid. When I use to live at home, it was along the way of my favorite Chinese restaurant, and there would always be crowds of people standing in front of it, smoking it up. At first I just thought it was a bar but then I began to hear music from it. Up until last night, I didn't find a reason to go since none of my usual friends want to even hang out in the Mission. That was until I started making friends who lived in the Mission. Funny... when I lived in the Mission, I never hung out there, but now that I've left, I've hung out there more times in the four and a half years I've lived elsewhere than any other time when I lived at home (and didn't involve eating out with family.)

So my friend invites me to the Seaweed Sway Showcase that was held here last night. I told my dad where I was going and he said, "Oh, you mean that place with all the dorky white people in front of it?" I said yes. Oh, the shit my dad says. He DID say that the crowd always looks harmless and that they're just out from their geeky jobs just to have a fun time, so he said it all just for laughs.

The show itself was pretty cool. I was with good company, so I had a great time. The beer was cheap and since they don't serve food, you can bring in a burrito or pizza or anything else from nearby establishments. The bartender was friendly and attentive and overall, I didn't feel uncomfortable like I do in most bars.

The decoration of this place is pretty bizarre, but that's what gives the place charm. Everything from the disco ball to the alien paintings on the walls to the really cool two-leveled stage... I really dug it. I didn't feel crowded or get claustrophobic since it was on a Sunday (during the Treasure Island Music Festival, a Giants playoff game, with not-so-pleasant weather.)

I really dug this place. I'd probably go again if my friend invited me back. Then again, I could imagine myself giving a lower rating if it was super crowded, so I'm glad my first experience with this place was a really good one.
author: Chris S.

description:
If you are looking for a douchey club or a posh lounge, this ain't it.  It was, however, a really fun bar to visit after a dinner at Foreign Cinema.  We were unfamiliar with the neighborhood and the name was intriguing.

Well, I don't like paying cover, but it was only $5, and I fell in love with the kitschy decor - I especially liked the bejewelled deer heads on the wall and strange art in the back of the bar.  The music was awesome - there was a DJ mashing up older dance songs and latin/reggaeton beats, which was perfect material for a dance party.  OF course, with a name like this, expect some weirdos.

Alas, there was no making out to be had for me, but I did meet a nice guy.  There was a lot of making out and groping going on around the bar, so if you are a prude, this is probably not your joint either.  Bonus - drinks were only $4.  You really can't beat that.
author: Adrienne C.

description: $5 cover fee, limited space, folks come and go, had a water dispenser. In a convenient area near the 14 bus line. Not too shabby nor uber chic.
author: R C.

description: I had a great time here. Not the classiest place. But it's the perfect place for Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights dancing and are too scared to see what your partner looks like.
author: Diane A.

description:
Make-Out Room! You've exceeded all of my expectations of what a dirty divey Mission bar should be! Although scorching hot inside when it's busy, I love the space. Big and spacious dance floor, booths for making-out or your hearts desire, long bar in front, great stiff drinks, and a mix of people. Totally digging the ceiling and red vibe.

I went here for my 24th birthday on a Saturday night. They played some sweet and happenin' Latin beats. EVERYONE felt like J-Lo. Got pretty drunk off all my birthday gin and tonics and ended up dancing with the DJs on stage. WIN.
author: Michelle N.

description:
This was definitely not the place I expected when I was told we were heading to the Make-Out Room, but I would be back in a heartbeat.  The drinks are well made, and any place that can make me not only drink but enjoy a margarita get at A+ in my book.  

Ample seating was available, which is hard to come by on a Saturday night, and well needed after shaking our booties to the blaring salsa music they had playing.  I love that the place is dark, but not overly so, and the bar doesn't seem to get so crowded that you have to fight for a drink.

Bottom line: Great mood, good music, and well made drinks.  I'll be back.
author: Kellie T.

description:
Maybe I went on a bad night.

Initially my senses were engaged with the cool decor.  It felt like a 1980s prom night was going on with all sorts of random junk hanging from the walls/ceiling and the stage with the DJ...awesome, I love 80s stuff! I felt like I was in the 16 Candles movie!  However I wasn't there for long before I was itching to leave.  The music wasn't doing it for me, and the dorky hipsters bouncing/crazy-dancing offbeat to the music really killed it.  Michael Hall- eat your heart out.
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
I just returned from a LitQuake event that was here this evening. It was the perfect spot for a totally perfect evening by myself.

Everyone there was friendly and willing to talk to each other. This could be event-variable though. I was at an event that encouraged networking. No making out for me though. Only gay men and their husbands spoke to me this evening. But this is totally ok. One of them turned out to be one of the writers who presented tonight; he was brilliant.

Maker's Manhattan was one of the drink specials. $7 may seem like a lot for a drink. And it is. But for Maker's Mark bourbon and for the area, it is not that much at all. And if you get it on the rocks like I did (which is how they do Manhattans in Manhattan), your eyes will pop out of their sockets when you see how generous they are with the Maker's. Seriously. I had, and only needed, one that night. (This is a good thing. I care to never repeat the fateful night I had five too many at Ginger Man...I am also flat broke from the trip too).

The venue was perfect for the event. Big enough to fit a sizable crowd. Small enough that you could see and hear everything. 

The bar staff is attentive.

It is across the street from Escape from New York Pizza.

It is walking distance from 24th and Mission BART.

The tacky tinsel and disco ball add to the ambiance. Ironically. Oh #@%$! Did I just make a hipster reference?!?!?!?!?!?! Bad Michelle!
author: Zulu Q.

description:
Love, love, love this bar.

Now, I am the kind of girl that HATES paying cover but this is one of the few places that makes it worth it.  The music is always spot on and I end up dancing pretty much the entire night.

The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars was because of the horrible bathrooms.  There is ONE toilet and I have seen it get flooded  multiple times.  

So if you are up for a sweaty night on the dance floor to great Latin music come here!  Oh and be careful, they make crazy strong margaritas. Just a heads up :)
author: Kate J.

description:
Went here for my birthday celebration two weeks ago. It was better than I expected! The seating area is limited but that's fine because no one was ever sitting down the entire time. The dance floor got pretty crowded but it's all good! Had a blast and the night flew by. Drinks were good too!
The only cons I can really think of is that they only have ONE stall in the girls' bathroom. So expect lines. And the DJ that night switched up songs way too fast. By the time we would walk over to the dance floor, it was a completely different song.
Either way, if you have a cool group your going with, you'll have a lot of fun!

Oh and don't forget, it's CASH ONLY!!
author: stephanie c.

description:
I saw Mortified here with Alyssa G. and company on her birthday.  The show was really good even though we had the farthest possible booth from the stage.  They have a kind of ridiculous online-sales policy; they sell out online, but you can still buy tickets at the door.  How does that work exactly?

I like the vibe, though, and this is one of those large bars that makes good use of its ample space.  So many big places in San Francisco try really hard to pretend they're intimate, which just makes them feel crowded.  This place doesn't feel crowded even when it is crowded, at least near the dance floor.
author: John S.

description: It's an older crowd here. What I mean by that is late-20's to mid-30's. If that's what you're into, then this is the place for you. Since that's not what I am into, I didn't really enjoy my experience here. I mean, they were also playing lots of disco music. Disco music is good, yes. But, that enforces the idea older crowds like the visit this joint. Cocktails were $8. I believe the beers were $4. I suppose I'd only come here if I was already with a group of friends (which I was). Oh, and there's no cover at the door so that's always good.
author: Marlon T.

description: Randomly saw a small band here perform. I can only guess that the genre would be considered polka-esque. It was the first time I'd seen several friends and we were lucky to score a booth since it wasn't very crowded. Inexpensive drinks, random decor, and our own booth made for a fun night. The bartenders took some effort to drag out of their conversations with each other, the music was overly loud, and it was a little grungy. Overall it was an interesting little dive bar. I'm sure it would be better if I was interested in the band.
author: Kari G.

description:
Ended up swinging by on Saturday night and had a blast! The tunes were great....old school cumbia, salsa,and reggaeton. The crowd was diverse, laid back and everyone was dancing their asses off! The margaritas are ginormous, and bursting with lime flavor...only $6 (if i remember, correctly). Overall, it was a fabulous night! 

Only downside....no making out:( Oh well, perhaps when i return next time!
author: Marie L.

description:
Incredibly fun place. I always felt like bars in the mission were missing something. It must have been the dance floor.

Nice people watching.  OK drinks. Laid back atmosphere.

The crowd grows gradually although the place does not look busy until late.

I had a great time. I will be back.
author: Jose S.

description:
My first memory of the Make-Out Room is from around ten years ago when I went with my cousin. Looking back at that sentence I realize it sounds kind of gross, but it amuses me so it's staying.

I was fresh out of college and knew zero about cocktails (I only knew Popov vodka) so I ordered a screwdriver, which was so strong that I threw up shortly after drinking it.

Flash forward to now, with many years of cocktails under my belt, and I thought the drinks wouldn't seem strong any more. Wrong. Very strong. Very cheap. I made it through three drinks and my head is telling me I shouldn't have had the third one. Damn.

Anyway, drinks aside, I enjoyed seeing 'Mortified' here last night and would definitely go back to see it again. Get there super early if you want to sit in the chairs up front. 

Otherwise, bring cash, stand near the bar, and sip slowly.
author: Vandana M.

description: I've always heard of friends going there all the time but I was always a homebody or on the other side of town. Finally had the opportunity to go the other night and had a jolly good time! It totally doesn't look like it would look like the way it does from the outside, which means stop judging books by they covers! It had a chill cute interior. People flowed in and out all night so if you're not parked at the bar or the chairs aligning the place, you better be dancing! My dark and stormy had more rum than anything else but still no complaints, that means it gets the job done sooner. Wash that down with an IPA and cut a rug a bit before leaving!
author: Mitch N.

description: It is a pretty cool place. I liked the musics on Friday. Saturdays are usually Salsa/Reggaeton style if you are into it. Entrance is kind of narrow and can be hard to get in and out on a crowded night. And I support cover charges because even if it is a $5 bucks still keeps the unwanted people out.
author: Ken B.

description:
My friends and I got some inspiration from Dane Cook the other night: "Let's go dance tonight! F guys tonight. Let's just stand in a circle around our shoes and our pocketbooks and lets just dance. And if guys come near us we'll tazer them. No guys." 

We had heard that the MOR was a fab place for dancing, so we decided to take a trip out to the Mission. Man, that place gets PACKED. I could barely move, let alone shake what my mama gave me.

The cheap drinks made it better, but I was still bummed that I didn't get the full night of dancing that I had so desperately wanted.
author: Michelle C.

description:
The Makeout Room can be unpredictable, but I suppose that's why I keep coming.

Large dogs seated next to you, cello recitals, bad dancing, snack tables, silly DJs, live band, burlesque. It's a potpourri of entertainment. And the cocktails are divine.
author: Ima D.

description: Awesome place to get drunk.  Interesting location.  Lots of lesbians when I went there.  Good place to have a birthday party.  Good place to dance to a DJ.
author: Cynthia B.

description: The first time i went there I had fun, but the other times (that were at least 4) were terrible music, and weird people....But who likes Mexican Ragatón will love go there on Saturday Nights.
author: Danielle S.

description:
This place is cool! I love a place where you can either hang out at the bar, or dance on the floor, and this place does it. The decor is really cool, it felt a little bit like New Year's Eve or something. The drinks were cheaper than I thought they would be.

I went on a Saturday night where they have Cumbia (?) music, and though I was skeptical and I'm no latin dancer, I thought it was a lot of fun! I'm not a fan of paying entry, but I guess $5 was a fair price to pay for what I got inside. The crowd was predominantly hipster, but there were a few people there who were serious dancers and were there just for the music. 

I wouldn't go all the time, but I'd definitely be up to go back.
author: Ashley H.

description: Before this weekend the only thing I knew about this place was it has a sparkly sign. Went for a friend's birthday and all of the single ladies we were with got some hot Latin lovin. Well only one of them was hot. Byo condoms
author: Aaron H.

description:
3.5 Stars

I came to the Make-Out Room on a Saturday night to watch my friend's band play their last show.  I love the two level stage and the red lighting, everyone looks good in red light.  I even kinda dug all that silver crap hanging from the ceiling. 

There's a small ass dance floor in front of the stage which were occupied with small tables and chairs and there are booths lining up the walls, so decent amount of seating.

$2 PBRs

It was hard to tell what the vibe was like since I knew most of the folks in the audience watching the band.  One hipster guy spilled his beer on a friend of mine (who dresses like she's coming from the Marina).  He was apologetic but she was still really pissed and had no problem showing it (I just washed my hair today!)  

My friend is kind of a bitch.

At the time of this review I am listening to Francis and the Light's 'Tap the Phone'
author: Walerz B.

description:
That is a cool  place but really they packed so many people in there we could not move at all. If there's a fire let's say that you're screwed...
And seriously folks, ONE toilet for women???? for real???? 
I don't know may be it's not always as crowded as that night, but that wasn't enjoyable ... even though the show was awesome
author: Carpe D.

description:
I'm losing my touch--I can't remember how much the damn drinks were at the Make-Out Room on Sunday night.  And I'm a cheap bastard--this is usually the *only* thing that I remember!

Estefany G. and I walked in hoping to do a little dancing--that didn't end up being the way things played out, as they had some acts scheduled that night who--while they delivered some good music--they weren't particularly dance-able, and you couldn't have forced the dancing to happen with a crowd that was only into occasional swaying.

I've always assumed that I'd been to the Make-Out Room, but the interior was totally unfamiliar--the space feels huge with 40' ceilings, and like Estefany says, "it feels like prom" because of the long silver streamers and shiny stars and tinsel crap hanging down.  I think it's kitschy and cute, some other reviewers think *very* differently about it, obviously (see below).

The place was packed pretty damn tight, but the bartenders were on it as far as I'm concerned.  It was so crowded that I couldn't belly up to the bar and had to kind of sidle up behind someone.

Understand, now--Martin W. is not a tall man.  Handsome... yes.  Clever... you have no idea.  But tall?  Not so much.

Nonetheless, while the (cute!) bartender didn't even look at me as she went about making drinks and taking orders, and I worried that she couldn't see me or was going to ignore me when she just called me out, obviously having planted me in the appropriate place in her mental order of operations.  Nice work!  Oh!  And I remember, their well bourbon is Jim Beam and I got a double on the rock for $6.  I think.  Must've been happy hour.

I am knocking off a star because at around 10:30 or so, after the bands had wrapped up, we went across the street to Escape from NY pizza (everyone who knows about my diet:  shut up) and by the time we came back, the DJ still hadn't gotten it together.  We sat and drank our drinks for a while, but then just go sick of it and bailed out.  Sitting around a quiet bar while a DJ shuffles through his records is boooooring....

EDIT:  also, I did not see anyone making out.  I blame the DJ, not the venue.
author: Martin W.

description:
first review in a while, first time out in a while.  Came here for a friend's going away party.  Cool place in the mission, nice sturdy drinks and good music :)

downside, cover charge.  i didn't think this place needed to charge, but it was a saturday.  downside #2, one bathroom stall.
author: Regina B.

description:
UPDATE: It's been years since I've been in this place and it's better than when I came the first time. I came on a Friday night and the music was good. The DJ mixed it up so it wasn't the same stuff all night. Lots of people dancing but not crowded AND lots of cute girls and plenty of seating if you wanted to take a break from the dance floor. Unfortunately there was a cover charge but it was only $5. 

....so I met this one girl last Friday night and her name was Robin - brown hair, thin, about 5'5, and very attractive. She showed me pictures of when she went to Africa. Foolishly I missed the opportunity to ask for her number so if anybody could help me out. If you know a Robin with brown hair (cute hair) and recently went to Africa please let her know I'm looking for her....(-;
author: David C.

description:
BE CAREFUL WITH YOUR BELONGINGS!!!!

I had my handbag STOLEN here on Friday the 29th of April, something I did not expect by the look of everyone there. 

The thief then proceeded to rack up over a THOUSAND DOLLARS on my credit card before I could get a chance to cancel them - reason being: I'm from Australia, and couldn't access internet to do so, because I was locked out of my apartment thanks to them stealing the keys.

I sure hope travel insurance covers this one.
author: Olivia H.

description: I've been here three times now, two weekdays and a Friday.  Though I haven't enjoyed all of the DJs, I've always appreciated a dance floor that isn't jam-packed with dudes.  There's a five dollar cover on weekends, which can be irritating if you don't like the DJs.  Both times I didn't enjoy the music the playlist fell into the category of "academically interesting, but really hard to dance too."  Hopefully that's not a trend, because I plan on going back a few more times.
author: Bill H.

description:
Everytime I go here it's a good time. Mostly I've come for readings. 

The folks at the door are the best, friendly, charming attentive. The bartendars are also quick, cool and really nice. 

But what's with the restrooms? Every time I come here the place is totally packed and the bar is full. They also have a door charge for events, so what's with the restrooms? 

Hey folks, it's 2010. Single stall well lit restrooms are totally in. It's time!
author: Fresh E.

description: I have only been here once and thought it was ok. The drinks are ok (cash only), but they need to do something about their AC (if they even have one) as it gets super hot in there. They have dance floor as well as booths, which makes it a great spot to go in a group and the location is good for venturing somewhere else or ending up here.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Pretty chill place. Cheap drinks. We got two ciders (Pear and Apple) for $8. Not too crowded so easy to get drinks. Plenty of seats when we were there 9ish. Close to food and other places so a good place to stop in for drinks for.

The ciders were not bad, except we couldn't tell which one was which. And my friend thought it tasted like vomit (I only thought that after she said it), but pretend I just didn't say that and it tastes fine. Okay, really I thought it tasted fine b/c I kept drinking it. :)
author: Anita C.

description:
I went here for the Stay Gold event, after hearing lots of positive things about it I really wanted to go...I liked the vibe of the place..or rather the set up. I like the furniture piece for the DJ's stuff, and the silver tinsel-y streamers. But it was so fucking loud in here. Not with music but with drunk trendy lesbians yelling at each other. It was crazy crowded. I reeked of so many spilled drinks, it was like rubbing alcohol. The music was a bit schizophrenic. 

Not sure how I feel about this, even if it's $3.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Tim Burton-esque decor, cheap drinks, funky music and good people-watching spot. 

A notch above the typical dive.
author: Faith S.

description: The makeout room is awesome! The place does get hot (temperature wise, though I've seen it get pretty steamy in the other sense too). Dim lit, fun decorations, average priced drinks (cash only). Good date spot, large-ish dance floor but also booths. Music is good depending on the night/DJ but overall its a neat place.
author: Julie K.

description:
I disdain paying cover to drink 100% profit marked up liquor. I question the logic why there is a comfy chair with table conveniently placed next to the men's restroom so it smells like a giant sulfuric fart blast mixed with lovely liquid smells every time the door opens? 

Aside from those two quibbles, the drink pours for a single neat are huge and cheap. There's plenty of space and while the DJ plays some strange music that I couldn't get jiggy with, there were certainly some fun moments on the floor. 

But alas, this is only a refueling station for a night out in the Mission.
author: Jason C.

description:
I think I figured it out.

"Hey guys, I've got a BRILLIANT idea for a bar! Let's charge a cover, even though this place is in the Mission. Then, let's make the drinks EXTRA strong so that people don't realize that the general attractiveness of the crowd is minimal. Then, let's dim the lights and throw tinsel everywhere because sometimes beer goggles aren't enough. Finally, let's make the actual set up unconducive to actually meeting anyone new except for on the overcrowded stuffy dance floor!"

"AWESOME! But wait - what about the name?"

"Making people pay for what is otherwise a mediocre bar? Let's call it the Make Out Room, so they can at least get their money's worth with a bit of low level nookie."

*High five!*

I don't pay to slum. I can do that just fine for free. Two stars.
author: Devon S.

description: One of my fave bars. Whenever I go in there, I feel like I'm stepping back in time - something about the vibe seems like the bar teleported from the late 70s and landed in the modern-day Kingdom of Hipsterlandia. And I like it. I'm a bit behind the times in writing this, but Halloween there was a blast. Fog machines, fun DJ spinning house/electronica and friendly crowd who just wanted to dance! And, of course, the trifecta of strong, cheap and delicious drinks.
author: Rachel G.

description:
who runs out of champagne on new years eve?! 

shame on you make-out room. 

keep an eye on your shit.
author: Layla A.

description:
Henry Chinaski, Tom Waits, and a troupe of Gay Elvises walk into a bar...

It's not a joke. There is no punch line. It's the Make-Out Room. 

So quick to be adored. (By me, at least.) I imagine I'd make it a point to be a regular here, if'n I lived in San Francisco. The bar is weathered and worn... the ceiling adorned with glimmer and shine in otherwise darkness...the bartender gruff, but in a very friendly sorta way. 

"What can I get you?"
"Stoli and Cran and a Crown and Coke."
"NO CANADIAN."
"Jack, then."
Begins to make drinks as our friends decide...
"What can I get you?"
"Red Bull"
"NO ENERGY DRINKS."
Proceeds to hand us our cocktails, to which we ask, "Do you have cocktail straws?"
"NO STRAWS. BAD FOR THE ENVIRONMENT."

I like this guy. He's blunt. He speaks only truths beginning with NO but he pours with a heavy YES. 

I found myself sipping, not downing, my Stoli & Cran with a wince and a sigh of pleasure. I held my drink close to the candle atop the table we moved our party to and inspected. Mmmm...barely a light pinkish hue. That's a strong drink, friends. Me likey.

We didn't stay long. Sadly the DJ did not seem to understand the concept of conversation and the decibels were screaming from the sound system. But I'll be back... indeed, I will.

*ps Cheers to you if'n ya know the character that IS Henry Chinaski.
author: Augusta S.

description:
So, I've been here 3 times now and haven't madeout yet. 

False advertising.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Back in the day - by which I mean circa 1996 - I used to host Joe Night at the Make-Out room every Wednesday.  Just so happened I had sorrows that needed drowning in booze, and a lot of friends named Joe - so why not?  If you weren't Joe, you were still welcome, we just made you an Honorary Joe.  When you bring a big crew of people to a cool bar on a slow night like, say, Wednesday, the bar tends to comp your drinks, too . . . just sayin'.

The Make-Out room was my regular hang when the smoking ban went into effect.  It was there that I realized how different bars look in the absence of a smoky haze in the air . . . and how nice it is not to get home to realize that your clothes stink of tobacco smoke.

I've been back many times over the years (Jonathan Richman did an amazing show last year), and I was back at the Make-Out Room last night for Mortified, which was just hilarious.  

A great venue full of cool folks and $2 pints of PBR earns 5 stars. Minus one cuz it was too damn hot!!
author: Joe C.

description:
People either get The M.O.R. or they don't (just read the rest of the reviews).  If I may make some suggestions to those who don't:

- Be stoned, or at least buzzed.

- Variety is the spice of life. This club has survived for so many years by booking different things on different nights on a regular schedule.  If you don't keep up with what's going on, then you may not like what's there on what night, but may like it better on another night.  (I'm there only on live music nights.)

- ignore any cheesy north beach visitors

- try my favorite beer, the Belgian White

Last and most importantly,

- Pretend you're in a David Lynch movie.

Follow my instructions young grasshopper and you will understand.
author: christoph s.

description:
I decline to say if I made out at the Make-Out Room for the sake of maintaining my mystique.

*cough*

I hardly ever get to the Mission because it's so 'effing far away from my apartment and it is over-run with urban hipsters of the very worst kind.  Though, every once in a while - given the correct persuasion - I can be lured into this area of town.

Last night I went to hang out with a friend at Penny Arcade (the monthly acoustic show at the Make-Out Room) where we saw the most excellent bands Aim Low Kid, BeatBeat Whisper and The Avalanche Lillies.  It was low key and mellow; and, was a nice change from the hectic week I've had thus far.

As to the actual bar: it's decked out in lots of red.  Tons of red.  And, it looks like they either forgot to take down last year's Xmas decos or they have started deco'ing early for this year.  Plus there is a really cool head in a jar w/glasses and baby bottle nipples for hair.  I think that's my favorite thing about the Make-Out Room... that head... because, it's eerie and the glasses make you expect that the head will look at you at any second.

I like weird.

They served me wine in a water glass.  I don't know how to feel about that - either they are going for a complete lack of pretension or it is a sign of a serious dive bar.  Either is okay with me.

They have happy hour until 10pm on weekday - beers are $3.  They have PBR on draft for $2 at all times.

If I lived closer I'm sure I'd hang here much more often.
author: Kate R.

description:
All five stars are only for the Litpac and Iron Comic events they host.  

Although they do have a decent stage and the woodwork behind the bar makes me wish I could jump in a time machine and order a martini from this bar in its prime.  I imagine satin dresses, finger waves, cigarette holders and witty repartee with Nick and Nora Charles.  You have to squint to see this through the tinsel and bear pelt.

I will have to bitch about the following:

Your bartenders should know how to price a bottle of wine for sale even if you usually only sell it by the glass. (price per glass x 4).

When selling 3 glasses of wine you should either allow the customer to taste or don't complain if they return it because it is corked.

Anything worth doing is worth doing graciously.  When said customers apologize (sincerely and are great tippers and we are industry) but want new glasses as the wine is clearly bad you should not (after serving new wine) say, "Just so you know, I JUST opened that bottle".  Because not only are we done with you and your bar (I know she didn't just try and read us) but you sound ill informed because wine is often ruined by improper storage as well as being opened too long.  Your cost per bottle is about $6-$8 and we are paying that PER glass, right?  Are we spending any more cash here after that?  You should probably do the math here and realize that it isn't our fault you look like Carla from Cheers.

snap. (tm Jack M.)
author: Mokirobinson M.

description:
Yes, I see more people making out here more than other place. I think the suggestive name gives a simple-minded drunk person the inclination to do it.

But why is it so dead whenever I come here!? There's always people but does nobody dance in the Mission? Either way, come with some friends and it's a good time. That's more because of my friends than the venue though. We'll see if I have any better experiences.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Yep. 

I came. 

I saw my friend Martin's band play (Wayward Sway -- YAAAYYY Wayward Sway!!!). 

I made out for a bit with super-awesome-nearly-run-over-by-a-car-for-me-I-fell-in-a-hole-for-him-guy. 

And then we made our way OUT of the Make-Out room. 

There really wasn't any reason to stay. The Sway had even swayed on.

Plus, the Attic is one block away!

http://www.yelp.com/biz/Mpghm2DTdkBmmg_kvqXe3Q#hrid:C36cHsFIi5yUXLdY1PkgfQ

Can't compete, sorry. But I will soon live just around the corner, so I suppose I'll occasionally be stumbling in. Because that's just what I do.

Stumble, and frequent my neighborhood bars all too often. In no particular order.
author: Lisa T.

description:
What is it about this place that makes me want to stick my tongue in someone's mouth?

I can't quite put my finger on it...
author: Rachel G.

description:
this review is for STAY GOLD. (couldn't find the yelp page for Stay Gold).

here is my biggest CON:
it smells bad in this place!! I'm not sure if it's the clientele at Stay Gold, or the stench of the walls. And when the place fills up and the heat turns up, it feels like you're baking in stank. 

The DJs are usually good, danceable- even though they are rude at times. like their job is so hard- pressing spacebar on their macbooks. 

The bartenders aren't the friendliest either. maybe they're pissed about the smell, maybe they're just tired of drunk ass patrons. i can sympathize, but still- charm gets the tips. the bathrooms are pretty common mission level- so... dirty holes that are somehow soaked. sub par. what else is new in the mission. at least there is a bar, am i right? 

What I love is going with a bunch of my girls and dancing it out.

I'll try on another night when it's not Stay Gold. Stay tuned for my rewrite.

I think it's between $2-$5 cover for stay gold.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Probably the cheapest happy hour in the Mission, and even after happy hour the drinks are still pretty darned cheap. Nice old vinyl booths.

Great Soul Night on Tuesday nights with DJs spinning slow-dance-type 60's soul tunes off of vinyl 45s!
author: Adam Z.

description:
I visited the Make-Out Room on Friday a friend's CD Release party. His band had actually tried to book other venues, but had trouble with their availability.

So we arrived, payed our $6 entrance & quickly headed towards the bar for a pint. Anchor Steam on tap, a very good thing! We ended up waiting while some yuppy dude took drink orders from all of his friends & relayed them to the bartender. Then we waited longer when he decided it was time to break his $100 bill. To the Make-Out Room's credit, the bartender was very patient with him through all of this.

Finally, after getting our drinks, we proceeded towards the stage to watch the band. The Make-Out room has a 'ragtime band stage'--two levels about 20ft wide where the band stands under red lights & does their thing. The acoustics of the place are good up front, but mediocre as soon as you hit the bar area.

While I enjoyed seeing the band, I didn't feel comfortable at this place--felt too small & cramped for me. But who knows...maybe it was just my irritated mood that evening or quite possibly it could be cramped because it helps people to start making out?

I will not be returning.
author: matt m.

description:
If you like DJs that play a fraction of a song and then move onto the next one or music so loud you can't have a conversation, this place is totally for you. You'll also like it if you enjoy paying for that pleasure - there was a $5 cover in effect after 10. Depending on your taste, that's either cheap, or insult to injury. I'm in the latter camp.

Not to mention most of the songs being spun sucked. Is is just me or is hip-hop these days absolutely terrible when you compare it to the greatness that was late 90s circa Dr. Dre's 2001? 

But I digress.

I literally had to go to Mighty just to cleanse my ears.

Extra star for most everyone else have a good time. It clearly is me.
author: Jason B.

description:
Speculation: I think I'd rather make out in the Elbo Room than the Make-Out room*.  

But, this place is still damn sexy.  Great bar service, sweaty-bodied dance floor... and when I went this past Friday the DJ was spinning some foot happy bossa nova beats.  I've also seen whiny singer-songwriter here, so my guess is they keep it diverse.

I am not a fan of the tinsel in the ceiling.  But it did it's job of making everyone (else) feel festive.  And now for a correllation.

Other people feeling festive =** Jen feeing festive.

There's also this one:

dancing  = Jen feeling festive

Or, for consideration:

overt suggestion that I "make out" =  trigger aloof impulse

And, mind you:

not making out =not necessarily= lacking in fun factor

Great spot.  Bring your friends.

*It comes down to deep red glow vs. tinsel.  Also, make-out room is too easy.  A lady doesn't just give it away.
**I know the equal sign is inexact as a symbol for cause-effect correlation, but Yelp prohibited my cute little arrows.  Lame.
author: Jennifer B.

description: My buddy told me to meet up with him here and I'm not sure if it was 50's night or if it was just the odd hipster fashion, but everybody here looked like they just came out of the movie Grease. The bartenders were not very good and the music was weird.
author: Darius A.

description:
This is specifically a review of the "MORTIFIED" event held here every month or so. I'm indifferent to the bar itself and I don't hang out here on nights without "Mortified" going on. The bartenders have always been really cool to me, but I've only ordered PBRs and I tip well; however, my fellow patrons seem to order lots of margaritas and other time-consuming drinks, so I probably serve as a bit of relief.

Okay, so the actual event: "Mortified" is a reading of sorts, but not in an embarrassing sense--ok, it *is* embarrassing, but that's the point. You see, a group of people, who have auditioned and interviewed with the creators, choose a series of journal entries or poems written while the writer was a kid. As a result, the audience listens to "adults" read their deepest, darkest, and most sordid secrets from their teenage/junior high years. The results are absolutely hilarious and, in a perverse way, comforting (you realize you maybe weren't so weird or such a fuck up as a 15-year-old). Afterward, it's fun to compare who related to what with your friends.

It's 12 bucks to get in, which is a bit steep for old cheapie stewart here, but totally worth it. The crowd is generally pretty douchey, but if everyone's responsive, loud, and encouraging then it doesn't matter (unless everyone's unresponsive, quiet, and un-encouraging, then it can be lame). Listening to people spill their teenage thoughts on sex, god, drugs, and, um, farm animals (seriously), is such a voyeuristic treat. . . I just know you want in!  

1 star knocked off for the one-stall girls' room (and the ridiculous line that follows it)), the sometimes lame audience, and the steep ticket price.
author: Chloe S.

description:
Just went out to the Make-Out Room, this is the first time I've been out since I moved to San Francisco last week.  

My girlfriend/boyfriend Merkin and I could only stay for an hour.  It was pretty warm in there and Merkin, well, he was wearing some 100% nylon high-collar business, in other words sweating grease-back monkeys.  

It didn't matter though, both deejay ladies each had a set that had us cuttin' up some Make-Out room rug.  Roll that rug up with the fun-loving vibes and you've got one hot tamale.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I really thought a bar called The Make Out Room would have been a little sexier. I was expecting nice lighting, red walls, candles, maybe a throw pillow? But the place looks like any other Mission Dive and is about as sexy as the dudes I passed peeing in the street on the way home. 

The DJ was really bad the night I was there, and I'm not very discerning. It's an ok place to go if you're already trashed. That's about it.
author: Sharon T.

description:
It's fun to makeout at the Make-Out Room ;)

Streamers for decorations everywhere made it feel like a high school dance, cozy booths along the walls, and a raised stage for bands and djs. Drinks were cheap and strong. People seemed friendly. DJ played a very eclectic set and a handful of people danced. Most people chilled at the bar or in the booths, but it was just a Wednesday night.

I 'love' the Mission and it's fun bars! Can't wait to come back here to check out some bands in the near future.
author: Nikki D.

description:
I came here last night not having any idea what to expect.

One of my good gal pals mentioned catching the Get Mortified Show here (http://www.getmortified.com/). I'd never heard of it, but I'm always down to check out something new, so off we went.

The idea behind Mortified is adults sharing their adolescent journal entries, letters, short stories, etc. I thought it was hilarious. By the end of it my face hurt from smiling and laughing. 

As for the bar itself, drinks were teeny-tiny, but strong. I asked for a Ketel and soda, and damn if my glass wasn't filled nearly all the way to the top with vodka. The bartenders were cool, friendly, and I loved the eclectic decor. 

The Get Mortified show is a monthly happening. I highly recommend it.
author: Jasmine W.

description: We occasionally meet with The Rumpus Room aficionados when they countermand The Make Out Room and proceed to have a raucous, hilarious, greasy time with modsters, lesbian comedians, hippies, loosely gendered fans and a continuing assortment of, to me, fascinating people.  I don't know where the Rumpus stops and the Make Out Room starts on these nights, but the bar offers off-the-beaten-path brew, funky barkeeps, a few good booths and enough room to shake your booty.  The decor is part- last year's Christmas, part- ecclesia. It is situated in the Mission - possibly my favorite area to stalk at night in the City.  Looking forward to going again.
author: Liana R.

description: I went for writers with drinks. Hope to go back for Mortified soon. I really enjoyed this place. People were very friendly. Lots of good beers for $4. Not enough seating, but that's cool. Had a cool academic-type vibe -- felt like a little piece of Western Mass here in the Mission.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I had so much fun at the Make Out Room tonight! I came to San Francisco with the husband unexpectedly and was in the mood for some Latin music, I did a little searching and found this place. Saturdays after 10pm a dj plays all sorts of latin music and the dance floor gets pretty hot! There are cheap drinks, and a few friends meet up with us there and they had a blast. 

I will definitely return.
author: Jay T.

description:
Cool space with a fun dance floor.  And the best part?  Nicest. Bartenders. Ever.

Last time I was there my purse was stolen off the bench where I carelessly tossed it on my way to the bumpin' dance floor.  I was completely devastated - no keys, no muni pass, no driver's license, no money, no credit card, no iPod, no camera, no yelp stick.  The very sympathetic bartenders took down my name and number promising to call if it was returned.  I figured there was no hope, but 40 minutes later they called and then stuck around for an additional 30 minutes while I busted my butt back down there to pick it up.  I nearly hugged them all!

Although my iPod and camera were taken, my credit card, id, muni pass, work badge, and YELP STICK were still in the purse!  Lesson Learned: talk to bartenders if your stuff gets jacked; thoughtful thieves may actually return some of it.
author: Tessa M.

description:
This place totally lives up to its name--I made out with someone when I was there.  I wish they would open up a sister bar called, the "Best Oral Room" or the "Savage Piledriving Room."  

Best time to go the Makeout Room is when the Romane Event is going on.  Or Writers with Drinks.  Or when I'm there not already making out with someone.
author: Candy S.

description:
Did you miss your senior prom?  Too much acne to get a date?  Too stoned to bother?  Feel like you missed out on your choreographed prom dance sequence ala all of those high school movies from the late 90s?

Have no fear, Make-Out room is decorated like your senior prom, complete with mirror ball, streamers, and maybe even an undersea theme (not so sure about this last one..).

I had a fairly good time there abusing the drink specials -- something like $3 for a mixed drink or a beer.  

Drinks are poured HEAVY, however the bar itself is understaffed, so you might want to pick up a spare when you finally get the barmaid's attention. 

Saw a fun band *clicky* http://www.soundsofarcadio.com/ , had a good time, spent only a few bucks and walked out with a smile on my face.
author: jack p.

description:
First time I came here I saw a couple literally making out on stage. It was gross but oddly entertaining...so much so that we couldn't stop talking or staring. But it gets better! They later proceeded to walk into the men's bathroom together and do God knows what. We told our guy friends to go in there and see what was up. One of them went in but he said as soon as he entered, they hastily rushed out. HA!

Second time I came here, it was packed. And there was a DJ up on stage (no making out to be seen). The music he was spinning was a bit tribal so we were disappointed. The overall atmosphere is fun though - big disco ball in the middle, dimly lit. Might be tough to get a drink on a Friday or Sat night so good luck.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
I am giving this a mixed review for a few reasons...

The dancing & music is GREAT. This is what brought us in. I thought the Latin beats made for a more interesting Saturday night than a usual bar. 

What distracts from this is that it is overly crowded and hard to find any room, the bar is packed with long waiting time, and there is only ONE stall in the ladies room - which is a death threat for a weekend hot spot.

So take everything into consideration - it is 100% worth a try and you are bound to have a good time. Possibly this is a good Thursday night location vs. heavy weekend traffic.
author: Emmy L.

description:
This is a review by a non-drinking tea-totaler

I'm conflicted about the make out room. I've been here twice, both times for comedy-esqe events.

Plus: both events were very funny. No one threw up or got into a fight. Unlike some bars, I don't hear or feel my feet leaving a dirty sticky floor.

Minus: the venue itself is not well laid out for it's stage for non-music. There are only a small scattering of cocktail tables, then comes open floor, then the bar and booths. The booths look like a good comfortable place but as soon as the show starts people will be standing on the floor blocking your view. You'd have to get there quite early to get a table.
Because the bar area is so far away from the stage , people who have just come in to drink can be heard having raucous conversation during the performance.

Still, I'll probably go again.
author: Bob R.

description: Fantastic bar, one of my favorites in the neighborhood! They have such a variety of themed nights.
author: Ken M.

description:
I've been here enough times to drink to know that I don't like it, and that I'd only return if I was dragged here (which I was every other time I've been here).  The drinks are expensive and small and not too boozey, AND THEY NEVER HAVE STRAWS.  How the hell am I supposed to look classy sucking down my well whiskeys and coke???  It doesn't work without a straw.  
Granted, I've never been here for a show so I miiight be back to check it out, but in general, there are other waaay better bars in the area.
author: Meh M.

description:
Love the decor and bored-looking drummer on stage.  Loved that i learned the game of throwing quarters down sexy-backs.  Thanks Eric! 
Cool bar, cool location, nice people.
author: Joyhan S.

description:
Strong drinks, good music. 

We got there around 10 just after a band had finished playing and were able to get a table, which was good. We didn't have to pay cover which was good and the bartender made us some really strong drinks, which was also good. Later they played good music.
author: Christopher U.

description:
I dig the shabby sheik-ness of the place, old school tiny glasses, and 60s prom decor.  

I would come here drunk though, because my vodka tonic was probably Popov...which reminds me too much of college.   The music sells this place - despite the hipsters that frequent it.
author: ankur v.

description:
Pluses: Live music, dark red lighting, Mission hipsters.

Minuses: Crowded, teeny drinks, Mission hipsters.
author: G. J.

description: Great music. Fun dance floor. Love the disco ball and New Year's decor. Tiny bathroom. Go for Writer's with drinks. good luck on getting a seat.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Such a fun place to people watch! Came here for a supposed birthday party but the birthday gal didn't even show up! We ended up having a great time dancing and watching people anyway. 

There were all types of people here... let me start with the short, creepy guy wearing a hoodie who was alone, not drinking, and eying every single girl. He moved from the corner of the room to a chair near the dance floor and later started dancing by himself (props to him for this bold move, but still creepy). Then there was his antithesis... the tall, manly, well dressed macho Latino man who was also alone but walked in a la Antonio Banderas, unzipped his jacket, slid out of it and flung it onto an empty seat. Then, he proceeded to ask a girl sitting with her friend to dance (gutsy!). She conceded and I'm sure she was not disappointed... the man could sure dance! Later, the girl probably felt bad for her friend sitting alone and went back to her. Antonio on the other hand, went off to find himself another chica to woo and danced with her and then with another and another.... Let's just say it was great to watch the balls this man had... figuratively of course.

Oh, the drinks were good too!
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Here's a recent video I took of this place durig their first ever Riders with Drinks event: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d_92Hi-S3Hc

If a bar collided with a high school homecomig dance, you'd have the inside of the Make-Out Room. Complete with streamers, stage with red velvet curtains -- if it weren't for the beer specials ($3 cans of Corona) and excellent cocktails all for $7 or less, you might actually guess you'd wandered into the gymnasium of your youth.

The Make-Out Room has fantastic DJs, live bands, and regular open-mic writer's recitations that cover everything from awkward romances to chance Muni encounters. 

Also on the brilliant 22nd St. corridor near Cafe Revolution. Latin American Club, etc.
author: Andrew K.

description:
lo, these many years ago, the Make-Out and the Elbo Room were my regular haunts in the Mission.  And the Slow Club on Potrero Hill.  About 10-many years ago.  I went there tonight to see Armistead Maupin and others read from their works, and had a great time.  Even though it was packed and it was hard after being on my feet all day at work to go out and stand in a hot, crowded room for a couple hours.

Not much has changed.  Sure, the people have changed, but the place remains the same.  The Make-Out first taught me the beauty of a dimly lit red bar.  I actually saw two hot women making out (10 years ago, mind you) and thought I had died and gone to heaven.  These are the memories of an impressionable young man in San Francisco at the age of 22.

The Make-Out is still cool.  Just not as cool as it was in '97 with two hot girls making out at the bar kind of cool. ;-)  This is during the prehistoric internets, if any of you remember back that far.
author: Joe B.

description:
OK, first of all if I could give Make Out Room 3.5 stars I would. But as we all know, you can't, so I'll round up because I'm in a good mood today. Anyway... firstly, the decor is wacky. Don't know what vibe / theme / mood they're trying to create, but something about all the streamers and shiny random stuff is kinda endearing. Hey, at least it's SOMETHING to make the bar stand out...

Yeah it's kinda dive-y, but it is the Mission after all. I'm okay with it, and after all it is a rock club, it's supposed to smell like beer and puke inside. Plus, some of that might be MY beer and puke, so who am I to judge? Drinks are good, there's floorspace for dancing, tables for lounging, etc. so that's all good too. But the big drawback to this place is for a rock club, the sound ain't that good, and the stage is super small too. Kinda limits the performers, methinks. And thus, 3.5 stars.
author: Drew S.

description:
For a great name like this ... the Make Out Room was a complete disappointment. 

I didn't MAKE OUT with anyone and that is rare for me at a bar and please please please get some new bar stools or get the ones you have repaired. My ass was numb from the wood base by the time I finished my only drink.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Alas, no one was making out when I visited, which unfortunately included me.  Still, there were delicious Makeout margaritas to be had, comfortable booth seating, and tinny and upbeat reggae music from I'm assuming the late 50s early 60s.  

Not enough people were dancing, but it was still a fun time.
author: Frank W.

description:
This place has strong, well priced drinks & fun music. I love it! You have to pay a cover most times, but if you're going in with a big group, you can usually work something out with the door guy.

I've always loved this place.
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
Whatever you do, do not under any circumstances sit at the seat third from the right (your right) at the bar. If you do, by fluke end up in this seat, you may find yourself, as I did, staring straight into the face of a ceramic head submerged in merky water. At first, this might not seem like a big deal. It is afterall, a mission bar with mutilated barbie dolls and random slightly disturbing chachkies as decor. But, the head will mezmorize you, it will distract you, and it will eventually traumatize you. It's not so much the head as its pock marked skin, glass eyes, and pacifire studded scalp that really get to you and give you nightmares for weeks to come... Beware the underwater head!! 

OK, now that that is out of the way. I had a nice experience here my first time. I went for a series called writers with drinks, which was pretty good. There were some people who just chose the wrong passages to read, ones that you couldn't really grab onto and chew. Others that were only mediocre, and others who had moments of brilliance in the midst of a lot of cliches and stream-of-consciousness crap. Some people definitely needed editors! Anyway, it was quite fun however to hear the readings, and the incongruous and odd introductions given to each writer. 

And the drinks were freakin cheap! Holy crap, 4 dollars for an absolute vodka cran, not bad!

I guess because this bar all hipstery, it's supposed to be too cool to care about nice decor or flooring or any of all that. The bar looks like it's a thousand years old, which is pretty cool actually, if they refinished it. The floor looks like a high school cafeteria from twenty years ago, and the ceiling is definitely the same wierd holy cardbord crap we had at my elementary school, but hipsters don't care about that!

Anyway, if you heed my advice and stay away from the submerged head, you will no doubt have a good night of cheap drinks here, and walk away a little more hipsterified.
author: Jeani H.

description:
I saw a friend's show here and we had a really good time! It's a great place to see someone play as it's the perfect size - not too big and not too small. Dark inside with comfy booths; great dive feel. Cheap drinks and specials: I love the Maker's Manhattan. After one of those I was dancing my ass off...and I am no lightweight. Bartender was slammed as he was alone behind the bar, but he kept his cool and remained polite. 

My favorite thing about this place is the random art they have on their walls. If this painting hadn't been like 6 ft. tall, I would have tried to carry it out with me. Three of the cutest animated snails I've ever seen painted on wood and then lacquered -  I think. Amazing. I took a picture of it in hopes to recreate something similar in my own hand. Yeah, I'll let you know when that happens...
author: Jenny S.

description: I find myself going here almost every weekend.  Perfect blend of bar and dance space.  No cheesy club vibe.  Interesting array of people.  LOVE IT.
author: J. Tyner R.

description:
My favorite dance venue in SF. The dance floor is a reasonable size, and so are the drinks -- a margarita served in a pint glass can last me all night. The door is usually a reasonable price (typically $5-$10 or free before 10pm).

The calendar bookings are eclectic, which can be a good thing but sometimes not so much. Check the website first so that you know what's happening any given night. Still, even if it's not what you expected, you are in the Mission, so there are many other places to check out.

Friday night with Tom Thump is the best!
author: Skye C.

description:
I had so much fun last night. It was PACKED. Music selection was great but the DJ needs to practice a little on his mixing. Drinks were not expensive but also not anything special. 2 kettle sodas, a cosmo, and a sudwerk were $21. Purty good for SF.

There were 2 bartenders and it was a bit challenging to get attention at first, but once they saw you they were really friendly. 

Lots of hipsters minding their own biz and really friendly people interested in engaging in conversation and dancing. I think I shall be back.
author: Annie T.

description:
I went to a show here called GetMortified, it was hilarious. The Makeout Room itself, well I cant really judge it, since I was only there during the show. But I give it 4 stars for the strong, yet, cheap drinks and great show.

I would suggest arriving extra early since seating (if your going to see GetMortified) and parking is limited. The parking garage across the street was even full.
author: Anastasia H.

description: I've realized that make-out room is a sure thing. always good music. always a fun scene. strong drinks.
author: Jessica M.

description:
It would merely be mediocre if not for aforementioned Writers with Drinks.
So an extra star for that.  I look forward to attending a Mortified as well.

It is too hot!  And the DJs are hit or miss.  As is the crowd - I've been there when it's packed and when people are scarce.  Both on Satudays.
author: laura g.

description:
I played a show here a while ago.  The bartender was one awesome lady.  I asked for a double Jameson on the rocks- she poured my whiskey into a cocktail glass to the very top!  I mean tippy top.  I think I just fell in love.  Also, she got us another gig from saying nice things about us.

One downside- 1 Bartender = long wait for drinks.   

The decor is silly but fun.  Like Jack P down there, it's prom-like (though i never went to a prom, I've seen plenty of movies to justify the comparison)  Unlike prom however, there is a giant bear skin hanging from the wall.  Bears are my favorite animal.  Mega points, unless I hear that the bear was killed unkindly.
