Post playing there was a DJ.  He killed.  I'm not much of a dancer, in fact I fucking hate it.  But this guy knew what he was doing and he got me out there, cuttin' the rug like a drunken idiot.
author: Denise C.

description:
How to ruin what could be an amazing music venue: 

1. hire a sound guy who shows up late, starts the bands late, then cuts the bands' sets short to accomodate the dj. 

2. watch as the sound guy produces a terrible mix in what should be a very nice-sounding room, then turns his back on the stage and chats up girls at the bar (he actually told me he was "multi-tasking"). 

3. proceed to alienate just about every worthwhile artist in the Bay Area because said sound guy inexplicably hangs on to his job, despite having his name mentioned in many circles as being impossible to work with. 

Ugh.  This is such a great room to play and such a nice place to see music, yet this guy is so incredibly useless and arrogant that he finds a way to ruin virtually every show I've seen here.  My advice: try to come see music at the make-out room when he takes a night off. 

Word on the sidewalk is: the nefarious sound guy got his job cuz he plays on some amazingly well-regarded indie rock record...which might mean something in L.A., but DUDE, in the Bay Area, all that means is you babysat the poodle belonging to the mother of the brilliant songwriter and he let you play rhythm guitar on a few tracks. Please come back to earth and realize that, although you DO have REALLY nice hair, the artists in the Bay Area actually LIKE each other and try to help each other succeed.

It's called community.
author: Good Food Lover V.

description:
I just performed here two nights in a row, in "Mortified" and I loooooved it. The decor is nouveau-disco meets intergalactic birthday party, which makes for a ridiculously fun vibe no matter WHAT you're doing. 

The service was consistently good, and - extra bonus points - my Spanish red wine was served in a tumbler, which is how I drink it at home, and definitely how I prefer to drink wine in a bar. (Stem wear plus tight crowd plus drunken stumbles inevitably leads to a broken glass.) 

Crowd was amazing, both during the shows and hanging out afterward. Friendly, supportive, excited to be there. It made for two perfect Friday and Saturday shows. 

I haven't been here, other than to perform, and I'll be heading back ASAP for some daaaaancing.
author: Sara A.

description: Chill and friendly atmosphere, not sketchy.  Just people wanting to dance.
author: Stacey B.

description:
Was dragged to this place on Saturday by a friend who absolutely LOVES salsa dancing here and has been begging me forever to go. 
The dancefloor was happening, drinks weren't overpriced but took too damn long and thinking about the sleaze-factor still makes my skin crawl. I'm pissed I paid a cover to get sweated on by a macho asshole who kept insisting (after I told him that yes I have one and I'm very happy with my bf)  "once you sleep wit a latin man, you never go back". 
They got their furniture off the side of the road and the bathroom was filthy. 
The second star is for the fact that a little of the music was good, and a little of the crowd was cool, but I should have omitted it for the stupid name.
author: Allie S.

description:
Good ambiance and cute people. Good drinks at good price, and cool music offered by a couple of DJs when I was here. Great night. 

But .... please please please guys, remove that bear skin of the wall. Are you proud of killing those beautiful animals ?
author: Javi V.

description:
MAN I love the make out room. Awesome service, really cool chics and good music. Although the deejay plays mp3's from his Dell, his choice is pretty diverse from Bhangra to hiphop to 80's. I like the crowd here, very casual, party loving.

make out room is all about having a good time. Oh, and you can also make out as much as you want as half of the lights are always off.
author: Sav B.

description:
I went here with a friend to catch the Mortified show, which we sadly missed. The venue itself was fine, although while sitting at the bar, I constantly felt like people were hovering over me (more than the usual), invading me and my friend's personal space -- but maybe that's more the crowd, and less the venue.

My main reason for the 2 stars? The music kinda sucked. It was a convoluted hodgepodge of genres that collectively weren't danceable imho...maybe they're going for eclectic? I don't know.
author: Joyce S.

description:
Make out room....I pictured lots of  couches and  dark  intimate corners.... soft lighting.....lounge music......sexy......

NOT!  This place looks like a badly decorated Shriner's Hall. Seriously surreal room. But....

Really cool bartenders, cheap-ass good drinks, fun crowd,  scziophrenic DJ. (the music was all over the place- if you don't like the type of music playing: wait a minute. Likewise,  if you do the like the music playing: wait a minute). My big bitch for the place is there is only one stall in the ladies room. Come on! 

While not at all what I expected,  I like it. It is a really chill, fun place to spend some time with friends. 

However, I was never tempted to make out., damnit.
author: Laurie A.

description:
Okay--I live up the street from here, but nary am I able to muster the mental strength to make it past the crowded bar area to the dance floor. 

However, the other night, the DJ saved my life.  My roommate and a friend cruised on by the bar, requisite hipsters hanging in front smoking cigarettes.  Wafting out of the bar were the sweet sweet sounds of Hall and Oates.

The tune?  "I Can't Go For That."  Now, rarely do I like to exhibit my penchant for Hall and Oates, and god forbid in public.  Yes, I may wander through Walgreens buying soap and toothpaste, and all of a sudden I start singing along to "Maneater" or perhaps "Your Kiss (is on my list)", but I don't know anyone who shops at Walgreens at the same time as me, so Muzak-Karaoke is safe.

But there was something about the strangeness of Hall and Oates coming out of all places the Make-Out Room.  It's as if the San Francisco Symphony started taking over Zeitgeist, and instead of participating in their loathsome renditions of Metallica, played "Nixon in China" by John Adams.

So there we were, in front, and I just had to go in.  Splitting the group of hipsters, pushing through the group of yuppies (one of which included 5 frat boys and 1 woman--which had trouble written all over it) we made it to the dance floor.

Oh consummate DJ!  How he spun that evening!  It was blissful!  Especially hearing some old Salsoul records, of which I've never even heard in a gay club.  Talk about irony.
author: David S.

description:
So this place stirs controversy, but here's how I see it:

1. if you're here to drink some drinks and dance dance dance it's great.
2. if you're here to meat market and to get freaky on people, it's not that great (albeit the name).

It's a kinda funky, eclectic music that really is for dancing, not freaking or making out, sorry. They keep the music diverse, it's really awesome to dance, and you really feel like the people there are just there to dance too. And there's room to dance (wow, what a novel idea). So I had a blast, with the man, who had a great time getting down to the funky music too. For those who just want to make out, it may not be the best fit :).
author: May D.

description:
4 stars for drink prices (happy hour until 10pm daily!), a hilarious high school prom in the 90s type décor, lots of seating and cool venue to see My First Earthquake play. 

Minus one huge star for the dj that went on after the band. Reggaeton? Uh ok. Oh now you're playing salsa? WTF dude take a look at the crowd - post indie rock show. We left after bearing the dj for a couple songs.
author: Wendy T.

description:
FINALLY! I made it to the make-out room. This time we had a group of 25+/- people. I didn't feel that we should all pay a 5 buck cover since we would be spending about 10-20 bucks on booze. So i whipped it out in public, that right, I showed the door man my awesome spanish speaking skill. He made us an awesome deal and we pretty much paid a dollar per person. Some skank ass ho's were trying to sneak their way into my group, and I said, HELL NO! I went home alone that night.

I like the weird two headed sheep art thing they have. People were doing blow in the bathroom. Drinks were being bought for moi. Latin american music was being play and danced to. It was Crazy fun. my friends made friends... The last thing I heard was "This guy distributes gay porn" and then I didn't see my friend tolu for a while. She likes that kind of stuff.

I'd come back...
author: danny e.

description: Cool music.  Latin dance hall that was thumping the whole time we were there.  Interesting folk who all seem to be pretty mellow.  I can live with a $5 cover charge because the drinks inside are tasty and reasonable.
author: Lucius M.

description:
5 dollar pitchers of PBR.
PITCHERS... not pints.... PITCHERS!
at this point, i fuckihg hate new york and i fucking love san francisco.
the end.


but seriously, this place has amazingly priced happy hours, good music, shiny things hanging from the ceiling, and good stand up comedy once in a while.
amen.
author: Helen N.

description:
The make-out room does not have any dark, secluded alcoves, no soft red plush booths, no barry white or marvin gaye on the jukebox. It is not a good place to make out.

It is, however, a good place to see your friends cousins band while drinking inexpensive drinks (happy hour lasts until 9 or 10) and enjoying a generally relaxed atmosphere. The sound system is not great, and the place doesn't hold that many people, but that's alright; bands that require great sound and large capacities do not play here. Only your friends cousins band thats playing one of their first gigs ever. Help them out and buy a cd. 

During awkward lulls in conversation with the friend of a friend that you just met that night you will look around and notice the tinsel and mylar hanging from the ceiling, the disco ball, the bra rack thing, the bearskin and antlers on the wall, the gorgeous 40s era bar itself, and the vintage victorian crown moldings. This detail will remain in the front of your mind for weeks to come; you will remember the make-out room as a bar with excellent crown moldings.

You will still stop by from time to time when you're in the neighborhood or when your friends band is playing.
author: matthew r.

description:
Somehow my personality really jives with this place. Came last night for a comedy show/benefit for a slain Iraqi comedian put on by Laughing Liberally (great stuff) and Reporters Without Borders and had such a great time.  

A good joke from the night:  "We should adopt our policy on Iraq from The Clash.  What about an exit strategy?  'If we go, there will be trouble...If we stay, there will be double!"  heh heh. 

It was so funny that when I ordered a Jim Bean and ginger ale and the bartender gave me a greyhound, I didn't even care!  Happy hour ran  until 8pm.  My drinks were $3 each. Hootie hoo.  Crowd was fab and typical Mission with a friendly and political slant.  
I also like the decor and weird-ass art and red walls.  It makes me feel calm and peaceful.
author: Sid D.

description:
Love the decor here, the STRONG drinks, and the non-"sceney" Mission crowd.  There's a night called kissing booth (I think it's on Thursdays) that's absolutely amazing. It's a fun mix of new electronic and rock stuff (that's not cheesy!) and cool, danceable eighties stuff. Everyone always seems to be having a blast. 

Highly recommended!
author: Sadie S.

description:
I went to the Make-Out Room last night for a friend's birthday and it was gay/lesbian night, which I enjoy from time to time. Sadly there are always some good looking guys that I fawn over and try to seduce but despite my efforts I alway strike out. 

Surprisingly there were a lot more ladies/woman/broads than men, about 80% of the sweaty bodies in the room had a vagina. At one point, my friend and I were scanning the room from potentials for him, and this is what happened:

Him: Ohhh, what do you think of him? 
Me: Oh he's cute. Nice smile, and I like the glasses. 
*Us peering to get a better look*
Him: Uhh...ohh wait...there's something...
Me: Are those...does he.....have moobs?
Him: Oh wait...that's not a guy...
Both of Us: Ohhh.....no.  

Other than that embarrassing tidbit, I found that my Make Out Room experience was just mediocre. 
Only one stall for the women's bathroom - minus one. 
Dance floor being wet and slippery - minus one. 

**Edit - Earlier I had said I would not be returning back to the Make Out Room, but in the end I can't deny it - I had myself a pretty  good time.**
author: MJ T.

description: Drinks were good and strong! Cash bar only. Great crowd of people. Music was HELLA weird.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Nice place, nice music... and cheap drinks ! A good way to spend the night, I will recommend to avoid margaritas or mojitos - they are undrinkable. Stick to the beer or soda !

The men's room is interesting, the latrine is a inch away from the basin you can wash your hands while peeing so you won't waste anytime !
author: Matt W.

description:
If you have friends visiting from a city that's not as cool as S.F. that like to drink, dance, and party but don't like the idea of actually putting effort in dressing up or looking attractive THAN 

MAKE OUT ROOM IS THE SPOT!

DID I MENTION 2 DOLLAR PBR'S.
author: Justin C.

description:
I love playing shows at the make out room, however, wasn't so thrilled with the sound man last time I played (Chris).  He showed up at least 30 min late.  We were all set up for a sound check but when he finally showed up he said there was no time for a sound check so we had to take our equip off the stage so that the first band could hurry up and begin their set (also without a sound check).  He wasted both of the bands fucking time and i just found it rude and unprofessional.   I'd play there again but this time when the booker says to be there at 7pm for our sound check i'll be sure to ignore that and show up right before we're supposed to play. 
I will say, the cute door girl was very nice as well as the blond bar maid (didn't catch her name)
author: Mariel M.

description:
New favorite bar in SF. The first sentence is essentially the review. 

So many times, so many places I've past, just curious to the booze. In fact this is the only time I've stopped and said, "you can't cross the street without a drink." 

50/60's deco gloss wood bar; Classic look of a narrow bar with a red-curtian stage, faded murals, etc. all with 60's/70's motown/soul music. A dance floor faded in with some idiots. Tons of great classic cocktails. Awesome-ness.  -Glad I stopped.
author: Jake H.

description:
stiff drinks
dim lights
good shake your ass music
disco ball
candles
sexy vibe
one bathroom stall for a perfect drunk make out session, or a I am too drunk about to piss my pants session..........
author: Eryka V.

description:
Four stars for hosting "Writers with Drinks", the best literary awesomeness for under $5 in SF. (see URL below for more deets)

It's always a party at the Make Out room, the decorations aren't seasonal they are seasoned! Not exactly oodles of seating, but the booths are big enough to support your friends and also making new friends. The drinks are stout enough to hold up a straw and the crowd is dare I say, eclectic? Also the stage is right on the dance floor which makes for the fun of bumping elbows with all the cute ones. 

Take public transport bc parking sucks. Be nice and keep up the friendly vibe. Call before hand to check out the music for the night bc, dare I say, it can be very eclectic.

http://www.writerswithdrinks.com/
author: Miel H.

description: Maybe it was an off night, but I got the Austin Powers vibe from this place when I was here last Thursday, and not in a good way.  It was '60s night, and the crowd was bizarre and the music was bad.  How is anyone supposed to make out with anyone else in this mess of a place?  Everything about the Make-Out Room is just plain awkward.
author: Kira K.

description:
The MakeOut Room is my favorite kind of bar. Unassuming from the street, dark, cheap, dirty. With the added appeal of lingerie strewn about. 

The kind of bar where a "double" is really a triple. Which is good, because you'll need to be wasted to appreciate the mostly wretched bands that play shows here. Still, a strong drink, sultry darkness and a band you can laugh at makes an excellent place for a first date.
author: Megan W.

description:
As we sat in our seats, waiting for the show to start, I pondered the ambiance of the Make-out Room.  Dark walls.  Long Bar.  Intimate booth seating.  Disco ball and other shiny accoutrements hanging from the ceiling.  Small stage big enough for a king size bed.  80's pop booming on the sound system.  And that's when it hit me.  

I want to live here.  

(BTW... The show, Mortified, was freaking hilarious.)
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
I have a love-hate relationship with the Make-Out Room. The bar rocks pretty hard but one of the bartender ladies is a rancid bitch. She gave me some serious 'tude when I ordered a long island... Are you really going to hate on me for being an efficient drinker? 

Additionally, do not expect any mixed drinks to come with straws... or mixed for that matter. When said long island was ordered, I could destinctly point out all the layers of unmixed booze. The beauty of the LI is not tasting alcohol and subsequently getting wasted. A straw would've done some seerious work on flavor impovement. 

Nevertheless Make-Out Room is an extra fun place and they play some good jams. I've just learned to bring my own straws.
author: C P.

description:
Make out room.  Awesome on Tuesday's with DJ Primo and friends spinng them slow jam 45 records.  It just sets the entire night.  There is no cover and they have $2 beers.  Hip friendly little bar mistress who can hold her own back there with some of the mission street creatures that tend to make their way in there sometimes.  I haven't been there on anyother night I imagine you get the great service 7 days a week!  My only complaint is a tiny one stall bathroom ladies.  But the huge mirrors make up for it.
Have fun see you on Tuesday!
author: Mother L.

description:
First thought:  "This place looks how a Bad New Years day hang over feels."

The tinsel hanging from the ceiling looks like someone forgot to take down the decorations from one bitchin' New Years Eve party (kind of like when people leave Christmas lights up year round, but don't turn them on).  This place is a perfect example of not judging a bar by its decor.  

My feelings immediately changed when the bartender told me my cranberry vodka (which was pretty damn strong) would cost me three dollars.  How great is that? Four stars great.
author: Julie M.

description:
Who doesn't like a weird vampire prom?? And seeing Jonathon Richman here changed my life for the better. The cool thing about this place is it's a fun Mission bar that's randomly hip without being completely overrun by hipsters.

But the Make Out Room is definitely a place that's best after a little buzz (I suggest a drink or three before at Revolution across the street) because then you can really get your dancing shoes on and kick it. Overall, highly recommended for a fun night.
author: Rachel H.

description: One of my favorite places in the Mission, MO is a great place to experience local talent. My buddy Brett performs there once in a while and those have always turned at well at this unassuming bar.
author: Michael G.

description: Another good bar/music venue in the Mission District!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Let's make some babies!

I'm not sure what to think about this place. 

Make-out Room, not so sure it appeals to me....
author: Stanley K.

description:
Pros: 
The nice bouncer who gave our group a discount on the cover. 
The attentive bartenders.
The amazingly strong cheap margaritas. 
The funky Mexican mariachi-ish, I don't even KNOW what kind of music that was, band.

Con:
The creepy bedazzled bejeweled sparkly deer heads on the walls.
(Ok who am I kidding, I was mesmerized)
author: Lauren B.

description:
As always, the revolution cafe was packed when we tried to go there, so we kinda wandered and searched for something else.  We see "The Make-out room" and at first we're like nah, that's probably some strip club or something, which we weren't in the mood for at the current time.  But then we're like, we'll maybe it would be funny to go to a completely sleazy place tonight, and a name like that certainly implies at least the hint of sleaze.

So we go in, and were both pleasantly surprised but at the same time disappointed to see that is actually a pretty cool hang out spot.  Chill atmosphere, cool booths, cool ceiling.  We ended up staying for a while, chatted, shared our hearts.  

Actually, the only thing we didn't do was make out.....dang.
author: Levi B.

description:
A friend of a friend said this place would be worth checking out, so on a friday, i would have expected better.

The setting was dark and reminiscent of a ski lodge, with the exception of the bedazzled deer heads on the wall. The DJ, who looked like he was doing a crossword for most of the night, was spinning loud brazilian style samba music while the crowd of 30-something suburban types danced like they were still in the awkward stages of middle school. I wanted to go home. Not worth it, especially if there is a cover.
author: Ian S.

description:
This place has a drink called the zephyr (lemon vodka, sake, and grapefruit juice, if you're interested).  My friend and I got here when it was pretty dead, which enabled us to have a fun zephyr-themed conversation with the bartender. It covered the following: greek gods, Amtrak, a comparative analysis of plane vs. train travel, the central location of most train stations in major cities, getting stranded in Iowa, the wisdom of accepting a ride from a random stranger in Iowa, unusual baby names, popular baby names, and whether it's a good idea to name your kid something that will be redundant to the names of 10 other kids in your kid's class.  Then we saw our friend's band play, and they were great.

Of course, this is a very specific experience unlikely to be replicated.  Ever.  So I'll give the Make-Out Room four stars based on coziness, the name, and the fact that they have a drink called the zephyr.  Because I'm pretty sure you could at least replicate ordering the drink.
author: Janna M.

description: Love this place! Wish there was something like it in L.A.  Eclectic crowd of music lovers and people who like to be out.  There's no specific dress code and there's plenty of seating if you wish to sit.
author: Evelyn T.

description:
The music is great, it's a comfortable, fun space, and they mix your drink EXACTLY the way you ask for it.

I don't know what other people look for in a neighborhood bar, but that about covers it for me.
author: Bee G.

description:
My friend M chose the MakeOut Room as the spot to throw a surprise going away party for our mutual friend, J. The awesome bit was that because we had organized the event in advance (and were bringing a very large group) the Make Out Room waived the $5 cover charge for our party. Hilariously, not for J who wasn't on the list because he didn't RSVP (obvi - it was a surprise - no worries someone covered him).

Ambience - The inside of the Make Out Room is adorable framed by the lush red velvet curtain up on the stage and the sparkly dangles hanging from the ceiling. There is a good amount of comfortable seating, although the banquettes look like they were salvaged from diner leftovers.

Drinks - Can't speak for the mixed drinks, because I'll never say no to $2 draft PBR.

Can't speak to the bathroom either as, by some miracle, I managed to get out of there without a visit.

Music - Inconsistent. There seemed to be two DJ's spinning and some of the music was awesome - at other times it was a little boring. There seemed to be a lot of people enjoying it though (maybe its just not my thing). Plus points for actual spinning vinyl and for the awesome dresser turned into a DJ booth.

It was a bit crowded, but not so much as to make it unpleasant. Overall, well done Make Out Room.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Came here for the Get Mortified show, which made it awesome. 

Drinks are disturbingly ... small? But HELLA strong. So it's a tossup! And it's hella cheap before 10. 

The show made this place awesome, so it gets 4 stars ;)
author: Emily C.

description:
This place gets a solid 3.5 - 4.0 star rating. They make good drinks, they play good music, and they have a good location.  However, there inevitably ends up being a cover charge for something, the drinks are a little pricey, and it gets way too crowded by the end of the night and you are lucky if you can squeeze into the bar to get a drink.

Come early, secure either a slice of bar of a booth and you'll have a great time.  Dance, drink, be merry.
author: Ryan G.

description: are the 5 stars due to the fact that i danced the night away or due to the fact that it was the 4th and last place i ended up at that glorious full moon filled friday nite.... (sigh) i will have to go back to find out.  Although I hated paying to get in, you should never have to pay to go to a bar/lounge in sf, i refuse (side note)  Anyhoot......after a few cocktails and a small skip and jump away from naps, el rio and all those places in between....makeout made my nite....music: fab, crowd: chill, drinks: hmmmm...not too sure......makeout just thinking about you makes me miss you...distance does make the heart grow fonder..... =)
author: Rita R.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the city, hands down!

Cheap drinks, always eclectic music, amazing people watching, and a good night had by all.

It's like a garage sale with a DJ....
author: Abby P.

description:
Went here to catch stand-up comedy (Iron Comic) on a Friday night.  The guy attending to the front door didn't catch people slinking in without paying, I was honest enough to pay the $7 cover.  I'm glad he let me in with my dinner though!  

MO Room is dark, and the ceiling hosts  New Year's Eve decor, such as glittery streamers and a disco ball.  There are only 6 bistro tables and one booth.  I arrived early, and I was thankful I did because I snagged a table for myself and a couple of my friends.  The show sold out and so it was standing room only, with a bit of pushing and shoving.  

The Roy Rogers (essentially cherry coke) was gross, but my friend enjoyed his whiskey + seven up.  I guess I should've stuck to alcohol that night.  This place didn't blow me away, so that's why I'm giving it 3 stars.
author: Vera D.

description:
I came to the Make Out Room after about 10 minutes at Medjool - we had some friends in town and Medjool was definitely not our speed.  I had never been to the M O R but thought we should give it a try... 

The guy at the door charged us $3 b/c there was a dj.  No big deal.  The bar is CASH ONLY - so, run down the block to B of A if need be... or, there's an ATM next door I think.  Good beers on tap, fabulous.

The space is really big and even on a Saturday night we were able to claim a booth for the night and groove on the spacious dance floor.  The crowd was tame and diverse, everyone was having a good time.  

I'll definitely come back here for a weekend night when I want to have a good time with good people and good music but want to avoid the "scene."
author: Alice H.

description: Interesting little place. Been here a couple of times, both nights were very different. First time, we were the only ones there. The place seemed too drab, and dirty. Second time it was packed. Some good music playing, and quite a lot of dancing. The drinks were a bit watered down, and it is a cash only place, so beware.
author: Gurpreet S.

description: I love this place! Too crowded-sure, but always with good dancers, it seems. Despite of what the name suggests, people come here to dance to great music. And, most people here CAN dance, which is refreshing. The NYE decor is always good in my book although I certainly hope that they haven't just been lazy... ;) Also, the $5 cover rocks, and I'm sure people would readily pay $10. Even the bouncer was personable here! Did encounter some sketchy characters at the bar, but oh, well, it's a bar/club. Will be back for sure as I haven't danced my butt off like this in a LONG time! My hat's off to the DJ! Really don't want to, but feel like I have to take off one star for the place being way too crowded. We had a fantastic time, but the first (sober) 30 mins of being shoved around were quite a bit uncomfortable. I think they should revisit their suggested capacity guidelines, but I'll be back regardless!
author: Marina S.

description: The Make Out Room inspires all kinds of hot. Hot music. Hot drinks. And hot people after far too many drinks in. At least that's what happened to the 87-year-old man in the Adidas track suit.
author: Alex H.

description:
I want to like this place, but I don't.

One star for the $2 pints of PBR.
One star for the awesome decorations.

Other than that, this place blows. It's too small, it isn't very hip, and I don't understand why I have to pay cover to get into a joint so I can listen to crappy music that's way too loud and try to dance on an empty dancefloor.
author: James C.

description: $3 beers until 10pm, great live shows, and silver streamers that make it feel perpetually like New Years. One of my favorite places in the mission.
author: Dan W.

description: Next time you tag me in your post 'Stephanie is with Bob (pretend name) at the MAKE OUT Room', is going to be the last time we hang out. The Make-Out Room hasn't changed at all in years, its always the same laid-back, salsa dancing, smelly atmosphere, crowded nightclub/music venue. I can not recall a time where I had a bad time here. I really dig the Latino music and dancing, much better then other places to dance spanish music. They have Monday-Thursdays Happy hours from 6pm-8pm with $3 micro pints, $2 pabst pints, and $3 well drinks. I've been here for Latin, 80's, disco, reggae, folk jazz, samba, Indian nights, you name it. I wouldn't say this is the best play to bring out-of-towners, but definitely great for locals. Its two blocks away from Farolito, so you can get a late night burrito.Their website has the calendar for local artists they support, stop by for some dancing and check it out.
author: Stephanie M.

description: music sucks big time , but  something about the vibe makes you want to come back ,and the drinks cant be any cheaper , cheers
author: NAEL K.

description:
5 stars for "Mortified" this past weekend. Hilarious, pathetic, and exactly what I signed up for. 

On the other hand, the Make-Out Room is a poor venue. There were only a few rows of seats in the front, plus the booths and the bar for seating that was clearly inadequate given the huge number of people. That means my friends and I had to stand for the entire two-hour show. Also, you only get some mild visibility (between the heads of the tall people who decide that short people should never, ever see the stage) if you magically secure some seats at the front of the house; or else you'll be blocked by people standing. The drinks are ok-priced but it's nearly impossible to get the attention of the bartenders. 

I imagine it'd be a fun bar. Just get here really early if you want to sit and see a show.
author: Madeline N.

description:
FIVE STARS for being the venue for Mortified.

Minus one star for serving tiny, strawless cocktails at large, straw'd cocktail prices.

Minus another star for not having Diet Coke. It's geigh, I know, but I like my Jack with a splash of DC!

No need for me to return unless I'm in the market for more diary readings, which is actually pretty likely.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Come to Make-Out Room for the awesome events they hold monthly (Mortified, Writers With Drinks, Muni Diaries Live), the cheap weekday happy hour drinks ($5 PBR pitchers), and the dark-haired, skinny-jeaned, flannel-shirted hipster boys.  Or not, because apparently hipster boys don't take kindly to well-read, articulate Southern CA-bred girls who occasionally wear non-American Apparel dresses.  Just sayin'.
author: Christy J.

description:
My Make Out Room review is going to be pretty biased because of my very specific experiences with it, but this is easily in my top five bars in the mission - because of those very specific reasons.

Every Tuesday night, there's no cover, and they've got a couple of really amazing 50s/60s soul DJ's. My roommate and I lovingly refer to this incident simply as "Did you want to go to Tuesday tonight?" That's how serious we are about this routine. The music is amazing. The bartender is a sweetheart - attentive and fast. I only order beer (and they've got a decent selection), but from the looks of things she pours pretty heavy-handed.

We come in around 9:30, can still score a cheap pitcher (happy hour lasts until 10!), and we snag a booth and just listen to the music. The middle school dance decor is honestly just adorable.

My non-Tuesday experiences are also fantastic, but I don't think they're terribly indicative of a typical Make Out Room night either. One Wednesday not too long after the roommate and I moved here, we decided to drop in for a cheap beer. There was one other person in the bar. The bartender was great to us - as soon as we mentioned that we were fairly new to town, he introduced us to some of his friends, gave us recommendations on other places to go, and bought us each a shot. Such a great night. He was super attentive to us even though it eventually got busier.

We stopped in on another random night where there was a cover on a supposedly non-cover night. When we said that we honestly just wanted to grab a pitcher and didn't care about the show (which was true - it was some kind of awful stand up show), the doorman was kind enough to let us in without a cover if we sat right by the front. We had our one pitcher, sat at the two bar seats closest to the door and thanked the guy as we headed out. We really did just want a couple beers and an opportunity to sit and chat.

Even on inaguration night, when Tuesday was packed, we still got quick service. The crowd was a little much for me, but hey. Everyone was out celebrating - we knew what we were in for. Any time friends are in town over a tuesday, I love to bring them here. One of the weekly moments I most look forward to.
author: Jen R.

description:
What's not to like? 

Stiff drinks, low covers, bands, dancing, literary events, and spangles on the ceiling (moved around by strategically placed fans... now THAT's attention to detail). 

Okay, the name scares some people. I once told some timid gal to meet me at the make-out room and she said "What!?! I'm NOT going to a place like that!"

But really, it's not like that. It's a bar. It's a club. It's a whole lot of fun. 

Making-out  is entirely optional.
author: Jacob L.

description:
The bar, the drinks, the glittery streamers--eh.  (Although there was one big blinky star that we wanted to steal for our Burning Man camp.)

But the readings we heard last night--to die for!  We screamed laughing as 6 thirtysomethings read from the journals, love notes, screenplays, etc. they wrote as teenagers.  One floppy haired dude read from the diary--named Jane--that he wrote his first year in the Navy: horny young Americans defending this country in brothels across the South Pacific, except when they're falling asleep in front of the sub's nuclear reactor.  Sorry I can't do it justice.  But go see "Mortified" the next time it's at the Make-Out Room.

Caution--arrive at 7 to get a chair for this performance.  We didn't.  And it was very claustrophobic and sweaty in there by the time the show started at 8.  My pint of warm pear cider didn't cool me down either.

Again, 5 stars for show, not the venue.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Went here Friday with some friends. The music was awesome and the drinks were amazingly strong (to the point where I could barely drink my diet coke and rum around 1 am).

People were dancing like there was no tomorrow, people watching was incredible. 

Would def come back here again, paying cover kinda sucks - $5. Also it was pretty empty when I showed up although I heard it gets pretty packed/sweaty normally.
author: elissa w.

description:
I've always assumed that this was a sleazy club, so I've avoided it. 

When I actually stopped by to check it out the other night, I discovered it's not a sleazy club, but a tacky bar! A tacky bar with good music.  

So much pretty shiny stuff hanging from the ceiling! And shiny jeweled moose heads. And shiny fake Christmas trees. I love its gaudiness.
author: Maia B.

description: Make Out Room is Dan-ger-ous! Those drinks are stroooong, the dance floor is shaking, creating unforgettable (or not,depending on how many cocktails) nights. I recommend going there with close friends who you know will keep you in check!
author: nancy k.

description: I've been here twice, once with a group and once with just one other person, both were fun. The dance floor has never been super packed, but there are usually at least a few people out there, and the music is great, both times i've been there the DJ was spinning real vinyl and the music was super funky. I love the bar's decor, with all the fun ceiling decoration, mirrors, and decorated mounted deer heads. The layout is a little weird, with a very narrow entrance and seating booth area feeding into  the dance floor, so there isn't always room for a very big group, but between the bar and the back seating you can usually make something work. I would definitely recommend this place for groups who like funky dance music, and good, moderately priced drinks. It is also in a great area, close to a bunch of other bars.
author: Breese R.

description:
Went one time for a small magazine live reading. Thought it ended, but there was music being played by a D.J. then some gang bangers came in and they were kinda giving me a weird vibe...got rescued. What I do want you to know is that some chollos come out to check out the chickas here and better make sure you get someone to walk you back to your car. These guys were very, very scary...all five of them were waiting for us (my rescue-man and me) outside. Lucky we didn't get beaten up and robbed because he had a lucky parking space right in front of the place...phew...

Thank God that Trinidad and Tobago have such talented sweet men.
author: miriam b.

description:
There are streamers here. And glittery things. The way it's decorated is is Azriel from "Goth Talk" decorated your senior prom. 

Otherwise, it's fine. The only times I've ever been here is to see a friend play. She plays sensitive acoustic songs. Oh and I saw OCS and developed like the biggest crush ever on the drummer....who is also in Burmese.
author: Jackie I.

description:
So so bar, decent drinks... if a band gets on stage prepare to become deaf.... they need to work out their acoustics. SERIOUSLY. 
other than that this place is okay... better to come here nice and drunk already.. then it is a little more do-able.
author: jamie z.

description:
You can get a pitcher of PBR for only $5 at the Make-out Room during happy hour - at least when I've been, on Sundays. (Not sure if that's still called Happy Hour, or something else - but pre-band time you can get that deal.)

A fun place to see live local bands or DJs, and there's plenty of booths/tables plus a dance floor. As far as decor, there's a deer head, a bear rug, some Christmas garlands and a disco ball. It kind of feels like a high-school prom setting aside from the animal stuff. 

It's a nice place to grab a couple drinks with friends on a weekend afternoon.

Also in a great location in case you want to pop in for some inexpensive Pabst and then head down the street to someplace livelier.
author: Heidi G.

description:
It would be nice if this place was open like a regular happy hour supporting bar -- but the Make Out Room is a performance space, a "night club" if you will, not really a bar.  Viewed in this context it is superb.  One should know the band one is seeing as, like all venues with local musicians, it has its share of bad bands, awful DJ's and wretched dance nights, but not as many as most.

The space itself really shines however, an actual dance floor, a stage visible from the bar, good decor (nice paintings as well) and excellent/attractive bar staff.  The bar even has some nooks where one can make the club live up to its name, though I don't approve of this practice as being one of those tonsilly couples is always pretty tacky.

Finally one will not be ripped off at the Make Out Room!  You know how "bars" with shows often pour small, watery drinks (think the Fillmore...) and charge too much for them? Well this will not happen when you put yourself into the hands of the Make Out Room, drinks are always doubles it seems, well made, and within the standard Mission price range.
author: Gustie L.

description:
A few friends and I went on here on a thursday night, which happened to be Kissing Booth Night. It was great. I love this bar and can't wait to go back. The music selection was a combination of indie, girly, & alternative rock and a few oldies from the 60's and 70's. My fave!! I was singing the entire time I was there, it rocked.
The decor is ridiculously fun and very festive, this bar has a lot of character.
author: Pearl M.

description: They know how to make a stiff drink without skimping on the alcohol.  That's for true.  Every time I go there it seems like the music selection is always "ironic" in that it's intentionally not good enough to genuinely move to and that every hipster on the dance floor is being satirical, by flailing their arms and jumping around like their testing out gravity for the first time.  I dunno.  If you don't have rhythm and want to take a piss at it among the like minded, this is your spot.
author: Marquita N.

description:
Ive gone a few times.. the last time I went, the Bartender was rude to me and the 2 lady friends I was with.  Even worse, he made us weak jack n cokes...  

I wanna like this place, cause its cool inside.. but there's plenty of other good bars out there that deserve my business and provide good entertainment,,

i haven't been to this place since my last experience a few months ago.. and don't plan too.. i have no time or money to waste on a coke and a dash of whiskey..
author: Georgio S.

description:
OK, I don't have a problem with cash only bars, but i wish there had been a sign or the bartender would've mentioned it to start. I order up m drinks and when i go to pay i realize i'm up shit creek.  the only atm in the bar is broken, of course, and luckily my friend has enought cash to spot me. Guess I won't be getting this round.

This was definately a dive bar, and reading other reviews I wish it would have been indie night or hip hop night. As it was, I'm not exactly sure what night it was, there was some old school hip hop, some michael jackson, some reggaeton, some techno. 

I think this place has potential, it just has to be the right night.
author: Lindsey P.

description: I've been to the Make-Out Room several times over the years, both as a performer and spectator, and always had a pretty good time. The split-level stage is weird, but the drinks are reasonably priced, they have some good beers on tap, and they have plenty of old-timey cocktails if you want to get fancy. I also like the decor and the interesting artwork on the walls.
author: Jami W.

description: Sadly I have never made out in the Make-Out Room.  I have enjoyed the surprisingly cheap drinks and good music, and have danced my ass off. But, as of yet, no making out. Sigh.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Once upon a time, when my ass was high and my face was flawless, I loved to do some serious underage drinking (and making-out) in Mission bars (well, any bars, really) but especially the Makeout Room. So, after many years away from the Make-Out, at a friend's urging, I made my way over last night. Oh how all the fond memories washed over me like a sea of vodka and soda. My youth, my youth! I've finally found you. Right where I left you. And you look hot!
The venue is never-changing. Gritty, kind of dirty, but charming as hell. I love the beaded ceiling, the crusty bartenders, and the strong cocktails. I love the rickety bathroom where I used to self-consciously apply way too much makeup and I love what I can only assume are the "regulars" hunched over the bar, fruitlessly attempting to engage the ladies in conversation. The crowd here has never changed either, as far as I can tell. Still straight MH (Mission Hipster) crowd, but old-school MH, minus all the attitude the new generation has. 
It's never going to be my regular spot. In fact, I probably won't be back for a long time, but it sure was nice to take a stumble down memory lane.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Although I had been here before a few times, I went on a date to see "Get Mortified" at the Make-Out Room last night.

If you are unfamiliar with "Get Mortified" it is a performance currently making the rounds where people in their 20s and 30s get up on stage and read excerpts from diaries, poems, songs, etc. they wrote in their teens.

Apparently some people find this performance entertaining and funny.  That's cool.  I did not.  No matter how much beer I poured down my gullet.  

And, speaking of beer, this is my first complaint about the Make-Out Room:  They don't have a pilsner on draft.  Hey, I'm no beer snob.  I just want a lighter beer.  

The last couple years I've found Stella Artois, Pilsner Urquell, Trumer, and similar pilsners are much better suited for drinking when going out because you can have a number of them without getting completely sloshed. 

On the other hand, if I drink a few Sierra Nevadas or similar ales/lagers I quickly get this dazed look in my eyes and will head like a zombie towards the nearest taqueria, shove a burrito down my throat, and the proceed back to the house for sleepy-time leaving my friends to say "um... where did Mark go?"  

For those who are thinking "Dood, they totally have PBR on tap.  For realz!"  I'm sorry, I know it's hip and trendy to drink Pabst (actually, it was hip and trendy to drink Pabst a few centuries ago - you hipsters need to find a new rotgut beer to deem as "kewl") but I drank plenty of rotgut when I was a kid.  Of  5 or 6 years old.  So, I will forego the rotgut as an adult, thank you.

The actual space of the Make-Out room is good.  There is a narrow part when you first enter the bar - the bar itself being on the left and a few booths on your right.  It can be a bit crowded here.  But, then the place opens up quite a bit towards the back.  

The place is dark.  As a dive bar should be.  The decor is ok.  There is a lot of red and black, if I recall.  These are good colors and the staples of any decent dive bar.  

However, there is a disco ball and all this sparkly, Christmas-y tinsel and shit hanging from the ceiling that makes it look like you are at some cheesy-ass wedding, high-school prom, or that work xmas party where you banged your co-worker and the gossip about your faux pas was still going strong into January and you had to resign.   

These "decorations" need to be ripped down, preferably by a powerful, rated-for-industrial-use 10hp weed-eater, and deposited in the nearest dumpster.  Moreover, some of the things hanging down from the ceiling look exactly like fly paper.  Really.  They even curl up at the ends just like fly paper does.  And that, my friends, is simply disgusting.

On a positive note, the bartenders are skilled and I don't recall ever having to wait long for my Sierras (revisiting the beer thing again, I was secretly glad I was "forced" to drink Sierras last night because I *wanted* to get sloshed in order to somehow derive some entertainment from the show, my surroundings, my date, or even the random stupid little thoughts in my head).

I hear there are some good DJs, bands, etc. here and it probably would be a good place for that because of the large open area in the back.  

Nonetheless, strictly as a bar, to go and drink, it is not someplace I would head to.  Mostly because of the flypaper and Christmas-y decorations (did I tell you I H8 xmas?  Yes, I absolutely do).  

Points for darkness and good service though.

2 and 1/2 stars.
author: David M.

description: Extra star for making me feel every night is New Years Eve.  Minus a star for cover on a Wednesday....
author: Stephanie B.

description: Oh my goodness, what a cute little place. I have to remember to come back here in the future. It's decorated like "a school dance" (my friend said this) or a New Years Eve party. The tunes being played on this particular Thursday night made you feel like you had time-warped to the TV show The Wonder Years. I'll be seeing you in the future!
author: Jonny A.

description:
came here for a litPAC (litPAC organizes progressive readings with great authors and the money raised goes to support democratic candidates: http://www.litpac.org/) benefit last night.  it was good.  not as good as the time that i heard some lady read vampire lesbian erotica here.  that was probably the hottest i've ever been in public without actually having sex in an alley.  or maybe not.

megan w's right...any crap band can play here.  megan, want to go down there with a harmonica and a saw and see if we can get onstage?  actually...really want to?
author: Laura B.

description:
great little place to go for salsa dance. the music is always good and the crowd is decent.

tip....get here early if you want to snag a table.
author: sarah w.

description:
last time i visited the make out room, i sat next to matt gonzalez at the bar and analyzed the mystique of his greasy hair. i should have asked him what he planned to do after his stint as sf city supervisor and if he planned on pursuing politics as gavin newsom's uber-liberal doppelganger, but he looked like he wanted to be alone with his booze and watch the writhing 20-somethings dancing to world music. 

i've always had a good time, and not much making out by me here, but definitely cheap stiff drinks and decent conversations.
author: May T.

description: A great bar, a cool nightclub, I've seen some great local bands rock the night away. There is a cover on a lot of nights, but typically not during the early evening (before 9pm). The front bar is great for meeting up with friends, while the more spacious area in front of the stage is perfect for taking in a show. The crowd is definitively Mission hipster, in a good way.
author: Nish N.

description: I remember the good old days (aka last year) when they had dollar PBR from 6-8. Those days are gone and thus, so are my visits to the Make Out Room.
author: Maria D.

description:
i remember the good old days when i would occasionally meet my friend maria d. here for dollar pbr on friday evenings (see her  earlier review). 

now i find myself visiting on fridays again, but later in the evening (yet always before 10 to avoid the $5 cover). almost every friday.

a friend and i have been on a continual quest for an honest-to-god quality early r&b/soul dance night. (help me, please!) so we wandered in somewhat randomly one night. we were impressed with the rotating djs with live drum accompaniment at first. some jackson 5, some grandmaster flash, but THEN:

the dj started spinning staxx singles with bowie bass lines mixed in. and it worked. song after song--from memphis to muscle shoals to atlantic in new york to detroit. it was like being on my porch with a live drummer. mind blowing.

i've been back continually since that night, although the music has yet to equal it in quality. they definitely mix in a lot of the typical top 40 dance hits you can hear anywhere, but they also play some good hip hop and the fore-mentioned blends.

bartenders here are really, really nice. (i've started to make friends with one.) pours are solid to debilitating.

the fairly sparse clientele is a mix of very low-key, mostly older, dedicated regulars, dykes (who always know how to dance), mission hipsters of the dorky variety (who sometimes know how to dance, if they're girls, and never know how to dance but do anyway with great and shameless enthusiasm, if they're boys). And of course there's a semi-regular invasion of bridge-and-tunnel types, who never know how to dance, or else specialize solely in the white-girl-whole-body-shake. come on. you know exactly what i mean.

straight guys are rarely overly aggressive, but rather prefer the "i'm going to just stand here passively near you while you dance because i would like to dance with you, or at least take you home, but i'm a hipster betamale and so will never make the first move until you've really, really demonstrated some interest" routine. herding mentality rules, but that works out in some unexpectedly pleasant ways:

this place never gets crowded to capacity. which means that when the bar area is crowded, the dance floor is empty. all for me.  when the dance floor is filling up, the surrounding tables and bar are empty. for me.  mostly it's all pretty empty, which is another reason i come.  

and the bartenders are really, really nice. also, the nice guy i used to see at my old video store comes here to play pool. that has to be a good sign.
author: jen s.

description: the make-out room wants you to make out, but instead you'll have fun dancing till 2 to music that's good- especially when Vanka spins! upgrade, definite upgrade! Whenever I have gone, I've enjoyed myself-heat hot and feelin pretty after shaking my hips.  Drinks are good, bartenders are friendly and local. the only minus is if you do go on a saturday  night, you might get stared down by some token wierd guy (you know they're all over the city) who has  nothing better to do than stare. do what I do stare back. they're harmless monkeys. the rest of the crowd is pretty laidback and just there to have a good time like you are. If you like music that sucks, say goodbye to the locals  having fun and head over to suite 181 and make sure the door hits you square in the ass.
author: J A.

description: We went here after a birthday dinner and I was pleasantly surprised.  It was very eclectic and the crowd seemed really nice, so it's a perfect place to go with a mixed crowd.  This music was interesting as it was all over the board, but I guess that means there was something for everyone!  I can't comment on the drinks since, while I know I had some, I can't remember what.
author: Sean O.

description: Come here with your pretty friend and sit under the pretty lights and drink a pretty cheap cocktail and they'll play pretty music but no one will dance because everyone's shy and perks of being a wallflower is everyone's favorite book in the whole entire world.
author: Ryan P.

description: I had a private party at the MOR and it went extremely well.  Thank you Amy, Rusty and the rest of the crew.    It was easy to organize and they all helped make it fun.
author: Vince D.

description: It's cool, nothing special though. My friends love it but I'm not impressed. They support local artists which is a plus.
author: Rayna A.

description:
The Good: the drinks were cheap and pretty strong, the music was okay, the crowd was not bad looking. The place had a nice cozy feel to it. 

The Bad: some a-holes got in a fight with 15 minutes to go before closing and then when that fight broke up, another bunch of idiots got in another fight. I don't get it. Oh and it was sorta funny seeing a bunch of Marina type looking girls dancing to Latin music on a Saturday night.
author: Hmmm W.

description: Great place.  First time I've ever actually even been in the MIssion.  The DJ was great (Thomas Thump), music selection was good as promised.  Drinks I heard were cheap since I don't drink.  Best of all lots of cute drunk hipster chicks.  But the best part of the nigt was outside while I was smoking a cigarette.  I had a girl outside approach me while smoking my cigarrettee tell me there was a party in her van, which was  parked across the street.  What that meant, I don't know.  FYI, I never found out
author: Tony K.

description:
i've yet to have a steamin' bout of lip locking here so i can't say it lives up to it's name.  sigh.  it's highschool all over again.  chuberella with bifocals and sweaty palms.

the layout is more new york city railroad apt.  i think i've schmooched my b**bs past many a striped shirt fella trying to get a drink at the bar while making my way to the small dance floor in the back.

the decor is more bad prom or rather the day after prom night.

i do like that there is a ledge on the side by the dj where you can rest your drinks and bar stools to rest your tootsies between songs.
author: Anh V.

description:
I've always had a good time here, whether I go for without-pants dancing (it was a theme night; wouldn't necessarily recommend this on standard evenings) or to see Writers With Drinks (laugh-out-loud drunk local authors reading excerpts). 

While the good, reasonably-priced drinks and friendly bartenders make this bar fun, it's really the decor that seals the deal for me. The ceiling is covered in outrageous postmodern-prom tinsel and disco balls, and there is a glowing demonic baby head in a fish tank behind the bar. How can it get any better?

Not only that, but every time I've gone, I've met someone entertaining. This is the kind of bar that puts people at ease and makes them friendly to strangers. I love it!
author: Geae D.

description: The price of the cover not always matches the quality of the music inside. However, the place is fun, the drinks cheap and the crowd interesting.
author: Ato B.

description: I feel like a schizo here...during the week its like your are in solitary confinement and on the weekends it seems like a zoo. Whats with having to wait 20 mins for a drink? Get an extra waiter and pay then the extra $10/hr so patrons can do other things than wait for a drink!
author: Vivek N.

description: I always have such a great time here! You feel as if you are in a new year's party here.  I love the laid back atmosphere and how everyone is just having a great time.
author: Jasmine K.

description: It's pretty good times here on a saturday night. From being thrown up in the air by strange latin men to being hit on by new yorkites who have friends with strange eyebrows....you'll enjoy yourself no doubt. The dj plays good tunes....a nice range of stuff that you never get bored or want to go sit down.
author: Emily L.

description: First Make-Out Room experience. Saturday night. $5 cover. Good DJ mixing some samba beats with hip hop. Plenty of booty shaking room on the dance floor. Strong drinks. Eclectic decor. Tables available for chill time. Pretty much everything one could ask for for a night out on the town. Will be back again.
author: Susan L.

description: Just came here to chill for a bit, nothing too crazy. I heard that it does get crazy on some Saturdays, but this Sat was under control with a decent vibe to it. They play mostly latin music (salsa-ish), so its not exactly my thing.. but they threw in Michael Jackson's Thriller and one or two other english songs mashed up with some spanish in there, which was cool. More reggaeton would be greatly appreciated though. Overall, decent vibe, busy bar. I'm guessing from what I saw and heard, the bartenders are extremely rude to some, but fine to others. My cocktail was good, so I'm not complaining. There is a cover, but I think its small.
author: Elaine H.

description: This is my favorite bar in San Francisco.  Laid back.  Good drinks.  Happy Hour til 10.  Mortified.  Live Chamber Music.  I have met many a cute boy here and I have definitely made out here.  4 stars because of the whack cover...even though I rarely pay it.
author: Alison O.

description: Pretty good venue for Writers With Drinks. Not enough seating, but the ambiance is pretty much just right. Crowd was eclectic - never been for a non WWD event, so it's hard to tell what it's normally like.
author: Dana L.

description: I like the name.  And I really like Club Neon, even though I've only been twice.  The most fun that can be had on a Monday night.  Top notch musical selections and fun kids.  I don't like it when my friends buy me the $2 drink that taste like hangover, though.
author: Coco D.

description: The second you walk into Make-Out Room, you get the sense that everyone lurking in the inside is more beautiful than had you passed them while walking down the street.  But here, fellow Missionites are united by the common bond of cheap beer specials, frothy glasses of Pabst and the love of great indie music which shines down onto the crowd as brightly as the beautiful red glow that is cast upon the walls and 70s era decor.  If you happen to be visiting with a lovely or significant other, be sure to slink back into the circular booths and be lost in a world of indie melodies and harmonies and no one will quite care that you are living up to the namesake of the place.  The feeling at the Make-Out Room is strangely inviting and should be a stop on any crawl through the Mission.
author: Taylor P.

description: I had not been here in quite some time and now I remember why. The decor screams "dive bar" while the patrons tend to be of the "cooler than you" crowd. The drinks are stiff, which is a positive, but I think that I would have to be totally drunk to say that this place is the end all be all of bars in the Mission when there are so many better places to go.
author: Miles T.

description: A favorite local hangout of mine...I fully enjoy myself everytime I am there.  Seriously, the make out room is H-O-T!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
This is for the STAY GOLD party.

Listen, I love the venue. I like the clientele (and love that there were some gay boys). For the single ladies: you can def do that creepster stare well all know and love here. People get ass. The music is only so-so. I'm a hip hop girl and I like my two-step. But, I guess I understand playing tunes for all the dance-music peeps. 

However, I waited 30 minutes for a drink because there were only 2 bartenders and 200+ people. Of the 8 people I knew there, that was the average wait. 

Also, when I left the place, my gf and I had this ringing in our ears for like days. And we like to party, so that means the music was hella loud- like health hazard loud. Even the bartenders were sporting ear plugs.
author: ascheras g.

description: The best part of going to the Make Out Room is the funny looks on my co-workers faces the next morning when they ask what I did the night before.  Sometimes I explain more fully. Sometimes I don't.
author: kiki d.

description: What a twilight zone-esque night I had there.  All these emo kids dancing to a dj spinning rap with a drummer accompanying him.  The cover was supposed to be $5 but we had 4 peeps so the bouncer let us all in for $10...and if you knew how much I hated paying cover you would know how much this wins my heart over.  Drinks were strong and cheap...there was room to dance and the bouncers weren't dicks when they kicked us out after closing.
author: Allison K.

description: Always a good show, it seems at the Make-Out. I've never seen something forgettable here and it's a great bar to boot. And the crowd is good, not over-drunk, and generally without much attitude. Is this still the Mission?
author: patrick g.

description: Went here last night for ladies night I guess you'd call it. For a Wednesday night it was popping off. Crowded, but not packed. People dancing their asses off. A lot of fun, interesting people were occupying the space, which has a really fun decor and large dance floor. Now for the cons: only one bathroom! And the DJs were kinda bitchy, would ask for some requests and they said 'Just go dance.' But cheap drinks, good music, fun crowd made for a memorable night.
author: S. M.

description:
I have had the pleasure of making it out to the Make-Out Room twice now and on both occasions I was afforded the opportunity to shake it all night long. The DJ's are simply blessed with truly demonic turntables-mash-ups of Mr. Jackson and your mother belching out the theme to Mash! It is simply just a wierd mix of readily available pop and the funk that your Mommy would love. Who the heck knows where these Disc Jockeys get their respectative wares but I am impressed! Hell...I love it. The Bartenders work fast and efficiently. I did make the mistake of not bringing cash, and as they only accept cash I was sh*%$# out of luck. Ahhhh...that "long" half a block walk to the ATM was devastating to say the least. (Think of all the drink time I missed!) Feel my pain and my sweat! If you like a bar/club where there are people who actually like to dance and do not care just how much of my salty liquid goodness gets on them...well then this is your place! 
One downside though...No Hangar One Vodka! 
Please do everyones' tastebuds a favor and drop the mass produced cleaning fluid and bring in the Hangar!
author: Andie F.

description: Despite the name, you can find great literary events at this spot. It's a little bland just to hang out, but they do a good job booking.
author: Seiji C.

description: ah, but I am so biased towards intimate setting with great crowd vibe.   Places like this gives character to San Francisco.
author: Sydney L.

description: Went to a show here last night. The bartender was friendly and their drinks reasonably priced. (Happy hours until 10 on Saturdays rock.) The look and feel of the place is also great. It's as if they put up decorations for a New Years party and then after the party they were like, "This actually looks really cool. Let's just keep it this way!" The small stage and intimate feel makes it a great venue for local bands though I have to agree with a previous review regarding the sound guy - he needs to get a clue. Otherwise, an enjoyable evening and I would definitely return.
author: Joshua K.

description: MAKE OUT ROOM!  That is SUCH a good name for a club.  And my bedroom.   I went there for the first time last night after a friend reminisced about her first legal drink being a pear cider at this establishment and was not disappointed.  I think I liked it so much because the lighting and decor was a little bit  fancy, but the overall delicious divey-ness still shone through (I'm not to an age yet where I can feel truly comfortable somewhere that isn't at least a teensy bit divey.  I'm just not looking for classy when I go out to spend my hard earned money on tasty drinks.)  I would go back here.  Over and over and over again.  I hope there's dancing the next time I go.
author: Claire T.

description: Relaxed atmosphere and unpretentious decor. The stage is a fun place to see different acts. Don't sit too close to the door or you'll freeze without your coat on -- they don't seem to close the door during performances.
author: Ellie P.

description: This is THE place to see Jonathan Richman.  The stage is raised high enough that you can see his signature hip-shake in all its glory.  I think the set-up causes people in the back to feel removed from the show, cause there tends to be an awful lot of talking from the back of the room.  Plus, its proximity to the Latin American Club makes for a great escape if the show is not to your liking.
author: L W.

description: beautiful funk tunes on a friday (the DJs were spinning 45s!) and cheap drinks. check your coat because mine got stolen :(
author: Ronny K.

description:
i always end up coming in here really late at night when the crowd is leaving. one of these days, though, i will arrive earlier. ho ha!

good music everytime i go though. gotta love a little midnight dance-down
author: Victor B.

description: I've seen a few shows here, but my new favorite night is Mondays.   The Classical Rev has moved here, and it's quite a scene to sit among red candles, watching classical musicians play under a disco ball.   The drinks are big and strong (individual mini bottle of champagne served with a wine glass, huge margaritas) and there's an interesting beer selection also.
author: laura a.

description: Similar to the opening band, the Make Out Room is average at best.  The cheap drinks definitely put a smile on my face, but I'm not entirely sure that I'm ready for a long term commitment.  Check out the full review with shenanigans at www.justinslive.com.
author: Justins L.

description: They don't have security inside, the place is ful, you can see people wondering around,trying to steal something, or looking for trouble
author: Rolando S.

description: What would be yet another Mission hipster bar is made unique by the live music.  I actually came here for Laughing Liberally...well, I laughed sparingly, but hey, gotta support the cause, right?  At least I drank liberally.  They're serious about cocktails here, even being listed in the Food Lover's Guide for their margaritas.  Lighting & ambience leans mostly towards the dark and red, with the semi-obligatory funky ceiling decor as well (see Latin American Club).
author: Wes M.

description: Every time I go to the Make-Out Room, I feel like I'm back at the prom! It's a must for the mission bar crawl night. I think its the space, and the dangling decorations (along with the many bras) draped from the tall ceilings that make it feel like making out is destined to happen! However, the Make-Out Room specializes in great shows. They feature good local bands and snuggly booths. I've always seen some good looking indie-rock looking guys there, but never made any moves. Perhaps it's me who needs to work harder at making the Make-Out Room come true!! smooch
author: Nicole L.

description: Sometimes a kiss is just a kiss, but Make-Out Room is always just a mediocre place.
author: John F.

description:
friday nite..good times had by all.  i really dug this place with its prom-vibe  and 80s influence.  the dj is perched high on a stage in front of a draping red curtain, which i half expected ducky from "pretty in pink" to jump out from.  i swear, had the dj spun OMD "if you leave," i might've cried.  it would just seem to fit with the silver streamers floating from the ceiling.  p.s. how could i not love a place that pimped out debbie deb?!

helen t's right..no pretentiousness whatsoever.  just good beats and fun people dancing their arses off.  (must be those strong drinks!)

UPDATE 04.15.07: much prefer the fri nite dj's over sat nite!  went back last nite and was not feelin the music as much.  will stick w/fri nites from now on!
author: Niki M.

description:
i ended up here on a friday night and it has pretty much everything i could ever want. we arrived around 10pm and was able to snag a table right away and although the decor is nothing to write about but who would even notice what with the happiest drummer in the world on stage, yes a real live drummer how often does that happen, the lady dancers doing their best to "get low", great dj who played a bit of everything including my two favorite dancing songs of the moment, sexyback and crazy, i was in dancing heaven. 

the drinks were ridiculously cheap and the bartender doesnt go light on the alcohol either making for a fun night by all. overall its a great place to go without the pretentiousness of most places and just people out to dance and have fun.
author: georgette y.

description: great place for drinks with bunch of friends.... plenty of space, and they attract cool bands during weeknights. Atmosphere is cool - def. has that dive bar feeling. One of my missio district oldschool favorite hangout.
author: ji k.

description:
I went here alone on valentines day was it yes, stag. I think stag means alone yes, it does. If I go out alone, I tend to not go out really late like 1 am. It's a new york/nJ thing.  So, the theme was dress in your underwear. Well, when in Rome!! I was looking for a bathroom to change at, but then change to get in my underwear sounded really weird.  So, no one cared, and really wearing underwear is no different than boxers which is no different than shorts.  

I had to catch up on my drinking to be fun, and I had two LI tea's. No one ever know what LI tea stands for, but I cant help it out of habit, it's Long Island Iced Tea. I went to college in long island my first two years before transferring to south carolina. Good move!

Anyway, you know how you bump into someone by accident, this girl thought I was hitting on her, and gave me a mean look. I am like your a bitch. So, she told her boyfriend, he told me to apologize in a bouncer type of way. Which I of course, would not.  So, he told me to leave. I am like the best I can do is walk five feet away. He said leave again.  Now, I am definitely staying. I have not been in a fight well a real fight, in 20 years I bet. But, I dont back down and my review has nothing to do with this isolated incident which could have happened at any bar. . 

The people at make out room are to alternative for me. I was hoping with the name it would be sexy, cool. As for seeing girls in underwear, there werent that many like 20. I didnt even get turned on, it's just not my scene.

The worst part is I am losing my tolerance to drink. I actually had a hang over from 2 drinks which is so disappointing, but then again saves a lot of money from the normal 5 to 7. Then, I cant find the clip or sensor to get into my apartment 3 weeks later. I am like where would a drunk person through his keys? Yet, I cant pay my apartment $50 for the new sensor.
author: Andrew K.

description: Warm beer.  Awkward transition to music. Otherwise not too bad. The crowd was ok. There just wouldn't be any reason for me to go here when I have the whole Mission area to choose from. Not nice enough to be worth dressing up for & dancing at, not divey enough to be comfortable. Maybe better if it's not a Friday night? or I'm not with a ton of wannabe lawyers?
author: Heidi P.

description:
I've been here too many times to count. Pretty shoddy dive bar overall. Bartenders are really nice, the doorpeople mostly are, though the Saturday night guy is a jerk. 
The real bummers though are the soundguy and the matinee show/DJ late night deal. Stupid. 
If you want to be a DJ place then stop hosting live music and rushing early shows. As soon as the last band was done, the bouncer started moving all the tables, including ours that was full of people and drinks, and rudely says "this is gonna be a dancefloor, move your drinks". I am at a table with three sweet smiling lovely girls, and you're a rude jerk? 
The WORST part, the soundman, who was apparently in some mildly popular indie band in the 18th century, yikes. Either he sucks at sound, or doesn't care, or both. He is also rude to musicians when he feels like it. Totally unprofessional and ruins the vibe for the band, which messes up the music, then the whole night. Crappy soundman domino effect.
Another crappy music venue further hollowing out an already hollowed out music scene. Thanks MO Room.
Oh, and no one wants to make out in there, not romantic, sexy or appealing. Seriously, if you like rude crappy staff at your dive bars, this is the place for you. Maybe you can just sit at the bar, with earplugs, and just dig the nice bartenders, who are extremely friendly. Why the discrepancy?
author: Joe B.

description:
it has cheesey, high school prom decor with the balloons and streamers hanging from the ceiling.  i'd probably have appreciated it more if the djs on saturday night hadn't been the worst mixers i've ever heard.  not only were the transitions between songs terrible, i don't understand why they went from one song to the next.  they'd start a good song, let it play for 30 seconds and then switch to some crappy song and play all 4 minutes of it.   

i've heard it's good on fridays so maybe i'll try it again.
author: Seong P.

description: Okay...so really, it's 2 stars only because it's definitely NOT my scene.  Went there with a couple gfs for one of their friend's bday parties and it's unlike any place I've ever been too.  They were playing like...underground hip hop/house type music which was pretty chill, but the crowd again, was just not my scene.  I totally get why people were having fun there though!
author: Cindy K.

description: I went to a rockin ass Mardi Gras party here last night, but as for the space itself, there is nothing too special about it. And they closed at midnight on a Tuesday. Lame.
author: Jessica W.

description: Came here for a show called Get Mortified. One of the most hilarious shows I've seen. Drinks are cheap but small but it's fine the bartendars pour heavy. The place isn't huge and the show gets packed but its a good vibe. After the show they played salsa music and we danced like we knew how to Salsa. We had a great time.
author: Hyung L.

description: Kinda a quiet place on a Monday night almost no one dancing at 10:30 PM.  But what would you expect for a monday?  Dance floor is vinyl and large.  The tables spill out into it so the dance floor is not protected.
author: Octous O.

description: Dance here, drink here, meet people here... no one cares what you do - it's all up to you. All I know is, it's always fun .
author: T O.

description: I give this place a solid 3.5 stars, but I had to round up b/c I somehow end up here somewhat frequently...so it must be cool right?  hmm... Well what do I like here?  Non-pretentious dancing, non-pretentious people, drink deals, consistent good time.  What do I not like?  sometimes creepos, intermittently good music, occasional cover.  It is a common end of the night haunt for me so let's just say this....it's my End Up.  Except for I never regret ending up here!
author: Caitlin J.

description: The Makeout Room has a fun, open vibe and a David Lynch feel going on with the decor. Also, the prices are RIGHT. Something like $5 for PBR pitchers during their happy hour, which is an extended period of time. One star of because I've received attitude from bouncers.
author: Kate A.

description: I have only been here once. I would totally go back, I just have been a very busy lady and getting to the Mission from all the way out in Oceanview is no easy task when you don't feel like trying to find a parking space and then hoping the whole time nobody is breaking into your car and stealing your umbrella from the backseat! Anyway, I came here for the Iron Comic session they have like once a month (or something like that), it was really good, very funny and entertaining. Afterward they had a DJ and a live drummer drumming along to the DJ, it was really interesting and made my booty shake profusely. It was not chaotic space at all, the bartender made me a drink called SNOT which was tasty, and this was the fateful night I finally learned about funcheapsf.com
author: Monica R.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco to see music. Not too big, not too small, good sound, and charming disco ball. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because they only have music on select nights.
author: Jaime B.
