description: Came here to listen to poetry on a Saturday night (April 11th). The readers were great. Charlie Anders was an excellent emcee/host. The rant on sexology and terminology was funny and prescient. The best reader of the night was from Atlanta (her name escapes me). Her insights and presence will not be forgotten. Thank you, Charlie, for bringing such a talented and interesting writer to the evening. The evening was a part of  Writers With Drinks and is a regular event on Saturdays between 7:30pm and 9:30pm. I highly recommend it. Seating is limited. The regulars came very early. If you don't mind sitting on the floor, it isn't a bad experience. Many people stood and listened, as well.
author: Joseph T.

description: I wish I could remember the names of the bands I saw here because they were awesome. We wandered in here on a random weeknight to see some really great twangy rock bands. Good drinks, great atmosphere and really good sound in this grungy little bar.
author: Michael E.

description: What a great name for a bar.  After a long absence my companion and I stopped in whilst waiting for a table at Dosa. Damn I love it when I ask for my whiskey on the rocks and it's served up in a highball glass. I really hate those pitiful little rocks glasses for this I will come up off 3 stars. M.R. is a great place to check out local music. We were fortunate enough to catch Feather Weight Champion of the World's sound check. Good Stuff ladies! Make-Out Room, I'll talk...
author: Mingus R.

description: Guaranteed dance party, no matter what type of music they decide to play.
author: Alicia J.

description: I love the Make-Out Room--a warm, cozy and friendly space that offers great music and even better margaritas. I mostly go for the tiki events that happen periodically, but I've seen some great bands there too. I always have fun at this place.
author: Kirsten B.

description:
this place does make you feel like you're at a HS prom, because there is a huge disco ball and silver streamers coming down from the ceiling.  it's pretty ironic too, b/c i happened to run into a HS friend the night i went!  i came here last night in search of good dance music, and it did not disappoint!  the night started off slow w/ some hip hop and funk, but as the night progressed, the dj spinned music that ran the gamut from soul, salsa, house, bhangra, etc, etc.  if you are in search of good music w/ little pretentiousness,  come here.

oh yeah, drinks are pretty strong too!
author: Helen T.

description: The bands are good...for something like $6 you can hear live music...and the drinks are shockingly strong and cheap--thanks for turning me onto this place Mx.
author: Barbara A.

description:
I've been to the Make-Out room, and I have yet to see anyone of a decent caliber making out there. I find this disappointing. I also find the bar itself to be a bit disappointing, for every time I go there, I usually end up annoyed in some way. The space itself is not bad, nice bar with dusty deer heads above, though the dusty streamers everywhere look a bit drab and lazy. Think, "post-apocalypse prom night in a bar". It is a typical bar/club, with the bar upfront, and the dance area/concert floor in the back. I have admittedly never seen a show there, but I have seen several random DJ sets there, nothing to write home to Mom about. 

I guess the thing that annoys me about the Make-Out room is the staff. In particular, the male bartender is pretty gruff (NO ENERGY DRINKS!) and one of the female bartenders there seems to hate you, even though she has never met you. I guess I came from work one time, and I wasn't dressed "hipster enough" or something, dressed in business casual. I swear to you that after she took my drink order, and after scoffing at how long it was taking me (all of 20 seconds to order for 5 people), I could swear she said something like "Somethin, somethin, f-cking yuppie..."  I didn't call her out on it, but I wish I did. I'm not 100% sure that is what she said either, but I am about 95% sure. I brushed it off and listened to the sub-par DJ, and then went to the half-empty dance floor feeling somewhat tainted for the night. I'm not even really a yuppie... well, maybe a little, but still... the music, every time I have been has been cookie-cuter house/electronica, or recent rap hits, neither of which I am too keen on.  

So, I go again, this time a month or two later (dressed in my normal, non-work clothes this time), and that same bartender was a bi.... was not nice again! Apparently because she has control of the alcohol, she gets to be rude to the customers. I ordered back-to-back drinks, and she scolded me for not ordering "all at once". Well... I wasn't finished with my drink 5 minutes ago, sorry. Fine then. You don't want my business. I'll take my friends elsewhere.

I'm sure its just her and her holier-than-thou-I'm-a-San-Francisco-hipster attitude that turned me off to the place, but you know what? The place wasn't that great to begin with. It's dusty, dim, with sub-par music (when I was there), though the drinks were fine. I've been there 4-5 times total, and each time I walk away thinking "meh"... 

If you're in the area, swing by and see for yourself. But I wouldn't recommend paying to get in, which we had to do once or twice.

**HEY YELP! Why was this review taken off the list of reviews for this business?**
author: Corey S.

description:
Whatever happened to that nasty mattress they used to have? Uh, scratch that, I should not care what rank end it met.
I saw Holly GoLightly here, too bad that was the only cool thing that ever happened here. Ok, I also saw Very Be Careful and danced my ass off. But then there are those times where I am supposed to be a good friend and see my friend's bands. Some of them are talented, some of them are not, so when we had to pay $8 to see some friends we didn't think that was cool we tried to work something out with the doorguy. We're like 'ok, these guys are our friends, but we don't pay $8 for many shows, let alone this one. (I think it was a Weds too) But we can't be dicks coz, well, they will be totally bummed. So if you can give us a deal, like 4 for 2 or something it would be the rad'. Well, he just looked at us like we'd escaped the mental ward. Clearly he didn't understand our dilemma, but ultimately he sure as hell didn't care. We had a drink and then one by one our friends had disappeared, but the band was on stage and you know they can't see shit with the lights in thier eyes so we left too.
author: Colleen B.

description:
the decor is hard to describe, but works in all the right ways. my usual string of local musicians plays this place quite often, so arriving early to snatch a good seat and sip on beer works nicely. a dark place, but the junior prom disco lighting keeps the mood up.

I've yet to catch anyone making out in this place though - so disappointing.
author: Darrell L.

description: I myself have never made out at the Make-Out Room, but if I did, it would be because of the red velvety curtains, totally Twin Peaks-y. Oh and it would be with Mike L.
author: Shannon V.

description:
if you want to go dancing, the price is right @ the make-out room.

on sat. nights is world music nights.. shake your booty to the beats from all over the earth!
author: Sheri N.

description: First star, happy hour till 10. Second star, delicious gin and tonics. Third star, delicious every other drink I've had there. And a fourth star for all the great events they host--from Iron Comic to LitPac. This place is a winning venue all-around
author: Megan K.

description: They book great shows here, but the space is a little awkwardly setup. The tables near the front and towards the side of the stage really take away a lot of much needed space. But, seeing Cloud Cult here is an experience I will never forget. The $3 Fat Tires weren't bad either...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Hadn't been in 3 years, but in the last month, have been to Mortified (www.getmortified.com) and www.writerswithdrinks.com here.   It's official-the MOR is my official location to spend my weekends pretending like I'm all literati and such, reminding me why the cost of living here is all worth it.  That alone sustains my strong review for the Make Out Room.  I should also add that the bartenders appear to pore with a heavy hand, meaning that I live up to my nickname of "Cheap Date" in record time.
author: Beth V.

description: Great staff, cold beer on tap. Super cool bands playing any night of the week. Occasionally a cover but usually going to a good cause. Laidback vibe and nice and dark.
author: Jerry M.

description: I've only been there a couple of times, but after the last time I finally figured out what the Make-Out Room reminded me off....dances in Junior High.  No joke.  That's not to say it can't be fun (if you are drunk or want to have a cheesy night).  However, the djs are the worst part.  They play some ok music, very nostalgic stuff, but they have no idea how to "spin".  Anyway, it's not a bad place, but not great either.
author: Amanda P.

description: Perhaps if I didn't get free drinks from knowing some of the DJs here, I wouldn't like this bar as much. It's very yuppy-ish, but I suppose I don't mind this. The music is good, but the crowd is kind of goofy. The drinks are STRONG. Two drinks and I'm on the floor - no joke.
author: Christine N.

description:
elbo room, boom boom room, make out room. i thought i'd been to this particular room, but i hadn't!

great decor, fun, quirky music, nice bartenders, and not too crowded on a friday eve. i danced with a couple dudes and gave out my number like mardi gras beads. that's a good night.
author: jean w.

description: Cheap drinks, great service as great as it can be in a dive bar.  I've been there for multiple events from Birthday Parties, Teenage Journal Readings on Love, and House/Alternative night.  The music has always been quite a mixture when I'm there.  The crowds have always been pleasant and it is not a "scene" just lotsa fun.
author: Diana L.

description: The make-out room has the strongest drinks I've ever tasted.  It feels like a dive bar but the drinks make this one of my favorite hang-out places in SF.  Depending on the night, though, it can get way overcrowded and loud.  If you're looking for something low-key during the weekdays, where you can get a bang for your buck, check out the make-out room
author: Yvonne C.

description: CLUB NEON is fun,dance floor gets loco in a good way,some good bands have played here,Friday night is booty jam night which I LIKE..a few blocks from my house. Bathroom line is ridiculous as fuck, ive heard the most inane banter known to man up in that piece
author: Lauren V.

description: Great place to drop in and sample a show, no matter the talent. I've bought Cds from some relatively unknown artists after the shows. Eclectic depending on the bands... there can be a good carney freakshow atmosphere one night, the next its a marina-crowd clean cut, then its some metal thrash. All welcome here. Good spot if you're solo.
author: brian s.

description: I love the Make-Out Room. Great vibe, cheap drinks, fun location. I've been a few times to see small indie bands, and I've always really enjoyed myself. With all the stars hanging on the ceiling and decorations galore, I kind of feel like I'm going to some crazy hipster prom. Neat!
author: Ava S.

description:
at first glance..i thought to myself..hmm..not really my kind of place granted i thought themovie theater announcement board was pretty cool. 

This was one of the first places i went to after moving to the mission a few months ago.

I was not a fan of the cover...i mean really five dollars to walk into a place called the Make-Out room(something i could without a room). Anyhow my best friend and i walk in, and i'm whisked away by the sound of Micheal jackson'sthriller playing, and i was loving the red decor and lighting..a prime a spot to "Make-out".

We take a seat at the bar and get a drink...then i notice bra on the hanging on the wall and i think to myself..thats not a very pretty bra! Moving on i order a drink and its way too strong i have to ask the bartender to add more juice or something to help keep my liver intact.

All and all, cooh place, i liked the music and i loved the DJ boothe, my friend and i danced the night away...however no " making out" for us.
author: Nia W.

description: always random in a good way. where the free-spirits go to make-out. if there's a cover, it's usually worth it. their heavy pours don't hurt either.
author: Jessica C.

description: Nice high ceiling, good bartenders, good drinks, and great performers.  I came here once to watch a clown show -- it was a blast.  Can get a bit too crowded for my taste on occasion, though.
author: Paul H.

description: I see all kinds of killer local bands at the Make-Out Room that I'll probably never see again.  The good side is there are plenty more great bands to replace them.  This is a great place.
author: matthew w.

description: Cool place to go and dance.  Grab a few friends and hang out one night, especially if it is one of their Theme nights.
author: Pele N.

description:
when club neon was at this dig i had a great time. fairly cheap drinks and a ton of alcohol without being too pukeworthy - i knocked off a star because there's something ALWAYS here, which in turn prompts a cover, which doesn't really allow for any true drinking time. i suppose it comes with the territory. i also saw a live show here, and the sound was very nice. the women's bathroom is also suprisingly clean for a mish haut. kudos!

weirdly enough, they don't believe in straws. i remember seeing this on someone's blog and going the next couple times after to check it out - it's true!
author: Jenz y.

description:
There's always something going on here, I'll give it that.

But with a name like the Make-Out Room, you'd expect a bit sexier decor. 

It's a good place for drinks...but understand it's more dive bar than lounge, so you don't get disappointed when you go, like I did.
author: Nicole R.

description: Ok this place was WHACK. There was no power in this place yesterday. The bathrooms were pitch black; they had a dim candle over the toilets to allow the ladies a guide to the pot. I was there to celebrate my cousin's 25th birthday.  After a while the power did come back. I felt kind of bad because she was under the impression that they were going to have a real DJ who played good music; what she got was a live band who actually played some pretty cool rock songs but was quickly replaced by this whack as DJ who played nothing but salsa. Well salsa-merngue- and some reggeaton mash-ups with bay area hyphy music.  Garbage sound unless you were heavily intoxicated by their well drinks. I ordered a "Make-Out  Margarita" which tasted like death- they might have even used tequila from a plastic bottle labeled tequila...it was disgusting! So after about 3 hours and due to insane starvation we left. Did i mention I had to pay $7 to get into this joint. Yeah it was not a good place and the crowd was way too ify. My cousin's friend got her clutch stolen as well. So have a plan B if you go here...it does help.
author: Yolanda O.

description: Totally eclectic and fun place for affordable drinks and unique music. The atmosphere is casual and it is small enough that you feel a part of what is going on on 'stage'. Great sidecars for $6- really cannot get much better than that! If you are looking for a place to be seen- this is not for you- if you are looking to dance and enjoy it- then this is for you. As for decor- it is cozy in winter and fun and funky in the summer.
author: Alicia A.

description:
Ive heard a lot of hype about The make out room so in celebration for my 21st birthday my friends and I decided to bar hop over there! 

We got there around 11pm, (no cover fee to get in which is a plus!) It was a bit crowded. The crowd was diverse and some were bad and trying to pick fights outside with my friends and I for some lame reasons (angry drunks i suppose...) 

Anyways the drinks were cheap and stiff bartenders were fast and attentive. 

It was a friday night. I wasn't a fan of the music at all. It was some weird african techno/ reggae/  salsa music. Wasnt danceable too (for me anyways). But after midnight a new DJ came on and played hip hop the beats were sweet and got me out on the dance floor!

The decor is unique, reminded me of a cheap middle school dance. (A large disco ball in the middle with streamers and stars hanging down everywhere)

The only downside is that there was only one restroom for women and there would always be a line of only a few people but they were kept clean!
author: morgan a.

description: when i was not yet savvy with san francisco night life, a first date told me he was taking me to the make-out room, which i thought was rather presumptuous. instead of what i painfully envisioned as something straight out of a middle school dance or that 70's show, the make-out room is actually a very fun, cool place with zero pre-pubescent teenagers tangled awkwardly on make-shift couches and hidden behind beaded curtains.  the music is hypnotic; i cannot say no to it. definitely a great place to dance the night away- a venue that encourages shamelessly practicing your salsa moves as opposed to dancing in closed-off circles to avoid the usual meat being marketed.  later i find myself wondering, among life's other big questions, how they got all of that silvery, shimmery, stalactite to stay put. but while i'm there it's like a time-warp. absolutely five stars worth of fun.
author: julia r.

description: Standing tough. She's looking at her curled hair boy, his greasy eyes - she beckons the words, "we'll spit from the hip when the going gets rough". A crotch mirrors its match, her gyrations pushing into him with nauseous aplomb - thrusting ripples through fleshy cheeks and crock-lipped smiles. The scene. Contextual abandonment would imply foreplay, neither wearing anything but a selection of finely considered undergarments. The room wears one hundred strong, skinny and sullen frowns - these kids weren't built to last. A pant-check is set up in the back corner, an assortment of blue jeans draping over its wrack. The red haired boy stands sideways with his Gothic love, her with the wanton display of arse. Big brutish bellowing flesh does its own dance, courteously abandoning her own bent leg trounce. Tongue-out lackeyed boys with sunken ambitions scurry around her orbit, bounding hands to her own - she simmers in their attention, eyes forever fixed on her red haired boy. He tells her he can never love her. His sentence neglecting conclusion. He can never love her enough.
author: Marc M.

description: was never a huge fan of this place. maybe i haven't been here enough, but something about this place ... i don't know ... maybe it's the sound ... it sucks for djing ... too muffled, etc. nothing jumps out at me. i'd rather be somewhere else than this place. i did see the "high dials" play here once. that was pretty rad.
author: James J.

description: i gotta 2 star it. i went last friday night and the place was fairly empty except for the 10 or so folks i came with. streamers and balloons were strung up like a bad prom in the valley. music vacillated between horrible, tolerable, and fun. its a little too dark to know if the person you are talking to is hot or not...a bad place to make that mistake. (much prefer wish or beauty bar)
author: Hilary H.

description:
my favorite bar in san francisco. not just because i'm poor and five dollar pbr pitchers is a hot deal, but because the dj nook on the stage is an old dresser, and because they have really incredible super lo-fi light tricks on the walls, and because the tenders are real nice and friendly. 

the music events are great too. i guess if there's a drawback to this place it's that like all mission bars it becomes oppressively busy come the weekend.
author: jesse m.

description: randomly walked into this bar w/ my date on a tuesday night and had an absotively great time. 60s soul definitely set the right mood that night...aHHhh soookie soookie now
author: Del O.

description: Had a really decent, solid experience here over the weekend.  The four stars rating says it all: Yay! I'm a fan.
author: L. Renee D.

description: they charged a cover, which was a bad start because covers in general are irksome to me and in retrospect it was in no way worth it. (and it wasn't even a live band.) i had fun because i brought a lot of friends, some of whom are good dancers and also find joy, as i do, in getting up on the stage after a few house drinks and demonstrating their ridiculous multi-cultural dance moves. as for the music, half of it was great, half of it was a parody of saturday night fever - style mariachi. and many of the transitions were awkward and disjunct. i did, however, enjoy the decorations hanging from the ceiling. the drink menu was different, although one drink a friend was trying to foist on me was a syrupy mess. (i hate too-sweet drinks.) in case you're like me, be sure to ask the bartender about the drinks because many of the names are ambiguous. the end.
author: Josie K.

description: when i get drunk here, i look at the ceiling and pretend i am in outer space.
author: Oleya P.

description: no words can express my deep love and almost perverted infatuation with this place!
author: Ranch S.

description: just got back from a show here.  my review is a little biased b/c halfway through the show, i became violently allergic to something in that space (i have no idea what it was), and i'm still not completely over the sniffle i acquired :(.  that said, it seems like it would a nice chill bar to hang out in during the week.  there's nothing strikingly special though.  the stage was good for small groups (or stand up type stuff like what i was there for), and although i was seated at a booth near the door, i could see the stage just fine.
author: Roshni R.

description: my girlfriend was meeting some of her friends here so i went with her and wow..........all i have to say is this place is interesting (not in a nice way)!!!!!!
author: junie k.

description: go here when there's no cover and its cool. when you get a shot they're its huge. i think it was served in a wheel barrel, it was gnarly. everyone that i came with was hammered. a buddy of mine cartwheeled into the pool tables. there's normally a weird band playing and you can play pool.
author: Mike L.

description:
you walk into a divey place thats been thrown back to the 80's prom...very urban hipster and strange at the same time. i'm just not into the urban underground hip-hop beats that the DJ was spinning & whats with serving drinks without straws?? i know they're bad for the environment but sharing "not so clean" drinkware is even more gross.

and bouncer had the nerve to charge us cover after 12:30am.
only +1 extra star b/c the shots they pour are bigger than other places
just not my kind of place after all.
author: Yolanda L.

description: Great place in the mission for a drink, atmosphere and some early-evening entertainment. Nicest doorpeople of any bar. Not much in the way of food, bring it in from the Torta shop across the street.
author: John W.

description: i came here with my cousin after being at berretta and i have to say, it's so random inside it a charming way. we went on a quieter night when nothing particular was going on other than a dj who's booth was a repurposed vintage dresser (cute). all the crazy decor and colors makes for a fun place to just go and check out. there was enough going on for it to feel fun but not so much that we were squeeeeezed to death.
author: anna g.

description: My favorite place in SF... it's essentially a garage sale with a DJ... and REALLY stiff liquor drinks. The people-watching alone makes it well-worth the $5 cover on weekends.
author: Abby P.

description: usually some cool music in here. you can sneak in a tall can or 40oz if you are sneaky and the dance floor is dark so they cant see you sippin. usually cost about 5 bucks to get in. try it out.
author: Wats C.
